description:
Pasquale's is one of my family's favorite pizza spots in SF. There's nothing extravagant or hipster about Pasquales--it's just an overall good pizza. We always order the cheese pizza and the mushroom, salami, and garlic pizza. (Garlic on pizza, so good!!) 

I have also come here to eat with groups of friends or on dates on occasion and both are a pleasant time. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is casual.
author: Sydney G.

description:
Hard to really state why 2-Stars other than just a meh experience all-around.

I have been probably a couple dozen times in the past few years and have always felt this way but not so much as to finally pull the trigger on this review...until now.

Just meh.

Under seasoned bland ingredients.  Soggy pasta.  Probably less than decent quality meats as they certainly seem chewy enough at times.  Bread that is worthless as a parsley sprig on a plate.

To top it off, it is not as if the in-house experience makes up for any of it.  All you can hear is the sound of the machines and the general hum of other people eating.  It is actually depressing.  I have no idea how employees make it through their shifts.

You can count on bland food and too-much of it.  Terrible, no, but it is pretty much just a meal.
author: Chris D.

description:
Their pizza is amazing! I don't think they have a bad pizza, but by far my favorite one is the Parma. It has Alfredo sauce, chicken, bacon, and green onions. It tastes like the pizza version of a Costco chicken bake, which also tastes amazing. My friends who don't like the chicken bake even like this pizza.

The only thing I've ordered from this place that kind of disappointed me was their fried calamari. It had absolutely 0 seasoning. I don't know if my order was a mistake or that's how it normally tastes. Even just adding salt would be better.
author: Bowen W.

description:
Okay pizza place in Inner sunset!

A group of 8 came here on Tuesday night around 5:30. We got seated right away and we ordered 2 XL pizzas (Medusa, Seafood, Chicken Speical and Beef Mexicali).
Medusa - okay pesto sauce based pizza 3/5
Seafood - everyone picked this pizza as their favorites! It was pretty good! 5/5
Chicken Special - I thought chicken was too dry and flavorless. My least favorite pizza 1/5 
Beef Mexicali - there were lots of beef and jalapeño. If you love jalapeño, order this! If you don't, skip this! 3/5

I always pass this place by and finally got to try this place! Overall it was okay! Pizza crust was thinner than I thought! I prefer thin crust so it was great. Service was mediocre. My favorite out of all was Seafood pizza! Other ones were so so to me.

I don't think I will be coming back because I have had better pizza in SF. But this place is good for large party because of its huge portion!
author: Clare L.

description:
Very tasty. $6 for a personal one topping pizza is a steal. The pizza was made fresh. I was skeptical to dine here due to some of the recent reviews. 

Upon entry I was quickly greeted and given time to cruise the menu. I was shocked by all of the food choices, actually I was slightly overwhelmed. I went in for pizza so I decided to curb my enthusiasm for various Italian dishes and stick to my plan. 

The pizza had the right amount of sauce and cheese. The crust was think and slightly crispy but had enough flexibility to not be stiff like a board. I finished the whole thing in one sitting. 

If you're looking for a quick cheap bite this is a nice place to go.
author: Ty S.

description:
This is my neighborhood pizza joint and I've been visiting this place since I was five years old! I can recall all the Volleyball team dinners, dinners with family, and the Friday night deliveries to my door. Fast forward to present day and I've brought my friends and fiancé to this spot. We've even ordered to-go and brought the pizza down the street to Yancy's Bar. 

My favorite orders:
Spaghetti a la carbonara
Sausage and onion pizza 

Nostalgia may play a part in why I am giving them five stars, but see for yourself and I'm pretty sure you'd leave satisfied.
author: Briana H.

description: We've come here a handful of times and every time is delicious. Their salads and pizza are good and the service is quick. Beer selection leaves me wanting more but the wine is good. This place has strong family ties.... my fiancé's Dad came here after day one of his bar exams back in the 70's. Anyway, come here if you want good pizza with friendly service in a super cute neighborhood with lots of shops!
author: Angela T.

description: I have to give it to them.  The pizza is actually quite good (5 Stars). I grew up in Manhattan in New York City & have had my share of pizza since childhood.  The crust, the cheese, the sausage, the pepperoni are all on point (did not do the anchovies if that is on the menu because, as a kid, no one did the anchovies).  So why to 3 Stars?  The price point is high for pizza and the staff could be both nicer and more efficient.  The hardware is not exactly table cloth either.  If I come back (I will, infrequently, but I will) I will optimize for the price to pie size to number of people in the party ratio and have to ignore the quality of the staff.
author: Leung T.

description: I went here with a group of 11 people around 10:30pm to stuff ourselves before going to the bar nearby. We ordered one XL Meat Eater pizza and one XL Great Western pizza. Both pizzas were delicious! Most of my group favored the Great Western pizza more, but all of us still liked the Meat Eater pizza. Since we ordered 2 extra large pizzas, we had a difficult time finishing it. I'd recommend ordering only 2 large pizzas instead of 2 extra large if you're coming with a group of 11.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Friday night Pizza!!  Got seated right away and ordered beer and medium pizza. Sausage and Mushroom!
Wasn't too long and got a hot and delicious pizza. Lots of cheese!  Good amount of Sausage mushrooms.
author: Trey W.

description: Recommend by a good friend who lives in SF. His wife grew up dining there. A true home made style of pizza. Freshly made too. Fresh salad was crisp and yummy. Love the relaxed home style atmosphere. Pizza was not skimpy or overly filled with to much ingredients. It was prepared with just the right amount of flavor. Delicious yet filling! Highly recommended if you want a great pizza and an easy going atmosphere.
author: B K.

description: Ordered a personal pesto really good....wait time was pretty decent. I love it. I went home and added my own sun dried tomatoes on it. Friendly staff . Given it was outside lands week they did a great job on service time
author: Selby C.

description:
Came here at 3 pm on a Thursday. Super dead, which is usually nice, but there was no kind of music or anything. I just had to listen to myself eat. 

I ordered a fettuccine Alfredo with one meat ball. It was the equivalent to something that I could've gotten at Olive Garden. I really just played myself. 

I ordered garlic bread with pesto which was just really plain and not even worth it. The food was so plain that I didn't even try to finish it because I was sick of it after a few bites. 

HonesTly if Cybelle's didn't close for a 1 hour break from 3-4 I would've been over there and had something tastier.
author: Cynthia M.

description: This is our TO GO PLACE when my hubby and I want a delicious american style pizza and we are in SF area. While waiting for our pizza, we had the chance to meet the owner who shared with us a bit of  their story. Open since the late 50's, Pasquale pizzeria represents a real institution in the neighborhood,  a lot of returning customers literally grown up with their delicious pizza. Still now, the place is frequented mostly by neighbors ,many of them families, and the staff seem to know all them.  The pizza itself is very light and crispy, toppings are generous and prices are more than reasonable, almost unbelievable for the quality and the quantity that you are actually buying. I'm also always very pleased by the relaxed, friendly and informal atmosphere of a classic mom and pop restaurant. Our favorite pizza is the sausage and mushroom, with the perfect amount of sauce and cheese, but honestly, I had the vegetarian once, and it was delicious too!
author: Michelle C.

description: Half-half large pizzas - two of these is enough for 6 people. We got seafood, pesto, chicken, jalapeño. My favorite was seafood-chicken- jalapeños- pesto in this order. Crust is not thick and baked just about right. Ingredients taste fresh. Pizzas come out ~15min after order has been placed. They come out super hot so be careful not to bite on it right away (I burned my palate and skin peeled off and suffered for the next few days). This restaurant is nothing fancy so giving rating solely on quality of food and service. Their pizzas are delicious and taste pretty healthy, not that oily. Good for casual eat out with friends and family with couple of Italian beers.
author: Adel A.

description: $5 personal size pizza is where it's at! You order and they make it fresh for you, can't beat the price. If I am in the mood for something a little more, I love their fresh clams with pasta in white wine sauce. They sure don't skimp on the pasta or the clams. Another favorite is the Frutti Di Mare pasta. I have also dined in once with colleagues and ordered large size pizzas, salads, and apetizers. Their chocolate cake dessert is bomb as well! Joe the owner is great and have been making pizzas since he was a little kid. He comes out talk to customers and make sure they have a great time dining. Great service and food all around!
author: Annie L.

description:
I wanted pasta so bad. I was at Yancy's. And so, me and my cousin Syd walked down the street. We ordered food for everyone. I didn't really bother looking at the menu. The first thing that caught my eye was meat ravioli so I choose that. 

Verdict: that ravioli was so good. I downed it like there wasn't going to be a next meal.
author: Lilian L.

description: Great eatery!  Pizza was fantastic and the steak Caesar salad was delicious!  Service was great will definitely go back next time in the City!
author: Catie L.

description: I don't live in SF but every time I'm passing through I make sure to come here it's absolutely delicious I was just craving it and live to far and got so hungry so I decided to leave a review haha
author: Valentino G.

description:
I grew up in the Sunset, and so did my parents. My family has been eating here for decades. We used to go to both locations back in the day--the Sloat location was usually less crowded, and you could get food more quickly--but at some point the service at Sloat got sloppy and their pizzas went downhill. From then on, we only went to Irving.

I love the House Special at Pasquale's; my wife is a fan of the pineapple-and-onion combo, which has also won me over. I've had the takeout phone number memorized since I left for college, when on trips home I would call from the airport so that pizza would be ready for pickup by the time I got into the city.

I've taken out-of-town friends here, partly for the pizza, partly for the ambience. I lived in New York for two years and loved the pizza there, but there's just something about Pasquale's. Some of it involves ingredients: the crust and juiciness of the pizzas, the huge family-style pastas, the pretty good house wines. But it's also the atmosphere: the smell of Italian goodness even when you're standing outside, the hustle and bustle, and the great neighborhood, surrounded by bars and the park and coffee shops. It's a good, old-fashioned Italian pizza place amid a city of brand-new, shiny, character-less restaurants that seem to try too hard. That character here helps overcome sometimes verrrrrrrrry slow service.

The pizza is at its best when it's steaming hot (although it's also pretty good cold the next day). It's also a great place to go for birthday parties  and other events (my family has done its holiday party here on a couple of occasions). It's not too expensive, and you get a ton of pasta when you order family style. You can also order food to take over to Yancy's pub down the block to watch sports!
author: Matt C.

description: I really like this place but had a shockingly bad experience with a to go order tonight. I called ahead and my order was ready when I arrived. I opened the pizza box when I got home and was greeted with the saddest, messiest excuse for a pizza I've ever spent $20 on. I'll probably go to Patxis from now on and it's a shame!
author: Amy B.

description: This place has been a family staple for yearsssss. And tonight, it was quiet literal! We found staples in our cheesey garlic bread! When my mother called to complain the manager did not seem to care much. Very disapponiting as we have been supporting Pasquale's for atleast 30+ years! Added photos as well since the manager was not willing to look at them.
author: Samantha V.

description: My pizza was deeeelicious! Ordered vegetarian  pizza from the menu and added beef. Pizza came out perfered. Dough was little crispy and crunchy when you bite but soft inside. Sliced cheese they put covered the whole pie. Beef was so tasty not just ground meat with no flavor. I rarely go to the same place twice but this place is on my very limited go to places list! Even my shirt liked the pizza.
author: Ricky G.

description:
This place is a landmark of the inner sunset.  It's been here forever and will always be here.  Look,  if I'm wanting to have the most amazing pizza in the world,  I doing come here.... but they're open late and their food is reasonably priced. 

Appetizers: garlic bread with cheese is where it's at.  For $4.45, the amount of deliciousness you get (and hella calories) is a sweet deal! I also like their mixed green salad with blue cheese,  again for only $5.54!!!!

LATE NIGHT: Check it,  they don't have individual slices.... but they have personal size!!!! It tastes so much better than a slice. 

In terms of toppings, I highly recommend the Chicken Special: you get charbroiled chicken,  green onions, garlic and tomatos. The vegetarian option is also freaking delish, but it's a tiny bit watery. 

Last note: as a diet coke aficionado, I love the free refills
author: Arman J.

description:
4 star place! Amazing seafood pasta

Never eat the pizza much but I've heard it's good
author: Lauren N.

description: Their pizza is a great option for late night drunchies. Especially because it's one of the few places open past midnight. The pizza itself is a little overpriced but very good. If you have time to sit in their seated area, their pasta is pretty good. I got the baked ziti with chicken, mushrooms, and Alfredo sauce. It was very cheesy and heavy, but it was delicious!!
author: Kristine C.

description:
This is probably going to be my first and last time at Pasquale's. My coworker was raving to me about how good it was, and I thought okay fine it's her turn to choose a place to eat. We got here and there was actually no one waiting in line to be seated. It took 5 minutes for us to seated. No one acknowledged us. Finally, we got seated and it took fifteen minutes to finally place an order. I don't get it. I had to get the attention of a girl and she said someone will be right with us. As if she hasn't been going to all the tables around us. 

My coworker and I were pretty hungry, so we both ordered an entree, shared an appetizer, and did half half on a small pizza. The plates came out one at a time which was really annoying. We didn't get our bread and butter until we got the pizza. By then, I was super pissed. The popcorn shrimp we ordered was just okay. The dish came with cocktail sauce, and it didn't pair really well with the shrimp. My cheese ravioli with pesto was pretty good but I didn't finish it. The pizza, since we split half half, we got charged for each different topping. The small pizza ended up being around $25. The pizza I got Parma, which I did enjoy because there wasn't any tomato sauce. However, it was so salty. The other reviewers are right. I had to drink so much freaking water. 

The experience couldn't get any worse until we had to wait 15 minutes for our waiter to come give us our check. Although he was really nice, it seemed like he was a busboy and not really a waiter. Which leads me to say, why wouldn't the other waiters help us? They went to ALL surrounding tables except for ours. It's safe to say, I will never be back to Pasquale's.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
This is not the average Italian restaurant you would expect....when you enter it's run-down, dirty, and not so pleasing on the eyes. I almost would describe it as a hole-in-the-wall type place, except that it's a large space. It will get crowded on weekends at dinnertime, so expect a wait for dine-in. Yes, it is a popular neighborhood place because I don't think there's another pizza/Italian place near.

The service was alright at the beginning, but it got busy and it pretty much tapered off after we got the food.

The bread and butter is alright, but this time it wasn't warm like before. The pasta dishes are average, they aren't presented in the most edible looking way, but it's fine. 

The pizza however was on the salty side...with pepperoni and mushroom, it could have been the pepperoni, but I also think the red sauce was a bit salty too. It wasn't too salty, but it is noticeable...but I would rather it have flavor than none.

The portions are okay for the price. It is also not too expensive here. This isn't the best Italian or pizza place ever to me, but it will satisfy that craving.
author: Spencer H.

description: I have no clue why this place is at all highly rated.  The only reason I have gone there is because someone else suggests it.  The service is kind of slow.  You would think the food would compensate, but not really. The pizza,  which should be the highlight of the menu,  is bland.  There is way too much cheese.  So much so that it overwhelms anything else.  It's also too chewy.  Both times I have had the pizza and I can barely get through a slice
author: Jerry C.

description: The first time I came here I absolutely loved their pizza. We recently moved back into the city and this was our first stop since we didn't have our kitchen unpacked. I feel like the pizza has changed. The dough is now super thick and chewy but a tad too much and super saucy. I love tomato sauce but not where it is drowning my pizza. The pasta was super bland and needed a lot of chili flakes and Parmesan cheese. That is also my other gripe, fake Parmesan cheese. Please please give the patrons freshly grated real Parmesan cheese not the canned stuff. Quick semi cheap meal while moving but I don't think I'd come back here when I am craving pizza again. The only reason I have this place 3 stars was for the service. Service is great and the staff is really nice. Quality of pasta is meh. I could have gone to Whole Foods hot food bar and gotten better for cheaper. Pizza needs work. It used to be so good!! What happened? It used to be light dough, perfect amount of sauce and generous toppings. I used to crave this place and drive up from the Peninsula area just to eat here.
author: Jen C.

description:
Heard so much buzz about this pizzeria. 
Ordered 3 specialty pizza.  Portions are huge. A medium is like a large. So if you're a part of 3-4 a medium would be 

Sunset 3/5 pretty basic.. not much to say. 
Pompeii 1/5 SALTY! One slice had me chugging my water and soda cup. 
House special 3/5 salty. 

Had a soda but server never came back to refill water or soda. 

If you love salty pizza come here. If you love being dehydrated from the salty pizza eat here. 

Service was below basic.
author: Kent B.

description:
We hadn't been back to the Irving Street Pasquales store for many years and the experience was NOT a good one.  Our server, Mita, was a rather spunky and vocal person.  

We asked her if we could have our pies less soggy by draining the pies during the cooking process.  She asked which pizzeria would drain the excess juices for us and we told her Cybelles.  She told us to go Cybelles instead!  Customer Service at best.

When the pies came, we were not "Wowed or Overwhelmed" by the Unbountiful amount of toppings.  The pie was crispy from the draining process.  Compared to their Sloat Street restaurant, there is NO comparison.  The Sloat store drained our pies without any lip service and the pies are crispy and served an abondonza of toppings.

We won't be coming back here anytime soon.  The limited parking was also a negative feature if this location.  So if want to be insulted coupled with mediocre pie.... this place is for you!
author: Dennis Y.

description:
Pretty great local pizza place that stays open late! The perfect gem of inner sunset. 

I came here because my friend was craving pizza for dinner. The crust was pretty good and the sausage toppings were great. I like how they offer multiple sizes of pizza, so you can get the right amount for however many other friends your with. 

Service was also great, even when it's kinda busy. It's not the best pizza I've ever had, but a good, decent place with solid pizza quality.
author: Stephanie K.

description: Really tasty comfort food. A little on the greasy side, but overall I've enjoyed everything I've ordered from them. Also a super speedy take out option!
author: Sarah N.

description:
I've eaten here a ton of times, from when my parents used to being me here when I was a kid to now with my own kiddo. The pizza is really great. Fresh ingredients, full slices of real cheese (not too thick) and good red or pesto sauce.  The pasta and sandwiches are good too and well priced for what you get (enough for 2 meals).  

I'm glad there are still paces like this around where a family can go for a casual meal and just relax and eat good food for a reasonable price.  Not sure what a lot of the other reviewers are looking for from a neighborhood pizza joint.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Food is Great, but service is lousy. Ate there today 7/6/2018. Waitress was in a bad mood. Really awfull experience if you eat there.And when you call to order to go, simple requests not gladly given with an attitude. Change your food containers to leakproof!

,   Go to school and take a class on " Good  Customer Service101" Been living in the inner sunset since 1969.  Suggestion to the owner of pasquales, your food is great but you need to pay attention to good service, and friendly attention to ALL customers not just select who they want to be friendly to. Real disappointed with unfriendly attitude of the waitress. WILL NOT EAT THERE AGAIN!!!!@
author: C B.

description: I didn't appreciate the flies in the dining room. The food was just ok. Sorry, but that's my truth.
author: Lili L.

description: Came here over the weekend with some friends before stopping by Yancy's. It's Saturday night and you're hungry and what's better than a pizza?! Paquale Pizza is literally few doors away from Yancy's so you can order to go and bring it over to Yancy's for some drinks. Service is great, the workers are nice. It wasn't too busy which was good. We ordered the large Meat Eater pizza. It had tons of options of meat from pepperoni, beef, sausage and salami. The large pizza is definitely good for 6 people and I was filled just by eating one slice. The wait for the pizza only was about 15 minutes. I definitely would love to come back and try other pizzas next time!
author: Monica W.

description:
The 5 stars is for great customer service and good food!

It was super busy when I picked up my order, like really busy; but they got me in and out. I got home and it was the wrong order! I gave them a call and the lady apologized and let me keep the food I took by accident.

The food was delivered ~15min later. Thanks for taking care of me and being so accommodating.
author: Dan R.

description: Great homemade style pizza. I had the madusa and it was delicious. You can taste it's made with fresh ingredients.
author: Claudia H.

description:
When someone mentions a pizza place they like, I must try it! My friend lives around this neighborhood and told me he loves this place for their seafood pizza. Obviously, I've got to try this. Its pizza... and seafood? not what i usually order but .... I'm open

Anyways, i walk in here and i thought it was one of those pizza places where you order and leave.. but then i turn the corner and nahh theres this little doorway that leads to a nice room with tables. Dont let that first little room trick you!

We sat down and got the garlic pesto bread (hands down the best thing ever made) and the seafood pizza! Usually seafood anything is a little more pricier than other items, but this place its the same. Everything came out in a timely manner and freshh!

The garlic pesto bread was everything you thought i could be and mooore. HELLA GOOD
The seafood pizza was ....very seafoody LOL. the clams threw me off a bit, but the baby shrimp and tomatoes were good. If you are not used to seafood in your pizza, it will take some time to get used to taste/smell of it. But everything was cooked very well. Crust was crunchy too
author: Vivian H.

description: Just an absolute gem of a pizza.  Every time I'm here, I try something new.  The food is phenomenal. Well done!
author: Sam D.

description:
The first time I came here for dinner, I'd rate this 4 stars because the whole meal was so delicious. I got the baked ziti with chicken and mushroom and it was so tasty that when deciding on a place for lunch months later, I just had to come back for more ziti. However, I don't know if it was a change in chefs or management or if they're at a slump during lunch time, but my second experience was far from 4 stars worthy.

This time my baked ziti was a bit gritty now. Everything taste about the same, but now the sauce had some sandy consistency to it mixed in and it was really distracting. Was this from a powder or a jar? 

Additionally, the bread we got at the beginning was cold! After finishing out first loaf, we asked for a fresher batch and the server seemed a bit offended and brought out a new loaf piping hot, but nearly charred. 

Finally, our server was just so lifeless and rude. I'm sorry if you hate working here, but don't ruin my experience because of it! He never checked up on us, was never available, and was difficult to communicate with. We had to get help from another much younger waiter who was very nice! I wish I could've tipped him instead! It wasn't even like the place was busy so our waiter had little excuse. 

I still give this place two stars because i still enjoyed my ziti even if it was a bit disappointing this time, and because I enjoyed my first experience here a lot. I would've given it one star if my second experience was my only. I MIGHT come back again someday.
author: Edmund L.

description:
We cannot figure this place out. The pizza is sublime one one day, with a great blend of of sauce, cheese, and toppings. Other days it is clear that the pizza chef just phoned it in. 

We don't love the pasta--we find it is bland and the sauce is rather dull. But the loaded potatoes are randomly delicious. 

In short, each trip (for my wife and I, at least) is a random guess.
author: Jon L.

description: Delicious crispy crust pizza! One of the best pizza places I've eaten at!
author: Elyse J.

description: I truly do think the food here is fantastic.  However, the delivery service is awful.  Because the food is so good, I keep going back...and they have screwed my order up so many times without a scintilla of accountability that I am refusing to ever order from them again.  The frequently get the order wrong and even more frequently forget to add any extras you may request (e.g. a cream sauce instead of marinara or parmesan cheese).  When you call to let them know they messed up, no matter who you get on the phone, they always insist that it was you who messed up and didn't tell them correctly.  They have never once offered to make it right.  I used to live around the corner and would go all the time.  Since I moved and try to get delivery, I've seen an entirely different side.  If you're walking in, go for it.  If you're ordering delivery, I recommend you look elsewhere.
author: Wes M.

description: Crispy sourdough pizza crust cooked to perfection. Chicken Parm sandwich that could feed an army. Chopped Italian salad wasn't chopped but hey, it was still delicious. We fed a group of 10 people for 100 bucks with pizza sandwiches and salad. Everyone was stuffed and raved about how great the pizza crust was. I've been a fan for a long time and I will continue to be a fan as long as the pizza dough stays so crunchy and thin. Delicious.
author: Roxie B.

description: If i could give this place zero stars I would. I asked the girl at the counter to split our bill into 3. You'd think that she would split it accordingly to what we all ordered but instead she decided to charge us all the same amount. I asked her if my pizza and drink were really $16 because I know it would have come out to $20. She gives me this snarky remark like "you asked me to split the bill into 3 $40 divided by 3 is $16. I can't believe someone would be left in charge of the cash register if they don't even know how to split a bill correctly. Has she never gone out to Denny's or any other sort of restaurant? Never coming back again.
author: Juan C.

description:
SERVICE: Overall pretty good. I work late on some days in the week so when I decide to come here for a late dinner, I usually get the small Asian as my waitress. I give props to anyone who can wait a table past 10pm with a glowing smile and personality! Also, I love the warm bread with butter and parmesan that gets served to every table. Classy touch. 

FOOD: Their smallest pizza can still feed two people generously. They have a bunch of interesting combinations but what I was most impressed with was the flavor behind their vegetarian options. I have been to more reputable Italian restaurants before with lack-luster veggie pizza options. Lately, however, I've been most interested in their pasta selections. If it's your first time here, I'd recommend the chicken and mushroom penne. When they say "mushroom marinara", it's not marinara with mushrooms sprinkled in. You can really detect the fungal aromas in the sauce. I also just realized how unappetizing that sounds but I'm too far along to press the 'backspace' on my keyboard now. Moving on! 

ATMOSPHERE: Meh. The tables have plastic covers on them, the carpet is dirty, and the atmosphere is...well....as you'd expect a late-night joint to be. With that being said, you can witness the pizza magic happening the moment you walk through the door and see all the fresh ingredients being put into your pie so that's comforting! Besides, if you're here at 10pm like me, you probably will not be caring much about the atmosphere anyway. Just GET THAT CHICKEN ALFREDO ZITI INTO MUH BELLY!
author: Greg Y.

description:
The eponymous old school pizza joint lives here. They need ten of these in Bay Area. 

This place is open late at night and is not all that busy during the middle of the day and there's good parking nearby if you nowhere
author: Randall W.

description: If I could give it zero stars I would. Good service is non existent. Sandwiches are garlic and nothing else. Couldn't even split the bill correctly.
author: Edgar C.

description: This is our new favorite pizza place. We just moved to the Bay Area and we set out in search of great pizza. After trying a couple, someone recommended Pasquale's. Their recommendation has forever changed the course of our SF living experience. They are quick, the pizza is fantastic, and their prices are decent.
author: Lucy M.

description:
I seen another post about someone asking If Pasquale's changed owners..?? I was wondering the same thing or why was my pizza dough thin with a thin amount of cheese?? I been going here with my Grandpa since I was a little girl & to bring my fiance for a Double Date with our great friends IS TOTAL CRAP. The SERVERS (a female with a ponytale on a tuesday night) who said "I hadnt been notified to serve your table" when I had seen her look over & I had waived. COMPLETELY IGNORED MY HAND. Waiting For our Drinks to arrive , 3 differnt people came out to serve us our DRINKS, ALL at seperate times & still forgot our waters. Not to mention it was hot a day!
I recemond Not to come if your looking to put a good tip down because the servers need training & better hygene .
THIS PLACE IS NOT WHAT IS USED TO BE. :(
*wasnt a packed night*
author: Miss M.

description: This restaurant is a neighborhood gem. It is family owned and humbly run. The food is delicious always. Chicken dore is one of my favorites, but you also can't go wrong with any pizza or pasta. The hassle of finding parking in the area is totally worth it!!
author: Antonella D.

description:
This place is really run down. It's old, there's a weird smell, and everything is peeling.  The carpet looks like it's from the 60s. When we came in, we were the only ones at the restaurant. But it was lunch time on a Saturday. We just figured most people get their pizza delivered. 

Pizza took forever to come out...and it wasn't good. Soggy and salty. Waiter never brought our drinks but did give us water. Cups were plastic and looked dirty. I guess there is a reason why it was so. empty. 

Too many good places to ever come back.
author: Carol C.

description: Call had a order deliver. It came around 8:00p.m. Pizza was over cook ,hard crust,hard center. Chicken wind was over ,hard as rock! I call yesterday to tell them and the girl just hang up! Wow poor customer services! Some day my husband call and she said did you order it like that? NO! She make you feel like it's all fault! And all she thanks for letting us know! It look like they LOST A GOOD CUSTOMER! Bad customer service!
author: Marie W.

description:
My family and I are regulars here. We sit in the same spot, have the same waitress, order the same food, and come on the same day. 

We always order an extra large pizza with linguisa, garlic, mushrooms, and sausage (thin crust). I highly recommend this. 

We sometime order the spaghetti or the lasagna. Both are really good. 

Mita (the waitress) is the best! She is always cheerful and sociable. She always has a smile on her face. It's a pleasure seeing her every time we come here.
author: Mariah V.

description: Umm if you don't mind standard pizza this place is close to gg Park . The staff is friendly but doesn't seem to understand that tossing pizza plates onto a metal surface is super loud for the customers who chose to dine in.
author: elizabeth m.

description:
I came here before going to California academy of science.  We parked in the park and walked over here. Pretty close to the park. That was Saturday 7 pm but we found a table easily.
We ordered medium size pizza with mushrooms and sausage. It fed 7 ppl. Pretty big. The taste is not super good but good enough. Traditional American pizza and I feel nothing special but the location and service was good enough. Convenient place.
author: Nazuki Y.

description: This place is way too expensive. Why are two large pizzas 60 bucks. The large is pretty big but I could've gotten 6 Dominos pizzas instead.
author: Noelle L.

description: Not sure how a regular pizza looks as we ordered with extra cheese. It was a good pizza that could have used better olives on top - - - black olives just do not add much flavor to the pie. The delivery was fast which made everyone happy.
author: Jim H.

description:
What a pizzeria should be my personal favorite deals are the personal pizzas.

You can get a combo or one of their specials for $6.00 !! That's a steal !!
author: Anthony N.

description: Good pasta & good pizza. Fast & always super tasty! They're personal pizzas are my favorite, they just always hold up better than the larger sizes but overall just a great restaurant with good food. The staff is super friendly except for the lady I literally just got off the phone with. I'm happy you guys are open on Memorial Day, but the person y'all have taking orders over the phone obviously is not because she was flat-out rude. She would ask me all the usual questions a person does when taking a pizza order but wouldn't listen to ANYTHING I was saying, & then would proceed to talk to me like I'm a complete idiot. I will always show my local small businesses love, but jeez lady-- lighten up & don't be so mad at the world-- you need to realize your bad mood is contagious girl!
author: Celine L.

description: Always yummy and never unsatisfied.  Best place for Sunday family dinner.  Crowded but worth the wait.
author: Ben L.

description: Excellent Pizza & pasta dishes & Love the pesto cheese garlic bread..heaven! Great anti-pasta salad as well. Great Neighborhood place and love to see Joe carrying on the traditions!!
author: Joni D.

description: They are always on time with delivery and have the best prices I can find in SF. The pizza is not anything fancy, but it's done well and the flavor is good. Only thing I can say is sometimes the crust isn't crispy enough for me.
author: Shannon H.

description: Great service! Good pizza had it delivered,  in the time frame quoted also very polite,   DEFINATLY will order from them again.
author: Diana P.

description:
This is San Francisco's best kept secret for quality dining and service. Located on the corner of Irving they have the option to order to go or dine in with a large seating area.

All the food I tried is delicious, fresh quality, and made to order. The pizzas are my favorite; I'm stuck between the garlic chicken and barbecue western
author: Mel L.

description: One of the few restaurants in the Sunset that is open late. Probably the cheapest beer in the area as well. Staff was very friendly.
author: 0 R.

description: They have, in my opinion, the best pizza and wings in all of SF. The thin crust NYC style pizza is amazing, and better than Escape From NY's, imo. Also, their wings have FANTASTIC crispy skin, not soggy nonsense. They deliver quickly, too. We love Pasquale's!! Thanks guys for continuing to make amazing pizza and wings!
author: V. C.

description:
Family friendly places are a win in my book. Family friendly with wine even more so. 

Super homey and lax vibe. They had those cushioned but wipe-able table covers that reminded me of my tia's kitchen table. I felt like it would have looked not all that different 20 years ago.

I was actually meaning to get just a slice but we ended up having much needed sit-down before taking a lap around the neighborhood.

Families, friends, and people who were either on a date or a super non-descript business meeting. 

Service was fast, friendly, and super accommodating. It was totally like being at a back-home pizza place. We're already making plans to go back to try some of their other stuff.
author: Loli L.

description:
Food is a 5 - everything was delicious. We ordered:
1. Small House Special pizza: 6 decently sized thin slices and it was probably the best thing we got (5 stars)
2. Veal Milanese: Very tasty veal with delicious crust, generous portion. Vegetables and pasta on the side were what you'd expect to be there on the side of a giant delicious piece of meat (5 stars for veal, 3 stars for the accompaniments)
3. Calamari: Nicely/lightly fried calamari with lemon and cocktail sauce. What you'd expect from good calamari, pretty tasty (4 stars)
4. Meat ravioli with pesto sauce: Nicely cooked ravioli with meat filling and vibrant green pesto sauce. Ravioli was tender and meat was ground very fine, almost like it had been blended. Pesto sauce was good (4 stars)

Service/setting/ambience is a 3 at best. Restaurant is quite old and doesn't always seem the cleanest, especially the restrooms. Service is decent, nothing to note (no rudeness but also no beaming waiters).

I prioritize food a lot higher than everything else, so this place gets a 4.5 despite the lackluster service/setting/ambience due to the delicious food.
author: Austin S.

description: Average pizza. Awful service. Don't trust prices online, which are different when you call in. When I inquired why I was told "we don't have time to update them". My reply: "Well, I don't have time to make pizza, but I might have enough time to hangup and give a less dishonest business owner my cash". Apparently when a restaurant has been in this city long enough to have manageable rent, and its lemming stream of foolish patrons have more money than discernment in taste, it becomes soft and rude. I guess it will satisfy if you have a craving. 2 stars is based on the food not my anecdote.
author: Jason K.

description:
This is a first for me: an Italian restaurant with no oregano for its customers!

Pasquale's has officially done away with oregano for its customers (oregano is already in their sauce I was told).  So if you'd like to sprinkle oregano on your pizza the message is "go screw."  Considering the price of their pizza has increased from last year, there is no excuse for this (except to save money). There are many ways of saving money, Pasquale's....why not do away with salt? How about refusing to hand out napkins?? Why not charge for toilet paper??!  

Thank you, Pasquale's!!
author: Rudy G.

description: We stopped by here because it was down the street and one of the few places open late night Sunday. We walked in ordered and Pepperoni with Pineapple as well as a spinach, artichoke, and garlic. Delicious pizza and priced very friendly. We weren't able to try the rest of menu because the time we went they only do pizza (not sure of cutoff time) If you are looking for latenight food I would recommend. #thingsnickeats IG @quicknickk
author: Nicholas L.

description: I never knew a sandwich could taste so good before I ordered one from Pasquale's. Because I'm vegan I had to make a slight change to it, but I ordered the Eggplant Parmigian Sandwich which was ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!! Would definitely come back and order again :D
author: Ann S.

description: I accidentally lost my phone at this pizzeria and when I went back for it the staff was so nice and helpful as well as funny I didn't have time to try any of the food but the customer service was great and the customers I met were also friendly. I will definitely go back to try the food.
author: Laura R.

description:
As a pizza connoisseur who appreciates the value of quality for the dollar, pizza at Pasquale's is the BEST! For an authentically made Italian pizza this place blows its competitors out of the water! I went there there with my wife, we ordered an extra large (this is a huge pizza by the way) with one topping for under $22. We were both ravenous and there was ample pizza left over.

Beyond the pizza, the pasta dishes are great including the fettucine alfredo and meat lasagna. 

Overall the restaurant is a great value and one of our go-to's for incredible italian food.
author: Jack C.

description:
My girlfriend comes here after work to grab us a late night bite on occasion. The times we've been there, we've always ordered the same thing. 2 personal pizzas, one Pep with Extra Pep and the other, Parma. Never failed us and I will continue to go there for their Parma.

But one time we went there and ordered a medium pizza, and asked for "Half Beef Mexi-Cali, half Pep with Extra Pep", and I quote. But when our order came out, the guy behind the counter presented us the pizza before placing into the pizza box to ask us if the order was correct. But what was presented to us was a medium pizza all Beef Mexi-Cali and half of it with Pep as an additional topping. They made up for it though offering us a personal Pep pizza on the house. Just one mess up by Pasquale's, but guarantee I'll be back for that Parma pizza!
author: Andrew B.

description: i live near here go there a lot.tonite i was treated badly ordered a pie and pasta dish girl said 20 minutes ok.came back 21 minutes said a few more ok came back now 32 minutes girl said almost waited another 5 minutes i said I'm waiting close to 40 minutes she tells me want your money back what a terrible answer I'm waiting now 40 minutes to be disrespected.im telling all my friends around irving place where i live go to another pizza place.
author: John M.

description:
Maybe Yelp needs to get an updated menu from Pasquale's. I just ordered spaghetti with pesto sauce and the veal scallopini. Instead of the prices here on Yelp of $23.50 the bill is $32.00 plus $1.00 delivery which I didn't know they charged. Live 'n learn.

Edit. The food arrived. It looked like it was dropped down a flight of stairs plus it was lukewarm at best.
author: Steven S.

description: This place always hits the spot when I'm craving Italian food. Had the half pesto spaghetti half meat sauce raviolis with 2 meatballs for $14. Good food, good menu prices, nice place and great neighborhood. Will keep coming back!
author: Mitch C.

description:
Worst delivery service I have ever experienced. They have gotten my order wrong twice. The first time they said they would give me 20% my second order. When I called back in, they had no record of telling me that.

The second time they got it wrong, the woman working the phone said I didn't tell her the correct order. I order the same thing from Pasquales about once every 2 weeks. They have no record. She said "it's your responsibility to repeat your order to verify it's correct". Then she hung up on me. 

Also, the delivery drivers are flat out rude. I tipped the guy well tonight and said have a good night. He didn't even acknowledge me. I repeated again "have a good night!"...nothing.

Never again.
author: Brian B.

description: Great pizza! So many memories: dinner after winning sports events; taking a. Volleyball team I coached for a victory celebration. High school hang out wit friends. And the list goes on!
author: Teresa W.

description: neighborhood favorite, I hope this place sticks around forever
author: A C.

description: Just amazing, some of the best pizza in sf been having it since I was a kid. Don't stop at the pizza the pastas and garlic bread will change your friggin life!
author: Matt S.

description:
Warning, bait and switch pricing! Prices on yelp and on the online menu are not accurate and significantly higher when you arrive to pick up your order. 

I mentioned this to the cashier and her response was "Yea the confusion happens all the time, we aren't associated with yelp" to which I suggested they update their menu; her response was to shrug. Pizza itself was fine but way overpriced. There is no justification for being the highest priced pizza in the sunset. Ultimately would have been fine if pricing was transparent or at minimum the cashier showed even the slightest amount or empathy. Instead they lost a customer and encouraged a negative review.
author: Marty H.

description: The pizza was excellent but the pasta dishes sucked.   The chicken mushroom pasta dish did not have the chicken Cooked well and we told the busboy and he said that was not his issue.  If it was not for the pasta Linwood probably give this place a few more stars.  The owner should pay attention to his crew and customer service
author: tony s.

description: This is more a review about the delivery driver than the food. I still enjoy the food but I dislike dishonesty and not taking responsibility for one's actions. Driver was upset with me because he said he rang my doorbell and a guy answered and said he didn't order a pizza. Driver calls me and says he's at another address and that they also said they didn't order a pizza. I gave him my address again and he says please come outside, he's walking to my home. i go outside and he repeats what he said earlier and gives me attitude. I told him I'm the only adult in the house and he did not ring my bell, he said why would he park at the wrong house unless he was directed there. For my own piece of mind, I checked my cameras, he did NOT come to my place at all! He does not appear in the video AT ALL, neither driving by or walking by my house, not even going to my neighbors! I hate liars!
author: Dave T.

description:
ATMOSPHERE:
The interior of this restaurant was nothing too fancy. You can kind of tell that this restaurant was kind of maintained. One thing that bothered me when I was in here was that there were flies flying around inside...

FOOD:
I ordered the Philly cheese steak which came with fries. I would say that it was tasty and the meat was flavorful. The fries were crunchy, however, it was flavorless so I had to sprinkle some salt on top of it.

CUSTOMER SERVICE:
Customer service here was fine. They were on top of refilling our water and fast at getting our orders and checks.
author: Aj C.

description:
I am so glad that we have a no-frills neighborhood pizza & Italian restaurant. When you're inside, there's something homey about it. The servers are sweet, but are also not afraid to give you some sass which adds to the fun of it all. The menu has something for everybody, and I highly recommend dining in for their pizzas versus delivery. Delivery, although relatively fast, just didn't have the same magic (well, duh right?). The crust didn't have that fresh crisp, and the cheese didn't have the stretchy goopiness we all love. Maybe that's just what the steam and time in the cardboard box does.

Anyhow, any of their pizzas are worth it, their sandwiches are worth it, their baked potatoes are freaking impressive, and their wine is lovely.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Stopped by for a quick bite before heading to the California Academy of Sciences, a short walk from Golden Gate Park.

Was a bit difficult to understand where to sit since no one came to seat us, but we ended up seating ourselves and then a server came over to take our order. Pizza itself was tasty and quick, nothing over the top or amazing, but definitely hit the spot.
author: Stephen Y.

description:
Customize your own pizza?! What?!

I believe it was a base price of $4.75 and $0.50 for toppings. Which sounded like crazy talk for a slice of pi$$a! But we ordered a small pizza round with pepperoni and bell peppers and watched as the bakers right behind the bar begin to make it. I see the dough being tossed and toppings being thrown here and there and then slid into the large pizza oven behind them.

The pizza was thin and crunchy. The crust itself was thick and had a chewy bread texture. The cheese and pepperoni blended marvelously together. I felt like it was the perfect portion for the price. I might have just found my new go-to drunk night pizza joint.
author: Linda K.

description:
3.5 stars is exactly right. I personally enjoy their pastas more than their pizza.  I've tried their linguini with fresh clams and this was an excellent choice. Flavors were on point.
The linguini with baby clams is not a bad choice either (no clam shells). I've had their house special pizza which does the job of filling you, but it's not best I've ever had.  The pizza is also a bit on the pricey side. It's a fun pizza place for groups.
author: Ali F.

description: Soooo grubbin'.  Crispy bottom, gooey cheesy toppped pizzas with generous, fresh toppings.  Salads and sandos are fully legit too.  Prices are decent as well!
author: Ryan B.

description:
Wonderful place....but the "B team" of the front house staff is terrible. 

The younger waitress who leans against the counter at the bar and looks at her phone all night in particular should be fired.
author: Vladimir H.

description: Beware of this place late at night. Know exactly what you're ordering, and ask for the price before picking up. I just walked out with a small special and small wings and paid $29. I'm no genius...but I believe I just got jipped.
author: Barry V.

description:
My family and I were walking by and there was another family with kids enjoying their personal pizza outside.  It looked so good that we had to stop and pick up some pizza for our kids ourselves.  We got two personal cheese pizzas and I watched them make it. 

The pizza's were delicious as I has to sneak a piece away from my son.  It was a great deal for $5 each (includes tax).

Will be back!
author: Henry S.

description: I love pizza and was surprised by the restaurant style of this place. Ordered the sunset special for two and and order of wings. The pizza was good. This place is decent for a late night dinner.
author: Jackson T.

description: Been eating Pasqualies for 40 years , most excellent pie, excellent pasta good prices , nice staff Jose the pizza cook has been making pie for 35 years ...try it
author: Jim M.

description: Save your money. Save your time. Save your energy. These guys are a real piece of work. Absolutely terrible rude and disgusting. I ordered two pizzas, both to the hospital about 10 mins away from the pizza parlor and both came hard as cardboard and cold as ice. I have two sick kids here and they asked for pizza, as a young kid myself I used to love this place. The owner is not a business man, he's an absolute garbage cat hustling innocent people from their money. I encourage everyone who reads this avoid the pizza at all costs. Avoid giving this scum bucket your money as they are here specifically to screw you over. When I called to complain and ask for something to be remedied he asked me questions condescendingly as if I was lying. I said barely any sausage on my pizza and this guy has the gall to ask me if I counted the number of sausages on my pie. Are you kidding me? As a business man you suck, as human you suck even more. He told me I should have called right away but with young kids hungry as hell what am I to do keep them hungry until the guy feels like making me another pizza. Total garbage cat two bit hustler. It'll be the last dime you get from me and I guarantee from the large chamber I belong to. Good luck slinging your trash pizza. If your service was even remotely courteous I'd be a bit more forgiving but your customer service is awful just like your establishment and just like your pizza. Pasquale's = trash and I'll make sure the city of sf knows this.
author: Nimer M.

description: My favorite pizza and pasta place.  I gave up on North beach pizza after several bad deliveries.  My favorite is the pasquales special pizza and meat ravioli.  They have been around a long time and quality of their pizza is great.  Cleanliness, eh,  I wish they would take out the carpets.  The service can be spotty, and over the years, I just don't recognize anyone anymore.  I frequent they every month or two for last 20yrs......I still them 4 stars only because 80% of the time their service and food was good.  20% time, the service is bad and occasionally the food is salty or bland.  Maybe there is a different chef, but I am hoping Pasquales will continue to be around and fix the inconsistencies.
author: tom c.

description: My go-to for Inner Sunset carb fix. Meals are consistent, pasta well-cooked al Dente, very savory sausages (good fennel hit). Current fav is the Louisiana style spaghetti but there are many other good options. I've only eaten the Mediterranean pizza about twice a year or so, but it has been consistent as well. Servers are very nice & efficient.
author: Ken U.

description:
Yummmmmy. Was on the lookout for some relatively "authentic" Italian food.. Not the basic Olive Garden cookie cutter meals.. We wanted gritty, witty, pasta, some Italian food with character. 

What we found was in your face, slap your momma, take no prisoners, Italian food. Delicious!! 

Simple restaurant no frills nothing fancy just good Italian food! Chicken penne marinara with mushrooms was amazinnggggg.
My girl got the cheese raviolis which were savory and delicious ! 

Huge portions for the price! Great food! 10/10 would eat here. A perfect 5/7. 2 toes up! 

HELLA good

Yes hella
author: Norman F.

description: Actually just the pizza is consistent here....well even that is questionable! I am born and raised in San Francisco also my family owns restaurants multiple ones in San Rafael and in the city I've bartended and been a waitress in all of them before I had children and decided to stay home for the past couple years. Place is your regular neighborhood Italian joint nothing special every time we order a pizza we get basil and at least 50% of the time - and I'm not exaggerating they forget the basil. When you order a vegetarian pizza that's the most important part. Plus I've ordered pasta and they put the wrong sauce - when I asked for the white wine sauce they put the red sauce for some reason whoever answers the phone doesn't seem to hear very well. Anyways call the restaurant to let them know they've forgotten the basil multiple times because I didn't call the first couple times having being in the business I know mistakes happen. The woman who answers the phone puts me on hold multiple times tells me she'll give me a creditFor three toppings next time I order for having forgotten the basil multiple times. I said well they should just give me a free pizza then- she said hold on I'll talk to my boss... Comes back on the phone and asks if they can just  send the basil out I say sure send out the basil and then she proceeds to and hangs up in my face...I'm sorry I pissed you off because you forgot to put the topping on my pizza. Not to mention it's a double charge for basil for which I haven't complained that you forgot it numerous times ...Only for you guys to be nasty and rude and hang up in my face!! Customer service is questionable there and now I'm scared to get the basil they probably spit in it! Completely unprofessional and uncalled for I'm sorry you forgot my toppings on my pizza - jerks!!
author: Dustin S.

description: Great service. Generous family style portions.  Food comes out quick.  Antipasto salad was fresh.  Soda fountain and clean drinking water.  Closest pizza place to the California science museum.  Place packs up quick.  Pizza was just ok.  The edge was burned on some slices and the thin crust wasn't cooked as well as from a brick oven. Good value.
author: Susannah K.

description: Great Italian place where the sf locals go. The food is fabulous and reasonably priced.
author: Gina R.

description: Been ordering pizza from Pasquale's since I was kid and can never find anything as amazing
author: Danielle B.

description:
Hey paisan! You like-a pizza? We gotta pizza right 'ere. OK, nobody talk-a like dat to us at Pasquale's, but it's the kind of old-school, plastic-tablecloth place where you'd expect someone in a Chef Boyardee outfit to come out and talk like that (photo: http://bit.ly/1jhX7qa). Well, at least the waitress was friendly and attentive, a far cry from the indifference we experienced across the street at the equally old-school Villa Romana. In fact, she sat us at the "special" table under the florescent blacklight so that our plastic water glasses would glow in an iridescent purplish pink (photo: http://bit.ly/1oSc29Y). Jamie W. and I have noticed this place for years as we peered out of the N-Judah, so this was the Friday night where we would give it a shot.

Whether Chef Boyardee tosses the dough in the air with one hand or not, we knew we were getting a pizza, but I was thinking we could share a $5.50 half-order of the Spaghetti with Meat Sauce. It was definitely on the ho-hum side. I mean, look at it (photo: http://bit.ly/QLNAe7). Doesn't it look like it came out of a jar? Yeah, I think so, too, even when you apply an aggressive shake of the dry Parmesan cheese on top. Yeah, I knew I should have ordered the Antipasto Salad for a little more variety on our palates. Luckily, the pizza didn't disappoint nearly as much. we settled on the $21.50 16" House Special with sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms, and salami (photo: http://bit.ly/1jwGIs3). We figured if we were kickin' it old-school, we'd kick it over the curb.

It was a pretty satisfying pie, and they certainly didn't skimp on the toppings which were piled high on the melted cheese. The crust was the thin, cracker-like kind, not my favorite since it buckles under the pressure of excessive toppings. But it was still good enough for us to devour 2/3 of it right there. The rest of it went home with Jamie in a box with a cartoon...oh, there's Pasquale (photo: http://bit.ly/1nR1V58) Hey paisan!  Anyhow, I'm not the type who pooh-poohs a place like this in favor of the designer pizzerias that offer fig and prosciutto on their fashion-forward pizzas. OK, I am that type, but I still like the old-school pizza that reminds me of college all-nighters. I could have used a glow-in-the-dark glass back then.

FOOD - 3 stars...generic spaghetti but the nostalgic pizza saves the evening
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...familiar old-time pizza place that'll give fellow baby boomers flashbacks
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...speedy and pretty attentive throughout
TOTAL - 3 stars...worth a trip in the wayback machine if you're in the mood for good dorm-room pizza
author: Ed U.

description: Went to dinner this week to celebrate a friend's return to US. Pasqual's was about 2/3's full. After sitting down for 10+ minutes we still hadn't received a menu but noticed a table of four that had arrived after us was already receiving drinks. We waited some more but our waitress (middle-aged, short, Filipina female) still did not arrive - evidently she'd forgotten us. We contemplated leaving the restaurant but decided to ride it out. After 15+minutes we finally were able to flag her down, and there was no apology and in fact she suddenly attempted to rush our order. As no wine menu had been brought we requested her to bring one. We also had to request bread to be brought to the table and water was never refilled. She never asked how our food was. Also my food was brought out over 5 minutes before my friends and dish was cold by the time my friend's entree arrived. But all these are small details. The worst part of the meal was not just the service but the attitude of the server herself. Her rudeness and passive aggressive verbal jabs made towards us at the middle and end of our meal were  surprising to say the least and *not* at all classy! Out of decency we still tipped her 20% but left the restaurant with a very bad after-taste and it wasn't from the food!
author: John D.

description: The best. Make sure u order your pizza well done and try the calamari. Bomb. I always eat there. Old school and home feeling. A real SF diamond.
author: Craig L.

description:
Service was great
Pizza was good-
Not what I expected from SF - 
Family friendly atmosphere
author: Lana M.

description: Their pizza sauce is way too salty and I do not recommend it for people with high blood pressure. The restaurant took forever to deliver, almost 2.5 hours! When the pizza arrived it was burnt, soggy, AND they got our order wrong, missing some toppings but charging us for it. Do not recommend.
author: Jenifer J.

description: My boyfriend and I was going around to go where to eat and curious about this place without checking other reviews. I love the service because it's pretty quick and getting your food as well. Very affordable and great portion food. Good temperature as well. One only down side is that it can get cramped. Other than that, everything else was awesome and worth eating. Next time though, I will not have breakfast and lunch to eat my meal even more than what I did or maybe try the pizza too.
author: C G.

description: I wish the food was better because the service was good and the location is perfect. The cheese was chewy. Crust totally underwhelming. Too many other places nearby make amazing pizza.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: This is my favorite restaurant every time I going to city always eat there specially before church. Always order the Cesar steak salad and a steak and fettuccine is the greatest I highly recommend it 77 thumbs up
author: Angelo M.

description: The reviews are accurate, OK, but not great in ambiance and service.  Kudos to them for accommodating a group of 18 of us looking for a mid-afternoon light meal between a wedding and its reception.  The pizza was excellent, but the poor couple in our group that ordered pasta instead waited a VERY long time for their order.  If you are in the neighborhood and want a good pizza, at a reasonable price, eat here.
author: Anne B.

description:
I had dinner here last night. I've heard so much about this place that I decided to give it a shot. We were in the mood for pizza and pasta. So we ordered the spaghetti carbonara and a medium sized half and half pizza- medusa and house special. It was decent, nothing too special honestly. 

Service was ehh..There was one waistress that looked like she hated the place so much and our waitress was never around when we needed anything. We ended up standing up, asking for the check, and paying at the register.
author: Dara S.

description: The 3 stars isn't for the food. The food is very good. I always get my orders for delivery and that is where the problem is. Every time you order you have to give your information over and over again. Other places they will say what's your number and all you info pops up.so they need to work on that and I will save time.
author: Larry S.

description: Pasquale's is my go-to pizza spot when I'm planning to stay in for the night. Pizza is good quality and fairly priced. I like getting the House Special, sausage, pepperoni and salami. I always order for pickup and they are quick. I do not dine-in there anymore because the few times I did, service was just mediocre. Overall, good place for pizza.
author: Jimmy T.

description:
I have always had amazing experiences here. My man lives up the street so we get pizza here a lot. The crust is amazing and I love their toppings. 
Big fan of this place. Very reasonable prices too for how good the quality is.
author: Marissa F.

description: If you love a hot slice of pizza oozing and dripping with gooey mozzarella wonderfulness, Pasquale's pizza is NOT for you. If you enjoy tasting chili powder on the first bite and every bite thereafter, you should enjoy this pizza. If you like cardboard, this pizza crust should satisfy. Pathetic in every way- never again.
author: Donald K.

description: Decent pizza in the area. Nothing too special. There's other pizza places I'd prefer over this.
author: Janet H.

description: Hands down the worst pizza I've ever had. Ordered a pizza for pick up and it was the SOGGIEST pizza I have ever seen/eaten. It felt as if it were drenched in soup before being boxed. Definitely would NOT recommend this place.
author: Anne B.

description: The worst service on weekends. I put up with it cuz it's cheap (in price as well as quality) and open late. Except to wait long and you'll be lucky if added wait time isn't added once you arrive. Again only cuz it's cheap and open late. #yougetwhatyoupayfor
author: Ivan M.

description: Love love love this place! I could eat their sourdough bread every day, all day!  Their marinara is bomb.
author: megan K.

description:
Love this pizza, since I was a kid. Best crust, best sauce, salami and mushrooms- awesome. It's thin and delicious.
Try it, you'll be glad you did!
author: Annette D.

description:
Popcorn shrimp is the only reason this place got two stars. And the fries were okay. 
We got the garlic bread with cheese, nasty. 
My friend got the Neapolitan sandwich and it was inedible. 
I got the cheese steak sandwich and that was just awful too. 
Everything was pretty bad.
author: Manouel O.

description: Horrible customer service. They do not wanna talk to you and put you on hold in a rude manner and are extra rude especially when you cancel the order. They do not have have a website although there is price data online and try try to overcharge you. Complete scam. $24 for 4 ingedients crappy pizza..
author: Serguei B.

description:
Made a spontaneous trip for lunch with my boyfriend yesterday. We ordered the house special pizza which came with sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms. A pretty simple blend of ingredients that made a really delicious pizza. We also added lots of garlic which made it taste even better. We ordered a medium sized even though a small would have been more than enough for the two of us (we're fatties), we took a few slices back home to snack on later :3

I definitely recommend this place; pizza is really fresh and has a nice authentic a favor. It isn't super doughy either. I wish we ordered other things on the menu because they sounded as equally as amazing as their pizza, but I'm sure we'll be back again soon! 

Unfortunately, the only negative aspect of my experience at Pasquale's isn't it's food but the fact that there were flies roaming around near our table. It bothered me especially with our food out on the table. But other than that Pasquale's is awesome (:
author: Diana K.

description: The pizza here is good and I'm saying it as a woman who grew up in a little Italian town with authentic mom and pops pizzerias. Def will be back
author: Kaye L.

description: The pizza here is great.  I always order the meat combo.  It's the go too spot in the sunset.
author: Mike G.

description:
I am frequent To Go orderer....I love that they allow substitutions, but find that the items are the menu are generally better than when I try to modify (trust their process!) LOL. 

Our favorites:
Regular garlic bread
Pasta in Broccoli Sauce - so so good
Baked Ziti with Ricotta
Any Pizza - incredibly good with delicious crust - typically get pepperoni well done
Spaghetti or Ravioli in meat sauce

Need to try stuffed potatoes, cannelloni, more pastas, and the Greek Caesar salad.

Staff are always super friendly too! Good hiring Pasquale's!
author: Christine V.

description: When it comes to the inner sunset, you can't beat Pasquale's. Just good solid pizza at the right price. I only do carry out from here. Always my go to pizza spot. This is 5 stars because it's the best in the area, look nowhere else.
author: Garrett G.

description: Pasquale's was our GoTo pizza place back in the college days. It was the default pizza delivery option in our dorms. I can still remember that characteristic aroma of the mushroom/sausage pizza in the hallways. Well, decades later, it does not disappoint. The pizza has not changed a bit, and why muck with a good thing! The crust is crispy on the edges, fennel sausage, mushrooms, and the herbs in that sauce -- tasty! No fancy review here, simply yummy pizza that I love to eat every time I am in the area.
author: Art I.

description:
My favorite pizza in San Francisco. We order almost every weekend while at work. Has to be either the House special or the Mediterranean. You can only phone in, no online or mobile orders. If you ever dine in, they have a cool retro cash register.

Open hours is actually 11am. Get you pizza fix early.
author: Robin L.

description:
This review is for pick-up not for eating at this establishment. I ordered entrees, 2 veal scallopini, 1 seafood pasta dish, a chicken catatorri , and a shrimp pasta dish along with a order of garlic bread and 1 order of steamed broccoli . All the orders were well proportioned and came with steamed veggies and pasta along with sour dough bread, They were all delicious and well priced. I was impressed with the size of the orders. Price was not too bad, all these entrees were about $100.00
Next time I will probably try to eat there. It's not only a pizzeria.
author: Dirk D.

description: The pizza was really fresh and the crust was really crispy. This is a good place to go to if you like thin crust. They open late and take walk in orders right before they close. Great for a midnight snack. I got the Parma which has bacon, chicken, Alfredo sauce and green onions. It was very flavorful but also pretty oily.
author: Alison T.

description:
Pasquale's is delicious. In recent months, the pizza has become really REALLY delicious!! Like do they have a new manager or recipe?!! Bravo! Delicious thin crust crisp pizza every time. 

After villa Romana and Milano closed down this is my go to spot!

Not sure how the wait staff is, but I plan on dining-in, soon, to find out. Could possibly give this place a 5 star. 

I'm so happy after all these years, Pasquale is still around :)
author: Andrew V.

description:
I order pizza from here quite often because they're one of the few spots open close to my work when I get off. Pizza isn't bad, but isn't the best I've had. The crust is a hit or miss. I hate it when the crust gets burnt. 
I ordered here last night with my boyfriend, half beef Mexicali, half pepperoni, and they messed up the order. They asked if we wanted it or if we wanted a new one. My boyfriend kept asking for a new one how we ordered it, but they kept insisting to take the pizza, or get a personal pepperoni pizza on the side for free. If you mess up on an order, you should fix it. That's not how we wanted the pizza, and that's not what we payed for.. Overall, service is whatever, pizza is ok.
author: Pauline E.

description: Food is great, just don't order delivery.  They don't deliver when they say they will, an hour estimate from them is normally 1.5 to just under 2 hours with cold food. Service is less than decent which is really sad considering this establishment is over 40 years old.
author: Sheila N.

description:
Decent Italian place with okay service. 

We ended up here after a long day of site seeing around San Fran.  Though not our first choice it turned out pretty good. 

The food was good - from my sole fish sandwich to my wife's ravioli and my son's ziti, it all came out hot, well made and presented, and just plain good.
 My only complaint - and it's a light one - is that the service was not as attentive or friendly as I would like or even expect. Possibly an off-day for them?  Maybe so. But it does detract from the overall experience.
author: José A.

description: Have eating here for over 40 years. Yes 40. I have noticed that the crust is different in a not so good way. Tastes bland and hard. They started skimping on toppings too. Restaurant feels dirty and a little grimy, overused and undercleaned. Restaurant needs overhaul and go back to its roots. Come on Pasquales, get it together.
author: H L.

description:
The pizza here is just okay and pretty pricey actually. It is also pretty annoying that they don't sell pizza by the slice! 

If you have the pizza right away, it is alright, but if you wait more than 30 minutes, the crust becomes hard and you have to microwave it again.

I'm not completely ruling out Pasquale's as a pizza stop. I have some friends who really like it but it's just not one of my first choices.
author: Ashley P.

description:
Pasquale's serves basic Italian American food, made well every time. It's not like going to Italy. It's not a trendy, gourmet or avant garde hotspot. It's just Italian American home cooking.  It comes to your table with good, polite, conscientious service.  But what really kicks this from 3 to 4 stars is that Pasquale's food is pleasantly affordable.

After having gone here inconsistently for years, last night my family ordered cheese ravioli with marinara, baked ziti and 3 personal pizzas for the kids. We also started out with some pesto garlic bread. All of the above was just good, solid food. The kids devoured the pizzas. My ravioli was plentiful and filling. Really, nothing remarkable, but absolutely nothing bad to say.  I was only able to finish half, and as I type this I am eating the left overs for breakfast. The ziti is advertised as "East Coast", which is funny because my wife was asking if I knew much about baked ziti and I explained that it's difficult to find a good rendition of the dish out West after having grown up on the stuff in NYC. Even so, I thought the ziti was good. It was cooked perfectly, and I really like their ricotta. My only complaint was that the dish was perhaps a bit watery, maybe from the marinara? The only drink of consequence was a glass of cheap chianti. The restaurant was a bit warm, and so was the wine.

When we were done eating, my wife and I wondered why we don't come to Pasquale's regularly as we have lived just a few blocks away for years.  We love Italian food and it's not as though every Italian dinner on a night out with the family has to be SPQR or Delfina.

We will definitely make this a more regular go-to spot for our family neighborhood walks.
author: Jason G.

description: What a way to top off my visit to San Francisco! Always looking to find a good slice and this was perfect. I couldn't stop eating it. The sauce is amazing! Wish I could remember more details for you all
author: Michael F.

description: The only thing Italian about this place is the name. The food is very bland, the shrimp (clearly frozen/thawed) dishes and even the eggplant Parmesan were overwhelmed with lemon. It all seemed to lack garlic, spices,... Nine of us dined there, none of us were impressed by the flavor.
author: Greg M.

description: One of the best pizza's in the city.  You must try meditarenian combo, stripsteak sand and fruitti di mare.  Yummy
author: Art Y.

description: Eh. So-so. The pizza was ok, but nothing special. Service was pretty good, and the greek salad was actually really good. The pizza was a bit too much saucy, a bit less and it would have been great. They have pasta's and other entree's to chose from. I probably won't be coming back anytime soon.
author: J M.

description: Our pizza was fabulously yummy! Every 2 months we trek from Humboldt County to UCSF for a doctor's appointment for my husband who is surviving brain cancer. Having food from Pasqueles is something we look forward to each time. Thanks Pasqueles!
author: D M.

description:
Dec 22, 2016

Service 4 stars (Lorrie)
Pizza (Sunset Special) 2 stars

I am almost certain the sauce is from a can. It isn't what it used to be. We should have gone to The Front Room. 

It was also still very dated and a bit run down and a bit on the dirty side.
author: Owl H.

description: I am not sure how differently they prepare their Pizza but I love it. I love their chicken and veg pizza and also garlic bread. Best place to have Pizza in Inner sunset.
author: Devan K.

description:
I used to love this place, but their repeated low health inspection score...which just got a lot lower this month...is keeping me away. I'm not someone who expects perfection, but the following list of violations (including a moderate risk vermin infestation!) is too much for me to feel safe eating here. I wish they would take the violations seriously enough to make lasting changes. I'd love to get pizza from here again...it's always been my favorite in the neighborhood!

Violations (from the local health department via Yelp) SCORE: 68 - Red.
Inadequate food safety knowledge or lack of certified food safety manager
Moderate risk food holding temperature
Unclean nonfood contact surfaces
Improper cooling methods
Improper reheating of food
Inadequately cleaned or sanitized food contact surfaces
Moderate risk vermin infestation
author: Mary R.

description: Serving was a lot. Im not a big fan of cheese pizza but this one is good. Pasta dishes with their marinara sauce is delicious. Meatballs are fresh and not frozen and the cost is surprisingly reasonable. Service was good. Will come back and try the seafood pasta. Chef Joe is very friendly.
author: neil v.

description:
For those of you in search of a real *baked* veal parmigiana, you can find it here!
