I have gone to many other restaurants, including extremely high end and even the fabled Woodlake Joes, and not found it.  What I was served was usually tasty, but definitely not baked.  Pasquale's knows how to use the oven to bring out that unique flavor.  Highly recommended.

With regards to the service.  Initial seating was casual with menus dropped off.  We were given time to look everything over and then the fun happened once we started ordering.  The server was most engaging and appropriately attentive and helpful.  We had ordered the calamari appetizer and when he noticed I put the left over squeezed lemon in my water, he went and cut up a lemon to provide wedges for my wife to use also!  Wow, that was truly appreciated.  The server (he has worked there 15 years) also recommended a great red wine to try instead of the Chianti, Tampino/Taurasi? (sorry, I cannot remember).  I will order that wine again in a heartbeat.  Through out the meal the service provided was pretty much on point: attentive, convivial, helpful, and not over bearing or intrusive.  We were not rushed and made to feel welcome.  If you are a person that wants to rush, well maybe the pace here will be too relaxed for you, but we appreciated it as we were looking to relax and celebrate.

We used to frequent Villa Romano while it was owned and operated by the father (and the uncle cooked);  but when the son took over it was never the same and closed fairly quick.  Now we have a place worth driving up from the peninsula to eat.  We will be coming back, and we haven't even tried the pizza yet (which lots of folks rave about).

By the way, the person that turned me on to Pasquale's loves their Frutti di Mare, I haven't tried it yet but that could be in my future.

p.s., the menu on Yelp is accurate in selection from what I remember, but the prices have increased by 2-3 dollars on most items, still a great deal in my book for what you get.
author: R W.

description: Great pizza.  Very fresh ingredients and you watch them make the pizza.  I'm not a pasta fan, so I can't say anything about that.  So far, this is the best pizza in the Haight/Sunset neighborhood that I've tried.
author: Dick C.

description:
Delicious thin crust pizza!  Ordered house special (pepperoni, sausage, mushroom) and mediterranean and both were great.  

I've been coming here for almost 20 years and they serve great pizza.

It's totally mellow here and you'll see many locals coming here over and over.
author: Susan C.

description: Been here for so many years..!! Came here a month ago.. But ate here few times.. Neigorhood pizza joint.. Crowded so please go early..!!! Everything on menu tasty n hot n yummy for our tummy hahahaha.. So you can pick one from salad to pizza or entrees... Can't go wrong !!!!
author: Crisy G.

description:
Pizza delish. Hipster douchebag behind the counter, not so delish.

Ordered a pizza to pickup today and was told it'd be 15 minutes. Showed up, paid, and started waiting. After 30 minutes from when I originally called, I told the hipster-looking guy behind the counter I had ordered a pizza and got a curt "yeah it's coming out". I'm kinda curious what the reasoning was for his nasty-mannered retort when he had plenty of time to flirt with the (counted 3 while I was waiting) young women who came into the restaurant.

Guys like him are why i dislike SF.
author: Leon S.

description:
I love the food here especially the Veggie Pizza and Frutti Di Mare. But I always have a bad experience every time I order on the phone for pick-up.
The lady always ask me if she can put me on hold which is fine with me, the problem is she didn't even wait until I respond YES. I find it rude for them to do that to their customers. 
The girl told me my order is ready to be picked up within 20 minutes, but it ended up being 50 minutes. Then when I got home, there was no chili or parmesan cheese inside the pizza box. Oh well.....
author: Dianne Jay S.

description: The pizza is always great, the service is always disappointing. Always difficult to get the servers attention and once you do they seem annoyed to serve you.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
The health inspecton is bogus, have been going here since early sixties. In fact when it burnt down I was lost.  The antipasto salad is great, and when I travel world wide this pizza is the one I always compare it to.
To bad they don't deliver out of state.
author: J K.

description:
My significant other and I have enjoyed pizza here many times over the last 10 years, usually eating late Friday or Saturday nights.  We've never ordered delivery, however.

This is an old school, late night pizza place.  Not a fine dining venue, so don't expect that.  Be prepared for plastic table cloths and old carpet flooring.

That said, every pizza we've eaten over the years has been well prepared, with toppings evenly and generously distributed, all fresh tasting.  The crust is on the thinner side and is baked perfectly and consistently.  Our favorite is their house special.

For appetizers, their chicken wings are well prepared, crispy on outside, moist and meaty on inside.  Their bread is served warm with generous pats of butter on the side.  

We also enjoy their reasonably priced bottles of interesting Italian wines.

For pasta and pesto lovers, their pesto tortellini is a great choice.  Their pesto sauce is fresher and much better than some Italian restaurants we frequent.  They serve a generous portion, so you may have left overs, which taste even better the next day!

Mita, their main server on Fridays/Saturdays is warm, efficient and ensures the customers are enjoying their meal.  

Maybe late at night, the flies that other Yelpers have mentioned, aren't around?  We've never seen flies in the dozens of times we've eaten here. 

Thanks, Pasquale's, you're the real deal!
author: Nina D.

description: Wow! Had forgotten about Pasquale's for a couple of years. So glad to be back. Pizza is as delicious as ever. Thin crust and lots of cheese. Huge menu and very reasonably priced.
author: Ed C.

description: This is a quality, no-frills Italian Pizzeria. The first time I tried Pasquale's, I was pleasantly surprised at how good the pizza was. They keep their ingredients simple, and bring out the most in the flavors through some special pizza magic. I haven't tried many other dishes, except for the soup and burgers, but they were also really good and hearty. The burger was a bit rare in the middle, so if you're picky about that, be sure they know how you want it cooked.
author: Shaina R.

description: I'm a local and have been going to Pasquale's for many years, although I don't think I've ever dined in their restaurant. I almost always get the same items for delivery or to go. I LOVE their pizza, although I always order thin crust with mushrooms and eggplant - personal or small size. I'm really surprised by people who say that their crust tastes like cardboard, as that's not at all my experience. Also, I've never been overcharged by them, i.e., had a discrepancy between their menu price on paper or online and what I've been billed. Their direct delivery is free and generally very efficient. The other thing I always order is their dinner salad, which is large, fresh, with a nice assortment of veggies and some beans. I'm not totally surprised, although still disappointed, about the complaints regarding rude, poor in-dining service. Since most of the people at the cashier and the guys who make the pizza know my face, I've never had any problems when I go in person and order my regular items to go. My only issue really is that they always seem to miss or mess up something with my delivery orders. Not big things, but things such as not including extra Parmesan cheese, putting dressing on the salad and not on the side, and very infrequently under or overcooking the pizza. I did recently go outside the box and order their roasted chicken entree with two sides, which was very good.
author: Chelsea D.

description: Disappointing experience. Went there with a family group and the food was below average over cooked pizza soaking in grease, a fly in our salad and very poor service. We won't be back.
author: Tim P.

description: Great neighborhood spot.  Delivery is always fast and easy, only thing I wish is that they had mobile/web ordering.  Can't go wrong with either the baked tortellini or the house special pizza.
author: Jai V.

description: The medusa is heaven. I've been craving it since I came to this restaurant last week. I wish they sold pizzaz by the slice
author: Betty T.

description: This is the best pizza that I've had in San Francisco!  So many awesome and friendly people working here and the service: eat in, take out and delivery is stellar. I have tried several combinations of toppings on the pizzas there and they are all amazing. The gnocchi and the cheese garlic bread are also super good. The steak sandwich is great, the steak is marinated and the bread is so fresh and super yummy.  If you haven't been, you need to get over to Inner Sunset and bring your appetite!
author: Amanda G.

description: fun atmosphere. Ample seating, good old fashion pizza and Italian food in general with a decent selection of wines and beer. The price is astronishing. Great place for families or after work with your buddies.
author: Mercy V.

description:
The title of this can be "ho hum."  The previous poor reviews on their service are true. Even though the place was moderately busy (3 PM on a weekday) the service was on the slow side. My water glass was empty before I got the attention of the waiter to fill it. The waiter was courteous and pleasant but kind of busy, for serving us properly, when we needed something. 

The prices were higher than what I have seen on menupages.com or anywhere on the net. An Italian restaurant competitor who has been just across the street for sixty years folded ten days ago and I assume that prices were increased at Pasquales's shortly after the demise of Villa Romana. Economics is what it is and I do not blame them for the price increase.

My wife's request was botched, but it was an honest mistake. She asked for Calamari with the tartar sauce on the side. It was put on the bread instead. The mistake was fixed but when the sandwich was reheated, the fries were fried or cooked a second time, so she had well done fries. As she put it, "double fried fries." She was unhappy about that.

My wife did not think that her calamari was very good. It had tartar instead of marinara sauce. Two stars. 

As for my chicken parmigiana; I guess I am a New Yorker spoiled by great Italian food in my hometown of Brooklyn.  This did not measure up to what I am accustomed to having in an Italian restaurant. The parts of the sandwich were there but they did not add up to a good sandwich. There was no blend, it tasted as if I had the separate parts but no chicken parmigiana taste. I took the cheese and tomato sauce from a slice of pizza and put it in the sandwich to make it a kind of pizza sandwich with chicken but it still did not have a good taste. I will not order this sandwich again, it is too much of a disappointment. Maybe two stars. Maybe less.

We both had French fries with our orders. It looked like these fries were from the bottom of the bag. Little nubs with very few long ones. Their taste was below average and my wife said that McDonald's has better fries. One star.

We also ordered a 16 inch pizza. I liked the taste of the crust. It had a good flavor to it. It was a bit thicker than I like though. The rest of the pizza (cheese and tomato sauce) would get three stars. In NY it would get two stars but I understand that I am not in Brooklyn.  

Appreciate that this place takes credit cards (but not Discover). So many places do not take them.

Also, no music at all was playing. I guess that is better than having to hear Frank Sinatra in an Italian restaurant. 

No Television. I do not like TV anyway. 

Bathrooms were clean, that is good.
author: Steven G.

description:
First off I'm going to give this place 1 star. I ordered salad, and alfredo from this place. I work as a mechanic, so naturally my hands get dirty. I finally was able to order lunch since I was hungry and when I got my food there was no utensils, no fuckin fork!! I would understand if they made a mistake but they said condescendingly that I did not request utensils. How the fuck am I going to eat?! With my hands, salad and pasta? They said they are not going to send a delivery guy out just for that, and so I asked to speak to the manager. I kept playing phone tag with them because they kept saying the manager was busy. Finally I got to speak to the manager and he was not apologetic at all. He said if they have time, a delivery guy will come out to drop off the fork. What fuckin restaurant doesn't give you a fork? Pasquale's has to understand that some people order from their work and there is no fork or utensils available. They should include that. What are they that cheap to not put a dam plastic fork inside?! Even Chinese restaurants provide chopsticks and forks without you even asking. Fuck this place. They are insensitive and rude as fuck. 
Go to Paxie's pizza on Irving. They blow this shit hole out of the water. I was a paying customer of Pasquale's for awhile now, but when they pulled this shit on me over a dam fork, I'm good. They are petty and can't see how other customers feel. They are just thinking their way about sending a guy out would be too much trouble for them over a stupid fork.
author: Alex C.

description: The food here is good, but it always takes a really long time, whether eating in or taking out. We gave it several tries, but last time we waited so long that we've decided not to go back again.
author: Susan B.

description: Super delicious pizza!!! Lovely old restaurant, super easy to get to from SFSU take the 28 to Irving
author: Katelyn K.

description:
Used to be my absolute favorite but right now, I am so beyond annoyed with Pasquales and their service.

Ordered a pizza- half cheese half pepperoni/mushroom, the delivery came quickly, but it was the wrong pizza. My boyfriend was starving and even though I told him not to eat the wrong pizza he took a bite. 

I called Pasquales and explained the situation, with no apology or offer to send over a replacement.

Called back, planning to reoder and REPAY for a brand new pizza because I am allergic to items on the pizza that was given to us- my boyfriend was fine with it, but i wanted the pizza we originally ordered

when I called, they said they were already sending over a new pizza and though I thought maybe they were confused, I verified my address and they said a new pizza would be coming shortly.

an hour has gone by, no new pizza. Clearly they are sending a new pizza to whoever got out original order....

I am now making my own dinner tonight and will not be ordering from Pasquales again.
author: Erin G.

description: Crispy, crunchy, and delicious pizza at Pasquale's!  The service is friendly with minimal decor, but honestly, who comes for decor at a pizza parlor? The toppings are fresh and I especially like how thinly the cooks sliced the mushrooms. It wasn't like a chunky chewy bite that you'd sometimes get at other pizza joints. My only gripe is that I wish there was a finisher of sea salt and evoo on the pizza prior to serving. The crust, although delicious, was bland and needed a salty kick.
author: Josh S.

description: Went to dinner here last night was seat wait ten minutes for service and young man comes to our table and says you need to move we have another party that wants this table, YES this really this happened!!!!  I asked for manager but he was too busy to talk and so older Chinese lady comes to tell us it's a misunderstanding and apologize, only after I made a scene.  We walked out of this dump it's a total disrespect and discrimination the way we were treated.
author: shimmerSF M.

description: They deliver to my neighborhood which is awesome since some neighboring places won't. This place is always consistent and I love it. Delivery is on time, every time (sometimes sooner which is never terrible!) I always ask for extra thing and extra crispy. SO yummy!
author: Parasto S.

description:
I went here for lunch. We ordered a large house special pizza. There was a good amount of toppings and the crust was nice and thin. Overall the pizza was just great. It wasn't too busy during lunch. 

Service was pretty good.
author: Alexander L.

description:
We wandered into Pasquales,  looking for a bite before a Segway Tour in Golden Gate State Park.  The vintage sign brought us in.

We had a great pizza.  Very fresh and flavored by the vegetables and not a mix.  We love thin crust!  They knew we were in a bit of a hurry and got our meal to us quickly so we could eat at a more leisurely pace.  I'd like to eat a full meal there some time on a future visit to San Francisco.  It had a great neighborhood feel.
author: Carol M.

description: A very good solid restaurant. Cheap eats for when you don't want to cook at home. The Pizza's are good but I also like the dinners. They have a broad menu and the Hamburger steak is probably the best deal in the city, The chicken Jack is another favorite of mine. This is an unpretentious place, with the decor that comes from standard diner from the 50's/60's. If you are into upscale posh surroundings, this is probably not the place for you. But, if you are into good food for a great price with nice folks running the place then this is for you. Come check it out.
author: David K.

description: Neighborhood joint that's been around forever and I hope it never leaves.  Pizza is good, not the absolute best thing you've ever heard, but very reliable and consistent.  You can dine in and indulge on cheap wine/beer or order for takeout/delivery.  I usually call in advance and walk over since they are so close and my pizza is always done on time without any problems ever arising.  This is my favorite option in the neighborhood (not counting Arizmendi) as it beats everyone else by a mile on price + consistency of product.  Patxi's is almost 150% more expensive for the exact same pizza, crazy.  This place is also a local spot, hard to beat!
author: Daniel C.

description: Delicious food and very nice staff, I haven't been here for years and still remember the same taste as before,  mmm good food
author: Valeriana L.

description:
Cowabunga! I love pizza and this place is my kind of pizza. Thin crust, hand tossed, and fresh ingredients. And from what I hear, this place has been around forever. 

I ordered a large sausage pie and it was magnifico. The thin crust was slightly crispy and the sausage wasn't overwhelming. Easy on the sauce and evenly covered with cheese, a slice was perfect for folding in half, gobbling down, or sharing with friends. This is the closest thing in SF to New York style pizza. 

They open at noon till 1am on Fridays and Saturdays. Others days, they close at midnight. Reasonable prices and plenty of seating. 

Ahhh...good eats.
author: Lloyd B.

description:
I love their huge platters of food here.  They always give their food in great portions and they are not that expensive at all.

This place reminds me of a lower end il fornaio.  I am always happy to get the seafood spaghetti here and there's usually no wait at all.  Great place to eat if you're in that side of town and there are tons of tapioca places you can go to as well around the neighborhood if you're interested.
author: Danny C.

description: This place is excellent!  The real deal. Authentic. Large menu - pizza, pasta, sandwiches, specialty dishes. The minestrone soup tastes like homemade and just like my nonna used to make. The garden salad is good and the pizzas and lasagne were excellent. Service is fast and attentive. Will definitely be back when in SF.
author: John G.

description:
This is pizza that I remember as a kid.  I've been looking for pizza like this.  I love most pizza.  One of my favorite foods.  I was searching around for a new one to try tonight.  i have driven by several times, and finally said, lets order one.  

I got a medium pepperoni and sausage and the pesto garlic bread.  It's fantastic!  The crust is not too thin or thick.  Crispy, with a good chew and a little sweet.  The sauce is just spicy enough.  Quality ingredients.  The pesto garlic bread is really tasty and not overdone.  So many places toast it so you cut your mouth while eating it.  This was done just right.

I'll definitely be ordering again and want to try the House Special.  I want to go and sit down and try their pasta dishes too.
author: David H.

description: 29 minutes after I ordered there is a delicious hot pizza at my door on a Saturday night. Love this place!!! Best pizza choice in the Sunset!  Do in it big in the new year as with every year.
author: Coco T.

description: There's a lot of pizza places, but Pasquale's is by far my favorite in SF.  Of course, whether you like depends on how you like your pie. Its crispy thin crust.  Which, surprisingly, is how I like my pizza.  I haven't tried their delivery, or eaten in, but their take away is great.  And their hours help, too.
author: Rik C.

description:
YIKES! 

Came here to grab food before the big fight. I ate here many times when I was younger, but this time; the pizza was a bit disappointing. I ordered the pesto chicken pizza. It was really dry. i didn't like it at all. I was really sad that they messed up. It took about 15 minutes for it to be done. 

Maybe they didn't put enough sauce, but my pizza was so bland. I'll give it a try maybe another time.
author: Adam J.

description:
Good pizza, great prices, but I feel like the pizza from ordering pick-up is better than when dining in. I really enjoy their thin crust, but if they don't bake it long enough the middle of the pizza is still a bit soft/soggy (this is usually the case when we eat at the restaurant). I like to eat my pizza on a plate, but for those who don't, your pizza might sag while you eat because the crust hasn't had time to crisp up. 

When dining at Pasquale's, we usually order about 3 XL pies for 12-15 people (majority of them are guys, and me the only girl in the bunch). Maybe the crust is still soft because they're trying to get our food to us as fast as possible, which is nice but I'd rather have a solid crust. When we do pick-up, we usually order an XL and it's usually enough to feed 4-5 people. I think an extra large with three toppings (sausage, mushroom, and pepperoni) comes out to be $21 and some change. 

Service at Pasquale's is nice and attentive, but we're usually the only table/big group there so it'd be hard to ignore us. Servers are great with bringing any sauces we request, and refill our water pitchers frequently enough. 

Pasquale's pizzas aren't ground-breaking or the best of the best, but it's a solid pizza joint with great prices. I wouldn't come here of my own choice, but my boyfriend and his friends have a sentimental attachment to Pasquale's since they grew up eating it so it becomes the unanimous pizza of choice.
author: Doris K.

description: This is my go to location for pizza in the city. My family has gone here for years and there's a reason we continuously go back, the owner and staff are amazing and hospitable, the food is amazing and everything is reasonably priced. Love this place and everyone I've recommended it to has loved it as well.
author: Sierra S.

description:
Pasquale's used to be one of the Very Finest Pizza Restaurants in the World.  Seriously.  No hyperbole here.  I've been eating here since 1970... and that is why this is hard to Write.

We called in our Order for Delivery and I had to repeat things over and over because the Phone person seemed to be having a problem with her hearing, or she was too preoccupied to pay attention, or maybe something else.  Either way it was like a frustrating boring scene from a bad sitcom.

It was delivered on time by a nice Delivery Man... but it was one of the Very Worst Pizzas I've ever had in my life.  The crust was like dough that was cooked a week ago, left on the counter all week, and then warmed-up.  When I tried to heat-up the slices in the microwave the dough became hard like a mutant uneatable cracker.  I couldn't finish it because it made my stomach feel like I'd eaten a load of cement.

Then I went to Yelps to see if anything had changed recently... and I saw this:

"Consumer Alert: Poor Food Safety Score!

Did you know that local officials inspect food service facilities to improve food safety?

Following a recent inspection, this facility received a food safety rating that is in the bottom 5% locally, and is categorized by inspectors as "poor."

Being in the consumer protection business, we care a lot about your safety and will display this alert for six months or until we receive a significantly improved food safety rating for this business."

Eat here at your own risk!
author: leesa M.
Brian J.

description: This place just lost my business for good. Tried calling in my order and was put on hold immediately. After six minutes on hold, I hung up and tried again. Again, they answer and say "can you please hold?" And then without getting a response put you on indefinite hold. I played this game four times in a row. Now I'm ordering food from Cybells now but hope the guys at Pasquale's realize that they just lost another regular customer. I wish I could give it no stars for them giving me no service, I mean they didn't even try.
author: Jeff S.

description: Pasquale's has become one of my favorites and go-to places not only for pizzas, but for Italian food. I came here a few years ago and completely fell in love with the items on the menu. I love that this place closes late as well! Nowadays, I usually order an appetizer and pizza if I'm with friends, but I have tried a good selection of what they have here. I am a big fan of their lasagnas and stuffed potatoes! The servers are usually always nice and they always come by to fill up our waters and pack up our leftover food. I'm so glad that even throughout the years that this place has not changed.
author: Victoria K.

description: I have order pizza from here for the past ten year. Today I order pizza and it looks like fell out of the box so I call them back. So they can fix it the worst service  I have ever seen . They wanted to argue with me. And wouldn't fix it. Bad Business. I will never go there again.
author: Amir D.

description: This institution will always have a place in my heart for it's nostalgia and longevity of the ambience and food. Tonight, my family and I decided to have a simple meal of fettuccini alfredo, half and half of cheese and pepperoni pizza, and a meatball sandwich with French fries. I personally indulged myself with a slice cheese which always satisfies with its great crust and sauce. If you're ever in the neighborhood, I recommend this spot if you have the time.
author: Anthony P.

description:
Two Cheese Pizzas And Two Sodas For $12.00 Dollars! 
Their personal size, but perfect for a light dinner. Also the guy who worked behind the counter with the SF hat was a super nice guy. He loved talking to people and loved his job.
author: Christian A.

description: Saw this spot while walking down Irving street last night and so happy I stopped by! I asked if they did take out even though they were a restaurant and the friendly cashier said yup! Anyways I ordered a personal cheese pizza for only $5.00 and they had it ready within 10 minutes. The pizza was very delicious and they had the friendliest employees... I will order again when I'm in the area.
author: Hoku L.

description:
We have been going to this place for over
30 years. Still the best pizza in the whole Bayarea   We live outside the city now and when in sf will either have one or pick one up to take home. We usually have a sausage , mushroom and onion
author: Chet W.

description:
Just read the September 2015 inspection report of this place.  Seven violations and none of them corrected as of January 2016.  Compared with the previous reports in 2013 and 2014 this place is getting worse not better.  Current problems include vermin, unclean surfaces, unsanitary food storage practices.  

Yuck.  Suddenly not hungry . . . . .
author: Yelp E.

description: 3.5 stars is far more accurate. I think the pizza itself is fine - nothing mindblowing but it definitely hits the spot when you're craving the kind of pie that goes well with beer. Service is fantastic and I like that it's open until pretty late. Portions are huge too, which is partially why I think Pasquale's is so popular. But I think when it comes down to texture of the crust and the overall taste, I'm more of a Patxi's kind of gal.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
We've lived in the Sunset for about 15 years now and Pasquale's is our go-to pizzeria.  The crust is not sweetened, stuffed or anything else.  It has usually been thickish, bready and delicious.  The last three years or so, the crust has gotten thiner, either to compete with changing tastes or because of the price of wheat rising.  In any event, it  matters little, it's a great crust.  We also are big fans of the antipasta salad--It's enough for 4 people and has a lot of great stuff.

The reason for taking off one star is that we've eaten at the restaurant and tried the italian dishes.  Meh.  Nothing bad, nothing great.  There are probably people who have frequented their italian cuisine more often so go with their recommendations.  But for pizza with a flavorful crust?  Can't beat Pasquale's.
author: JC H.

description: We order a large pizza every month to commemorate the night we had one delivered to the hospital when our kid was born. Since that night it has been consistently great, and delivered epicly fast.
author: Marci D.

description: Like they say, you've tried them all now try Pasquale's... Oh wait, don't bother. Mediocre even for drunk food.
author: Stephen M.

description:
well, I have to jump on the "good food, terrible service" bandwagon. It seems that they have really declined recently.

-- Placed my order at 5:10pm
-- Received incorrect order at 5:49pm
-- Called restaurant at 5:50pm and was told our correct order was sitting there and would be sent right out
-- Still no order at 6:27pm (we live 1.5 miles from the restaurant)
-- Called restaurant at 6:27pm and was told by first person i talked to "sorry, we are busy and deliveries are taking an hour." I told her that this was a correction to a mis-delivered order and was told it would get priority. she put me on hold.
-- Next person who picked up told me some story about our order being stolen from the delivery car and they would have to re-make it and send it back out.
-- 6:45pm and still have not received our correct order. my kids are hungry and need to go to bed soon!

We order from this place 2+ times per month (including many large orders for birthday parties) but will no longer give them our business. service is rude and terrible.

(should note that we had a missing item in our last delivery too)

UPDATE: got the order at 6:50. still missing an item (bread) and french fries totally undercooked and soggy :(
author: Jennifer P.

description: Best pizza in town! Just stopped by and picked up a large pepperoni. This is my first time trying it, I'll definitely be back for more. The crust is thin and flaky and crunchy and soft all that the same time. The tomato sauce is perfect! It tastes very healthy, I could eat it all day long. The group working tonight were wonderful as well!
author: Ari M.

description:
This is my go to pasta place. The chicken pesto pasta was super good, however the chicken wings which use to be my favorite were super super salty. We also order a medium pizza with pepperoni, garlic and tomato which was delish. 

Service was great like usually. 

Please fix your chicken wings, I don't want to stop coming here.. Thanx
author: Chiara M.

description: My favorite pizza place in this neighborhood.  The service is down to earth. The atmosphere is relaxed. Terrific pizza. Thin, crispy crust. Robust sauce. Perfect balance of sauce, cheese and toppings. Recently had a simple pepperoni and mushroom. The pep and mushrooms were quality. This pizza was so comforting and delicious. Rarely do I have a craving for pizza but if and when I do I'll get this pie again. Thumbs up!
author: Rosalyn W.

description: I used to really like this place, until I saw their most recent health score. 68/100. That is ridiculously poor. I really saddens me to see restaurant owners who do not care about the quality of their food.
author: Zach B.

description:
Really good food; love the pizza and the pasta dishes. 
Docking 2 stars for the terrible service: 4 of us eating and all got our food separately with about 10 - 15 minutes between each plate's arrival. My husband got his side dish a good 20 minutes before his meal, and my son's spaghetti with butter arrived last which was strange since it was the simplest thing we ordered. 
By far the unfriendliest waitress I have ever been served by. EVER! She was in a hurry, very brusque and definitely in a bad mood. Twice she knocked my son's menu out of his hands in a bid to put cutlery and napkins on the table and she sighed when I asked to see a wine list. Think I'll stick to their pick up/delivery.
author: Miss M.

description:
I just had a really weird and disappointing interaction with Pasquale's. Up until this point, they've always been my favorite pizza in the city. I work in the park and go there frequently, and have had many delivery orders from them in the past with no problems.

Tonight I placed an order for delivery and was told it would take up to an hour and a half. I told them that was fine and placed my order. I gave them my address and my card info and was told it was good to go. I found it odd that the woman didn't ask for my phone number, but figured they know what they're doing.

An hour and 45minutes later, I still hadn't received my pizza and called to check on it. And honestly, as someone that works in customer service, I'm very understanding of errors and wasn't calling to yell at anyone. I was then told by the guy on the phone that the pizza delivery was attempted but that no one answered the door and that they must have had the wrong address. He then said that they were supposed to take my phone number down but didn't, and apologized. He took down my phone number. I was then also told that my card hadn't gone through. I asked them why they didn't tell me this when I placed the order, because the woman had told me it was "good to go." I was then told to wait and that I would speak to the boss. The second the boss got on the phone, he immediately started saying that he didn't believe that I had really ordered pizza, and that no one answered the door. I told him that this wasn't possible, I had been waiting for it and looking out the window/purposely listening for cars. I also asked him why no one told me that the card didn't go through, as I could've just fixed that problem then, or known to have cash ready. It ended with him hanging up on me. I called back and he answered again and I calmly told him that he was being very rude, and wasn't even letting me explain anything. He ended this call with a "Ok, we won't be delivering it" and again, hung up on me. 

At this point I figured I'd eat somewhere else, as he had told me it wasn't coming anymore, and I had been yelled at and hung up on twice by this man, who is apparently the manager of the restaurant. I was very upset at this point, and felt that as a manager he didn't even bother to let me finish one sentence while I spoke to him. About 10 minutes after the phone call, I received a call from a different phone number, and it was a pizza guy saying that he was outside. He then saw me come down from my staircase and realized that he had been knocking on our garage door, which was why I never heard him. He also must've parked down the street, because I never heard or saw a car. At this point, I didn't have enough cash for the pizza and was visibly upset because of how frustrated I was. Ultimately, the pizza guy told me that it wasn't my fault, and let me keep my drink for free since I only had cash to cover the pizza. 

It was an incredibly unpleasant experience. I'm not sure if I'll order from them ever again. Which is heartbreaking, because their pizza truly is the best. I'd highly recommend eating at their actual spot if you're in the neighborhood, but sadly I can't recommend ordering for delivery from here on out.
author: Amanda B.

description: Great family style restaurant reminiscent of TOTO's in Daly City back in the day before the Bart extension. This my second visit in about 2 years. Fried calamari appetizer was fresh and tender served with warm marinara..my husband's seafood linguini was delicious and a generous portion...my sole had a wonderful lemony capers sauce with steamed, no fuss vegetables and side of pesto pasta....great attentive service. Parking is generally a challenge..but we got lucky. We will be back soon!
author: Maggie M.

description:
3.5 stars
Delivery under 30 minutes for Pizza and Spaghetti Alla Carbonara

They're pizza is always good. I stick to the basics, mushroom and sausage, but I'm sure their over flavors will be just as good. 
My favorite thing about Pasqualie's Pizza is the fact that I never feel like I am eating a slice of salt. 

Today, their Spaghetti Alla Carbonara wasn't all that great. First off, the piece of sour dough bread they gave us was not cook all the way. And secondly, there was not enough sauce for the pasta itself. It was a HUGE disappointment. I really like this dish too. This was my boyfriend's first time having it here and he said never again.
author: Jess W.

description:
The first time I ordered a pizza from there we had just moved into our new place. The pizza was great but the crust was a little soft. We like our crust a bit cripser so I had them cook it a bit longer the next time we ordered and it was great. This is one  of the few places in our neighborhood that is open late and is not a bar. We got back from a long trip, late at night and were able to get a nice dinner around 11pm.
   The place is a low key family type place, nothing super sophisticated or out of the box, but everything we have had is well executed and pretty darn tasty.
author: Atom H.

description:
If I could give no stars I would waiting 2 hours on my pizza still waiting pizza good, but not worth 2 hours waiting. And they put me on hold for 5 minutes to find out about my order......

Update- just got pizza an it is cold! Now I have to spend 10 minutes reheating? This is crap!
author: Astrea M.

description:
I have been going here for years and always enjoy it. Mostly picking up pizza, but this time I sat and ate there with a pasta dish and everything was good. Pizza,pasta,soda, bread. I liked all of it. The bread already came warm. The pizza came fast, and it came with all the toppings put on equally. I will go here again. Sausage is so tasteful! =) 

Honest Review! 
-Poison Ivy
author: Poison I.

description: Wings were amazing.  Garlic bread awesome and the meat eater pizza was a perfect finish.
author: Miguel R.

description:
This restaurant is truly a home away from home. The meat sauce they make for the pasta rivals my mom's (my mom would kill me if she knew I said that), the pizza is always fresh, and dore anything is simply amazing.
It's obvious that management cares for the staff as there are people that have worked there for 20+ years and that family feel environment is what has customers coming back for 40+ years and me coming back for probably longer. They genuinely want your experience to be a good one, therefore, if anything is ever wrong they will work so you leave happy.
Overall, great place to get great food either to go or to stay!
author: Carolynn R.

description: BEST pizza I've had in a long time! Lots of toppings, personal pizza only $5! The staff is super friendly and the pizza is cheesy deliciousness! I don't know what's up with the health alert, the place was spotless!
author: Monica M.

description:
I've come here in the past just to grab a personal pizza to take home. Pizza is always good and fresh although the counter service and wait can be so-so. The other night was my first time sitting down to eat here and I was more than underwhelmed.

We waited to be seated, which wasn't an issue as we were a group of 8. The majority of us have all worked in restaurants so while I understand a party that size can be a burden, we know how to behave ourselves and make life easy for the server. After the one server mistakenly thinking we had cancelled we were finally sat. Apparently they were only doing garlic bread and pizza at that time, I understand that kitchens will partially close at certain times but they should really consider having something like a simple side salad available also. It doesn't need to be cooked and it would just be really nice to have some sort of green side available. Anyways, whatever, we were aware. I had the Pasquale's Combo, the pizza was great as always. Hot, fresh, and greasy. Just how I like it.

The bummer here is the service. Before our waitress even appeared I was kind of off-put by the older lady serving other tables. I could hear her being rude to other people and it didn't seem warranted. Our waitress showed up (not her thank goodness) and she was better but not by much. Short, gruff service ensued with a ridiculous wait for waters and a miscount in the sodas. I know it is late and maybe you hate people... but when I was management this never would have happened and when I was serving this would not have cut it. Obviously the management of this place either encourages crappy service and attitudes or just doesn't care.

The food here is good but there is so much good pizza available in the city that I will take my money elsewhere in search of a pleasant experience. Maybe with a side salad.
author: Christina R.

description:
I've eaten Pasquale's a couple of times. The pizza was subpar. The place itself smelled like a gas leak, which was alarming and uncomfortable. 

This most recent time, I ordered delivery, and the total was inexplicably $4 to $5 higher than the price advertised on their own website. I agreed and proceeded with the order anyway because it was late, I was hungry, and there weren't many other options. 

The pizza arrived lukewarm, which is disconcerting because I live only 4 blocks away.
author: C. C.

description: Low key pizzeria with excellent pastas.  The grand parents and my teens enjoyed their meals. My linguini w baby clams was delicious. Al dente noodles in satisfying broth and a good amount of clams.
author: Elaine L.

description:
Seriously one of the best pizza's I've had.

We ordered the Great Western (BBQ sauce, bacon, chicken, cheese) and it came hot, bubbly, and delicious! The crust was perfect for me...thin and crispy - but not burnt! It was also MASSIVE for a large. We also ordered a half bowl of spaghetti with meat sauce that was extremely underwhelming but our toddler ate all of it. Hardly any meat in the sauce but it was only $5 and change.
 
Excellent for kids, families, college students - decent prices in a great location. Now there is a frozen yogurt place right next door - perfect family night outing. If you live in the area, they deliver pizza and pasta.

Recommended if you want something chill and warm on a cold summer night in the city.
author: nina B.

description: Pizza is great! Great service, I have eaten at their restaurant and have also had pizza delivered at my home. a little expensive compared to other places but in all I dont think you'll be dissapointed...
author: M C.

description:
After being a regular for 1.5 years I am officially never going back here.

My girlfriend and I were starving last night after both working all day.  We tried Paxti's but they said it would take over 45 mins just for a thin crust pizza.

Instead, we chose trusty Pasquale's.  My girlfriend can't eat much here because the bread they use is so chewy and always cooked to a crisp (she has lock jaw).  I actually always liked their sandwiches even though Milano's used to do a way better Eggplant Parm, sadly they are gone and Pasquale's became my go-to place.

Starving and tired as we were, we got take-out and brought it home.  I opened up my box and realized they completely forgot my fries.  

Not a huge deal, but I am starving and now am looking around my kitchen for something to go with my sandwich to actually fill me up.

I sit on the phone for a while on hold...  Then I get some young girl and she tells me either I can come get the fries or she'll give me a credit.  So I asked, "since you kinda ruined my meal you are giving me the credit for the meal right?"

She just rudely says, "I'll put the manager on the phone."

After another long wait I get a guy who sounds like a bad actor asking me how he can help me.  I explain to him that I don't have the food I paid for and was just transferred to him so I'm not sure.   HE JUST PUTS ME ON HOLD AGAIN!!!

Then I wait for another long while...   The same girl answers, "Pick up or delivery?"

I got super pissed...  

She tells me that the manager said that I didn't need his help so he passed me on.

What a freaking idiot, right??!??

I explain to her that I still need to talk to someone (I guess)  and he comes back on the phone.

I tell him and he starts yelling at me. " Come get da fries"   "So what?  We left da fries!"

I also took a bite of my sandwich and it is STONE COLD.   So I explain to him that I am a regular and have eaten there over 40 times in the past year.  I was hoping that that would get him to stop yelling at me.  He tells me that it is impossible that a sandwich can be cold and told me that I must have been late picking it up!   (they told me 20 mins and i got there in 15 mins, so I was actually early)  

But he was just one of those punk italian guys who never made it past the 3rd grade and decided to be a boss...   Obviously, he knows nothing of customer service and I am not really sure what he does know.  The food is mediocre, the prices got raised, the service is horrible, the decor hasn't changed in 40 years, and you actually get yelled at by fake mob sounding "managers".  As a real Italian, I hope this guy passes over his can opener and gives the place to a real chef and they put a real restaurant in this space.

I am not going to need the french fry credit because I am never going back and I hope this review makes more people not want to give him their money.  

I've been a loyal customer and tip really well even on take-out orders.  But never again.  At least now I have a reason to call it ASSQuale's.
author: William G.

description:
WOW I live a few blocks away and walk by here every day, and I had never wanted to come here. It's kinda dingy and kitchy, I don't know.

But my friend NEEDED some Italian food so I came by here with her. I didn't even realize the pizza place was connected to the green seating area with a full menu of Italian dishes. Friend ordered a chicken parm sandwich, and it was humongous. Definitely good for 2 meals.

Week after, we ordered delivery at work and we chose here. The cheesesteak was REALLY good. That crunchy toasty bread, amazing. Lots of flavor with the caramelized onions and peppers. I actually lived in Philly for 4 years and was not a huge fan of the traditional cheesesteak, but this version is awesome. The pasta portions are freakishly huge too.

They really need to work on decor, it bothers me. Also, the silly waiter completely forgot our drink order.
author: Vivian H.

description:
This place is a big problem it blames the driver for there mistakes it not there fault it's the driver I got a cold pizza and the manager requests the pizza back and did not replaced the pizza I wished the owner will call me 
Back and say I am  sorry for the dumb  they hired as the manager for this pizza place he should not be the manager of this place he sucks
author: Glenn W.

description:
The food was great but I've never had such a rude waiter. After we were done eating he came to the table and asked if we wanted deserts, I said no just a togo box please. He comes back and hands me the box and I go to put the pizza in it and he grabs it from me and says let me do it for you. So I say sure no problem and he boxes the pizza. He then leaves a bill for the pizza which was almost $24 and I put $30 in cash and was hoping to get two bucks back. He comes to the table and said "do you want your change?" I said just give me 2 dollars back. He then took the bill and mummered under his breath walking around the restaurant talking to the other employees and made me and my date wait a good ten minutes before coming back with change. Well guess what he did... instead of making it all one dollar bills he gives me a $5 and a $1 and some change. 

It annoyed me first because he asked if I wanted change and then made it so I either give him at least a $5 tip or the other remaining change. The dude had an attitude and was rude so I kept my $5 and left him the $1 and how ever much change was there. If he had listened He would of gotten a $4.58 tip on two people sharing one pizza. He wanted more than a 20% tip and was pretty rude. It's people like that who make good places hard to want to go back to,
author: Robert B.

description: Horrible.  Half the time they say they deliver to my address and half the time they say they don't depending on who I get on the phone.  I love the pizza but so fed up with the service.  Who doesn't deliver within a few miles radius especially with things such as postmates at this day in age.  Get with the times Pasquale's and you're losing valuable customers
author: Michael F.

description: The personal pies are AMAZINGGGG!!! Best idea ever and such a good deal. Specialty personal pie only $7 and enough for 1 person unless your insanely hungry or have no self control like me in that case get 2 and then you have two different pizzas for $14.
author: Austin Q.

description:
My Brother's family is staying at Koret Family House. This restaurant has been a wonderful experience for his family.
We went yesterday with my brother and his wife. Warmly welcomed by staff. 
Ordered 2 shrimp cocktails...very fresh and tasty. Had pesto bread....very delicious.
My entrée was the baked ziti with an extra meatball. The best ziti I have ever had. Just finished my leftovers.
Sis in law ordered cheese raviloi...she shared one with me and it was gooey cheesy goodness!!! 
My Man had spaghetti with mushrooms and he wasn't sharing nor did he bring home leftovers. Enough said.
Brother dear had spaghetti with claim sauce,  once again no leftovers.
Thank you providing a home away from home environment for the families of Koret Family House, your warm and homey food is so comforting during their difficult times.
author: Kimberly R.

description: My family has been coming here since the early 1960s and as a kid I'd watch them throw the pizza dough in the air. We travel all the way from the East Bay to come to Pasquale's. It's been over 10 years and it still is the best! Alex is the best waiter you could ever get! His family are loyal Pasquale employees. This business is built on the best foundation - delicious authentic food, excellent customer service, and loyalty to their employees. They place their values on what counts!
author: Rose H.

description: Cheap, easy, fast, and it does the job just like, well ya know
author: Bryce P.

description: Just ate here this evening after an appointment at UCSF and I have to admit that we totally loved the food. Great pizza and pasta.
author: Ed L.

description:
The food is good! I recommend it to anyone traveling to San Francisco. 

We ordered steamed clams/mussels, shrimp salad and half sunset and pepperoni/jalapeño pizza. 

Mita was our waitress's and she did a fantastic job! 

My friends and I will defiantly stop by Pasquale's when we are in town.
author: Stacey N.

description: Good tasting food. Big portions and reasonable prices.    More casual atmosphere!   I had the shrimp w white wine sauce.   Very good!
author: Lorina B.

description: Had sausage and salami pizza, and I was surprised at how good it was. The person I was with loved it too. I hope to go back to Pasquale's many more times.
author: Denise C.

description:
Dinner again with the same couple 4/2/16.

This has become one of my favorite restaurants in the City!  Chicken Piccata and the House Special pizza were highlights of this meal.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Terry S.

description: I enjoy pizza! Over the past few years it's been hard to find good pizza in California. Well I found it! This place is the bomb. Great food don't miss out!
author: David D.

description:
IT'S A %^&*() to find parking around here. I could have walked here from home faster.

2 birthdays, 10 people, 3 XL pizzas, & 2 family sized salads on a Sunday after church.

It was relatively empty when we came for lunch today, which was a good thing because everyone had a problem trying to find parking so we wouldn't have to move tables or hurry up and order.

Ordered:

~1 XL Meat Lover Pizza: pepperoni, beef, salami, & sausage.
SO good, one of my favorites, LOTS OF MEAT!!!!!! 

~1 XL House Special Pizza: Sausage, mushrooms, pepperoni, & salami.
Similar to the Meat Lover Pizza, so good, very classic.

~1 XL Make your own pizza: Chicken & Pesto Pizza, it was good but not as good as the rest. 

~2 family sized Mixed Green Salads with Italian dressing: yumm mushrooms, garbanzo beans, kidney beans...originally we wanted to order 1 mixed green salad but the waiter told us that it's only a bowl, so he offered to get us family sized salads instead.

Pizza crust is thin, and sort of burnt at the bottom. Stuff sometimes falls off the pizza easily, luckily there are plates, forks, & knives. I didn't use any of my silverware, so my hands got really greasy but it made it easier to eat. 

Everyone left really full, so 4 stars. Good times, good times. 3 pizzas, & 2 salads including tax & tip was about $108.
author: Kylie L.

description:
We were here on a Friday night for second dinner.  We just walked right in and ordered a medium pizza.  It took about 15 minutes and it was done.  It was like there was nobody else in front of us.  Don't know if that's good or bad, or maybe they just weren't busy at that exact moment.  Either way, it was done quickly.  When I came back to pick up the pizza, the cashier asked us to pay again.  I told her we already paid and she figured it out.  We ordered that pizza to go, so I can't comment on the service.

The crust is very consistent and doughy, love it.  The sauce was pretty flavorful.  The only toppings we got were pepperoni and mushroom.  The pepperoni didn't have much taste to it.  I think it should have been toasted a bit more to brown/blacken the edges.  At least the mushrooms weren't soggy like at other places.  Overall, I like Pasquale's.
author: Wally W.

description:
Personal pizza is around $5 or $5.50 and up. Considering a single slice at most places costs $3-4, this is a pretty good deal. Thin crust. 

If you prefer thicker crust with more substance, head to Cybelle's Front Room on 9th/Judah. They also have personal pizzas.
author: I Like T.

description:
Decent late night pizza and wings. The salami and mushroom pizza is my favorite! Calamari isn't bad either.

However, this place is not worth it at all for the non-pizza dishes, I would rate it 2 stars in that regard. Stick to the pizza.
author: Nic B.

description: This is our go to take out.  Great pizza.  That said, tonight we had a not so great experience. Ordered a medium pizza at 6:30pm. Was told it would arrive in 45 minutes to an hour. It finally arrived at 8:10pm, nearly cold. Such a bummer. And, hey, I get it... restaurants get busy, but in this case, I'd say that the ball was dropped.
author: Jodi H.

description: This place is good at what it's supposed to be--American-style pizza. It's not fancy or trendy so spoiled San Francisco snobs need not come. However, if you want a good version of the classic Italian-American experience, grab a slice!
author: James W.

description: I swear my friends know exactly where to be eating. My group of 4 and I came into this place at around 8pm on a Friday night with empty stomachs and a hankering for some pasta. All I have to say is the portions here are AMAZING! My dish (which I forgot the name of unfortunately) was so rich in Flavor! I wish I remembered it. The garlic bread is also a necessity here! It tied together the meal so well. Overall, this place has great food, great proportions for the hungry, and doesn't break your wallet! Very chill environment & you can order pizzas to go here too if you don't want to opt in for the dine in area.
author: Kai S.

description: Excellent pizza! I've wanted to eat here for years on the recommendation of friends, and I was finally able to go last night. Definitely worth the drive up from Burlingame. The house special pizza is phenomenal, while my wife got the Pompei, which was also very good. We'll definitely be back! Order the personal if you're looking for a pizza for one. The small is huge!
author: Matt S.

description:
Mediocre food and bad service. 
Grabbed food to go from here once before so as a group we decided to head on over late night. 

We were quickly seated and the restaurant wasn't too busy. 

After our waitress told us she had no recommendations, we ordered three dishes and an appetizer. My dish was the veal parmigiano with vegetables and pasta. To my surprise, the pasta for my dish was brought out first out of everything we ordered. Our waitress let us know that "the pasta side is served first here, that's just how it is". The other two entrees then arrived five minutes later. Five minutes after that our garlic bread appetizer arrived. Then, fifteen minutes after my side was brought the rest of my dish was delivered. It's worth noting that I got to watch my dish sit on the counter while our waitress ignored it to expediate the order of a table of her friends who arrived after us. 
The bad service continued thru the rest of our meal as our waitress continued to ignore us, telling us at one point that it was nothing personal and that they were understaffed that night(while she continued to talk to her friends). 
At the end of our meal we had to wait for our waitress's her friends to tell her that we had been staring at her for over 10 minutes so that we could get our check. 

More than the food quality(more on that in a second), what dissapointed me the most was the poor service and being ignored by our waitress. 

As far as food goes, everything was mediocre at best. The pasta sauce was basic and flavor-less. The vegetables on the side of the dish didn't even have any seasoning. Our table also ordered the Chicken Dore(sp?) with fries in which there was a beyond liberal use of lemon juice. The fries were half-hazardly tossed in the side and thus were let to sit and soak in a copious and near unbearable amount of lemon. 

Overall our experience was unfortunately very poor. It seems this spot is a somewhat popular local pizza delivery joint, and it's probably best left as that unless they make some serious changes both in the kitchen and out front.
author: Kevin M.

description: Went here with my buddy who LOOOVVVVES this place. Truth be told it lived up to the hype. We had the house special pizza (pepp, salami, mushrooms, and sausage) ... It was Goooooodddd. The sauce is boss! We also tried their hoy sourdough bread...good stuff. I went ahead and gave them a full 5 stars because the good pizza was married with GREAT service. Seemed like this place is both a go to joint for travelers and locals. Try this place out, you won't be disappointed. And remember if you want good pizza in San Fran, look for the 'stache...
author: Amado H.

description: Don't waste your time. I called an hour after ordering and they had not even made it yet. It was 3:00 in the afternoon. Not the dinner rush, not a complex order, just food for my kids. They didn't even try to accommodate me or apologize just told me to wait longer. Inexperienced staff that works in an old business that has stopped taking pride in their product.
author: Chris B.

description:
Yuck this pizza taste worst than little ceasars.

The place is very dirty and the service is horrible. When u walk in they look at you and go back to picking their nose and scratching their arm pits.

After eating just 2 slices of cheese pizza I was sick all night and vomiting.

My wife also got sick. 

If you are looking for good pizza or even edible pizza this is not the place
author: iron s.

description:
Would have given 4 stars, but had to hold one back because of not knowing their ingredients for those who suffer from food allergies.

Food is great, service has always been great. The pizza is some of the best in this area of the city. Highly recommended - but do be careful if you have food allergies. They seem to not really know what ingredients are in there food. A member of our group asked specifically if one of their sauces used wheat flour as a thickener and was told that they do not use it... yet, that person suffered a horrible gluten reaction as they have a food allergy. So, either they don't know what they use or they just don't care about their customers who have dietary restrictions or food allergies.

So... food is great, service is great.. just be careful if you have food allergies and go to this place.
author: Marc C.

description:
Pizza was average. Depending on who you get that works there, they try to over charge you for toppings. One time I ordered half 2 topping and half different 2 toppings and they insisted on charging me for four toppings. After an argument for 5 minutes I walked out, called and ordered and the person on the phone charged me correctly for 2 toppings.

Well done.
author: Clay S.

description:
Seeing all the hype my friends told me about this place made it more disappointing for me. We ordered the house special pizza (sausage, pepperoni, salami, and mushrooms) and it was alright. Don't get me wrong, it's better than those fast food pizza places you go to, but it was not amazing enough for me to go here more regularly. 

One thing that I really did not like was how after a while, the bottom of the pizza gets soggy from all the oil seeping through. It made it very unenjoyable for me after a while. Tip of advice, eat the pizza FAST and you don't have to worry about this problem.

The price is reasonable though so it's not like you are getting ripped off. It is just a typical local pizza joint for me.
author: Spencer E.

description: I would give it no stars if possible. Used to be very good.  Took forever to place our order. We ordered two pasta dishes.  Our waiter delivered the someone other customers's meals to our table.  We sent those back.  Then another waited delivered one correct dish and another dish we didn't order which we sent back.  After about 45 minutes and still no meal we gave up and left.  Our waiter was so stressed out he was trembling and sweating.  There were plenty of others who could have helped him out put nobody did. They were just standing around.  We've been going there for over 30 years but we'll never go back.
author: Jan M.

description:
We've been ordering  from Pasquale's once or twice a week for a couple of years now.
Have to say the food is good.

However, the manager is the rudest I've ever come accross. 

Our pizza was delivered one time with something un-edible mixed into the sauce; it was a tiny rock or pebble and something else  that was un-edible; which had  the texture of a twig or grape vine. I thought maybe a vegitable wasn' t washed or something so I just continued with dinner untill my daughter spit something un-edible from her mouth as well; another pebble. 
So I called pasquale's to tell them. The manager said that wasn't possible. He seemed to think we just wanted more pizza. He asked how many slices did you eat??
I told him we noticed on our first slice and I have the un-edible items on my plate.
He argued with me for a few minutes and said ok if there is any more than two slices missing I can't help you and told me to give my eaten and uneaten pizza to the driver as he delivered another pizza. I was afraid to have another pizza delivered as the sauce would have to be the same one used on our first pizza. Well the driver picked up our uneaten pizza along with the 2 slices we started with. And I sent the un-edible items along too. Two pebbles and a twig or vine.
 I was pretty suprised and dissapointed that I had to even go thru this dance with the manager. I felt that he did not believe what I told him. 
He did, however call me back a couple of hours later to say it must have been from the fresh herbs they use in the sauce. And said he was sorry.
That was the first time we'd ever had a bad experience with Pasquale's. 

Untill last night. That is. And sadly the last time we will ever call Pasquale's.

 So We shrugged that first bad experience off and continued to regularly order as usual once,  sometimes twice a week from Pasquale's. 

Last night we odered a couple of burgers, fries and salad. The fries were cold. I thought that it would be ok if I just nuked them for a few seconds. But the burger was ice cold as well. We live only 14 blocks from the restaurant.
I called to tell them our food was cold. The nice man who answered the phone apologized and said let me tell the boss and put me on hold. Well the man returned saying "sorry the boss said it just came out of the oven so we can't do anything about it"
I asked what just came out of the oven..my burgers???
He said  " yes, sorry we can't do anything about it "

Pasquale's is history for us !!!!

There is Patix's and Irving Pizza near by.

So long Pasqule's.
author: Angela B.

description:
So ordered a pizza last minute as friend was coming over and recalled this place as I always walk by it!

(1) kid who answered the phone couldn't be anymore annoying like are you talking to me or yourself while I'm placing the order ?
(2) 3 simple toppings pepperoni, black olives and mushrooms and for some reason the pizza delivered had no olives but onions which we hate 
(3) deliver dude knocks on door and when I opened it he couldn't look any more pissed to be delivering a pizza lmfao order was $19.80 and gave him $25.00 smile sometime !!

Pizza was ok I mean who doesn't deliver napkins with an order you would think pizza joints had this down pact ? Anyways maybe it was a bad day overall for them all but I don't care to try it again!

I will give them this the delivery came fast then again the wrong topping was on it lol
author: Sharon L.

description:
This is my go-to place on pizza nights.  My fav is sausage & mushroom.  The thin crust is always crisp with just the right amount of tomato sauce.  The amount of the other ingredients, on the other hand, is inconsistent.  I guess it depends on who's tossing the pizza.  On our recent visit, we had the most sausage and mushroom ever!!  I hope we get the same pizza maker next time.

This is a popular joint, but not so crowded that you have to wait a long time, even on weekends.  It offers a very casual dining atmosphere and is kids-firendly.  Having said that, it is not a first-date destination.

A word of advice:  Having pizza to-go or delivered is highly discouraged.  It tastes great when it's consumed 60 seconds after it comes out of the oven.  It you eat it at home, you'll missed the fresh tomato/cheese aroma and end up with soggy dough.
author: Jean T.

description: They're not amazing. It's better fresh hot. The crust gets soggy after being hot though. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I've always been a big fan of Pasquale's pizza, but I had never had it inside the restaurant.  The norm for me is usually having it picked up and enjoyed among a big group of friends inside Yancy's Saloon on the same block.  Their crust is really pretty average and is slightly thicker than a good thin crust, but they definitely pile on the toppings.  Their Meat Eater and Charbroiler Chicken are a couple of my favorites.  It is countless times better once you've had a few drinks at Yancy's.

Pasquale's stays open pretty late, and I've always wondered about their large menu which features a wide selection of pasta dishes, meat and seafood entrees, appetizers, charbroiled meats and hot sandwiches.  I got out early from work one night recently to finally give the dining room at Pasquale's a try.  

The place was still pretty busy around 10 PM.  I made eye contact with the waiter who gestured to me to take any seat.  I did so as the waiter walked over, greeted me and placed a menu on my table.  For those of you curious about the menu I've scanned and copied a scaled down version and posted it in the photos section.  I was a bit hungry and thinking along the lines of which dish would yield the least wait time.  I settled on the Half Spaghetti, Half Ravioli.  You choose between cheese or meat raviolis.  I had the cheese.  Meatballs can be added to any of the traditional pasta dishes so I asked for that.  They give you a choice of four sauces: meat, marinara, Alfredo or pesto.  I selected the meat sauce.

The kitchen was definitely working on a fast pace on this night.  Within two minutes of placing my order the waiter brought me my soft drink along with a partial loaf of hot, crusty sourdough French bread.  The little pats of butter were chilled solid so I moved a couple of pats and allowed the hot bread to hover over them.  Worked like a charm as the the butter softened a short time later.  Chewy and crusty on the outside, hot and soft on the inside the bread was excellent.

Before I had even finished my first slice of bread my pasta arrived (http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/5Q82x5hIwfWSF3XEeINkgQ/l).  The waiter joked that the kitchen was a bit slow that night.  The raviolis are big and round here.  I cut into a meatball and it was nice and firm (http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/VOjmVyvr-2_uXB432VWB8Q/l).  The meatball was excellent with good flavor, good texture and a firmness to my liking.  The ricotta cheese-like filling inside the ravioli was very good.  The spaghetti was cooked al dente.  The meat sauce had big chunks of ground meat and was good in flavor but a bit on the runny side.  I would have enjoyed a thicker sauce.

Overall, it was exactly what I had hoped for.  I got a delicious, filling, hot dinner with excellent service and very little wait time.  I'm sold on Pasquale's, and I'll be back.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Love the carbonara spaghetti!
Best pasta place by far!:)
They do deliveries too super late .
Prices are so affordable and big portions:)
author: Louie B.

description:
I've only been here once, and it seems to be a local favorite.  It was pretty empty at about 10pm, but I heard it gets pretty rowdy during the after hours.  

It seems to be a pretty laid back spot - lots of traditional Italian dishes, but without all the flare and pizzazz.  Their pizzas are made as you order them - choose your own toppings (50 cents per).  However, they are a bit soggy.  Sad to say, but it almost tasted like a frozen pizza you buy at the store.. 

Maybe I just needed to be more drunk... then, any pizza would be great pizza!
author: Cecilia S.

description:
Pasquales has everything covered from 
Italian style pizza. ( No bacon or BBQ sauce available)
Italian pasta options ( I don't see Alfredo though)
As well as the standard set of appetizers like fried calamari. 

And not that garbage that paradise pizza in west portal tries to feed over to you as fresh. Try comparing the differences here and I could almost guarantee you that you can tell exactly who's the smart mouth chef trying to serve you pizza from Lucky's frozen section haha.


I ordered the standard Pesto chicken and cheese pizza to see what they were like. Generally you can tell how lazy or how competent a chef is by the bare basics dishes he makes...nothing flashy..nothing fancy...

We have already seen what happens to wanna be high end fancy and pompous business owners' restraints on kitchen nightmares.. so no need for a repeat of that stuff right?

+2 on quick refills on the coke.--if your paying attention. You'll know when to refill.
+1 on pricing scale. nothing exuberant. Customer friendly for quality
+2. The chicken is thoroughly cooked. And the pesto doesn't kill my taste buds like what the Giants did to the padres at the end of the 2013-14 season.

If I had to put you guys head to head with Milanos. Purely on availability tho....man that would be a uphill contest for you guys.

Typically I'm picky what kind of options an establishment would have but being that this is a specific cuisine and not the average corner store pizza like roundtable or pizza hut. I can't fault them as i would the other two being that roundtable and pizza hut try to make deals on basic specials while trying to cover everyone's tastes and needs but skimp out on quality ingredients. Therefore when the next epic yelper rips them rips them a new one..they probably had it coming
author: Eric C.

description:
Soo gooood is what we kept saying since last night. We ordered pizza and sandwich for delivery. It is for a change as we always always order from Seniore's! What a nice surprise everything was sooooo gooood !
My eggplant parmigiana sandwich was still warm, the bread is perfect - so crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside, and right size of thickness..... taste is just excellent.  The cheese pizza is amazing. It had wonderful tastes, excellent crust, and just the right cheese. We picked the right pizza place!!!
author: Chung T.

description:
A comfortable place with a lot of seating. At first, I didn't realize that there was a restaurant portion in the back. It wasn't very obvious, but it's nice that they had a dining area. 

Service was great. They checked in with me frequently and did not rush our decisions. 

For me, the meatball sub was delicious! Definitely get that. Also, if you enjoy house fries that are crunchy, this is the place to go! 

I ordered a medium sized pizza with charboiled chicken. I get it. Chicken's difficult to leave juicy, especially on a pizza. It was just too dry when it came out on the pizza. In terms of the sizing though, the pizza was sizable and worth the price, had the taste been there too. 

Other than that, things were fine. Nothing too spectacular, but I was expecting more mind-blowing pizza. Maybe I should have tried one of the specialties.
author: Tek L.

description: Ordered the Meat Eater pizza and the fried calamari. The pizza was crunchy and overall delicious. We did wish it was more cheesy though. Unlike other pizza places that have limp pizza slices with ingredients that slide off when you try to eat it, the pizza we had here was mostly crunchy, the toppings stayed where they're suppose to, and it's not too oily. I deducted points from this place for customer service because nobody greeted us even after I went up to the register where 2 waitresses were standing and one was busy discussing how much tip she just received from the table that left. We had to grab our own menu and stood back in front of the register for 5+ minutes until the lady on the phone took my order. No hi, no apologies for the wait, or anything from her before she took my order. The customer service here is definitely lacking, but if you are craving for pizza late night then this place is alright. The pizza didn't taste special, but it passes for good pizza. The fried calamari was expensive and didn't have much flavor without the dipping sauce, but they were crunchy. Add your own favorite drink and you have a good late night meal option.
author: Mike W.

description:
This is one of four must go to places whenever I come home to San Francisco. Their thin crust pizza is second to none and should challenge New York for the King of Thin. 

I've never had bad service. The food is always amazing and I would die inside just a little if they ever went out of business.
author: R.C. S.

description: Couldn't agree more with the previous posters regarding the service. Just awful. The waiter Miguel has no business dealing with customers. What an unpleasant person!!! Unfortunate because the pizza was pretty decent.
author: Natalie B.

description:
If i could give this place 3.5 stars, then I would, but for now I'll stick with 4; here are my reasons why. The service was decent, but not the best, it seemed that too many people were trying to assist us and didn't know how much food we had ordered. We also noticed that since we had come in for a very early dinner (4:30 pm on Good Friday) that the place was slightly empty- and plenty of people looked through the windows, debating whether to come in or not. We also noticed that the restaurant was severely fast at serving our plates, especially in between times with out appetizer (bruschetta) and our respected main courses. I asked the waiter which plate was better (between the cheese ravioli and the gnocchi), she had no clue and this is worrisome. How can you not have an opinion on a plate or at least tell me what you think stands out more? 

My ravioli was made perfectly well and i really liked the red sauce, a very straight forward dish. My friends ordered the Mediterranean pizza and loved it. I would come back here again, especially on a cold night as their prices are reasonable and for the 6 blocks that I walked to get here, it was worth the decent meal. 

I would give this restaurant a 4 solid stars if their wait staff communicates more with each other (we had three different people assist us)... perhaps next time.
author: Carolina S.

description:
Family restaurant with good food. But, could definitely use an overhaul on décor and setting.
FULL DISCLOSURE: I DEBATED BETWEEN 3&4 stars. if I had little kids it would have gotten the 4.

I haven't had the pizza, but the Italian food is excellent. Much better than the Italian restaurant across the street.  Usually, order the stuffed potato dish...it is wonderful. The bread is also very good.

Ambiance of restaurant will make you want to take it to go, but the food is best if eaten on site.  to-go orders take way too long.
author: Sharine d.

description: Basicly in two words Pizza was great service was bad.  We had to wait forever for server to come up to refill our drinks after 15 minutes of waiting we just found bar tender and he did it.
author: Andrey P.

description: I grew up in the Sunset, in The City. I grew up 4 blocks away from Pasquales at Tenth and Irving. My family bought pizza at Pasquales from time-to-time. Through college at USF I would go there with my buds and to the one byt hte zoo and load up on the awesome pizza after beer soaked nights. My wife and I moved 55 miles north 27 years ago and raised our kids in Larkfield. I don't get to the City much. Today, I went to a class of 1970 eighth grade reunion on 12th Ave. between Irving and Lincoln. It was a blast. There was fresh crab, lox, Bq'd tri-tip...you name it, and wine and beer for any appetite, taste. I had two things, the fresh crab, which my buddy caught, and a slice of pasquales, by this time room temp and as a background to conversation. At the end of the party a lot of pizza was still there.
