I should have asked for it. In that moment when a friend since fifth grade and I were talking and commenting on the quality of the pizza, it all came back to me. This was pizza that was exactly the same as when we were kids. Every square cm of it was covered in just the right amount of sauce, a generous helping of sausage, a balanced amount of mushrooms, cheese and sauce. I've made and had a lot of pizza over the years. Some of it was pricey and trendy, some, fru-fru bullshit hipster, some was just plain bad, some was expedient, and some was just, "Thanks Lord for filling my gut.". Nobody makes better pizza than Pasquales. I'm back home in Larkfield now, having a Lagunitas IPA in my nice warm home with a fire burning and all of us home. I have one want...Thanks for still being there!
author: Patrick L.

description:
I absolutely love this place. The food is fantastic, the staff is friendly and relaxed and the ambiance is what you would expect at a neighborhood spot. They don't try to be something their not with all the bells and whistles of fancy Italian food. Its good food and that's what matters. I crave their pizza, and have driven across the bay to get it.  
My usual meals are either sausage and pepperoni pizza or gnocchi with cream sauce and chicken. 
Love this place, if its not for you that's fine, that just means more for me!
author: Natasha L.

description:
A delicious, super-inexpensive, friendly neighborhood restaurant...what more could you ask for?!!

Start with the Stuffed Potato alla Carbonara...trust me, you have no idea just how orgasmic this is until you take your first bite and your toes curl!!!  Chunks of potato, pancetta, and green onion mixed into a cream sauce and baked with cheese on top...oy, I can feel my hips expanding just thinking about it!!!!!

While the pizza is good, it's not the best thing on the menu...and this is a pretty complete Italian menu!  My current favorite dish is their Meat Tortellini in Alfredo Sauce....*DROOL*!!!!  It's SOOO GOOOD!!!  And the helping is HUGE, so I always get leftovers for the next day's lunch or dinner!

My partner sometimes gets their Meatball Sub...it's absolutely delicious!  Also a hearty portion, he gets it with salad on the side...perfect!

Coming back to their pizza...this is the only place in San Francisco that we've been to where they use real East-Coast-Italian-style sausage on their pies!  Rich and flavorful, this stuff is the real deal!  

The prices here will shock you...in a GOOD way!!!!  In a city where hipster restaurant meccas are terribly over-priced for what are just mediocre Italian-knock-off meals with tiny portions, Pasquale's prices are very low and perfect for people on a budget who still want to go out for a delicious, hearty Italian dinner!  The restaurant is also pretty big by San Francisco standards, so you can easily come here with a big gang for supper and know you'll get a seat!  While this place doesn't have much going for it as far as high-design is concerned, that's not the point.  The food is.  And most of all, Pasquale's feels homey, comfortable, and clean.

This is my current favorite place to get a low-key Italian dinner on a weeknight in San Francisco!!!  YUM!
author: Amy L.

description:
Used to come here all the time... It was one of my top 5 in the city... But then I Got food poisoning from a bad pizza... =-(
And now I will Never eat here Again!!!
author: Mitchell U.

description:
Complex equation.

First location excelled in simple pizza math: http://www.yelp.com/biz/pasquales-pizza-san-francisco#hrid:2L63cJzDMzkqXhA7qBfY6Q

This location tried to solve for a great sandwich: Fresh baked turkey accented Italian herbs with marina sauce instead of olive oil on a French roll. Side salad too.

Best ones versions are large (almost big enough for two meals), tasty (no question), clever (sauces preemptively put on the side for takeout) and high ROI ($7 indeed).

Answer to this equation is an enthusiastic four stars.
author: Jason B.

description: Best pizza in San Francisco:) Every time I go there with friends we have a good time, it's an awesome family place. After I take someone they end up loving the food and place. They are always busy which is a good thing makes you realize that the food is pretty awesome. Patience helps I wouldn't go anywhere else .
author: Karen U.

description:
One star for taste, yet horrible, horrible service. 
Last night I ordered our "usual" - Medium pizza with garlic and mushrooms for pick up. How hard do you think it would be to screw this up. Honestly, this pizza has 2 ingredients on it, plus cheese, how can you possible mess this up? When my BF went to pick it up, they handed him a totally different pizza with shrimp and bunch of anchovies plus some other mystery ingredient for $30. Clearly this was not something we ordered and they made a mistake. But the owner rudely claimed that "they never make mistakes and it is no way the person on the phone  could possible screw up our order". We had no choice but pay for something that we didn't even order or even liked! Just because we live in the neighborhood and have some sense of decency, we were left without a choice or apology. Really? Instead of admitting that the person who took our order completely screwed it up, you will tell me that this is exactly what I ordered and make me feel like a total moron? Sorry, never again! We live a block away and have been very loyal to it  for 25 years.   Pasqualle's will never get any business from us from now on.
author: Laurie P.

description: Pasquale's is the perfect late night pizza place.  If you are with a group of friends there's even a decent dining room to hang out in. parking is never to tough in the evenings on that part of Irving. The pizza is awesome!  Clam, Garlic and Pepperoni - the secret house special, shhhhhhh....
author: Dave T.

description: Food was great! Ziti, ravioli, linguini and clams. All delicious. The service was good and the prices were reasonable. I'd definitely come back again. Good place for the whole family.
author: Rachel S.

description:
I'm not sure if it was because I was exhausted and starving or because it's actually really just that good but this place was good.

I got a pizza to go and the wait time wasn't bad and they make it right in front of you which is cool.  The staff seemed very friendly and helpful and the joint seemed pretty genuine Italian.  If you're getting a pizza I would definitely recommend trying the sausage as a topping.  It was recommended to me by my uncle and it did not disappoint.

I definitely need to come back and check this place out again to determine if it was just the intense hunger or the quality of the food but for now I give their pizza a big thumbs up!
author: Dylan M.

description:
Delicious and such a great corner family owned restaurant.
My favorite waitress is Mita who is always always always friendly and warm.
Pizza and great!!! definitely the best thing on the menu, antipasto salad is HUGE and good to split between 3 or 4 as a starter.

Again, It's a great place to bring the family or to see authentic family style italian food. Great Price range and never disappoints.
author: Megan V.

description:
Che bello!  Che divertente!  Last night we celebrated an end-of-session class party at Pasquale's!  It was SO MUCH FUN!  The food was great-  fresh mixed green salads, and chicken salad was yummy.  We tried so many pasta dishes it sent us reeling.  But the big hit was the pizza.  Try the pesto con salsiccia-- or the Margarita!  Others loved the combo w/ pepperoni and salsiccia.

You can't go wrong!  It is the PURRRRRRFECT place to bring a group of people to have a fun, casual dinner with great service!  

Bravo, Pasquale's!
author: Lisa E.

description: Best pizza in SF for sure! I always get pepperoni, green peppers and onions for the big ones and a personal size cheese for the littles. The personal pizzas start at 4.75!
author: Hanster P.

description: they still DOUBLE charge for 1/2 and 1/2 pizza. there is no reason to charge for two toppings if you are doing 1/2 and 1/2.  i don't know of any other place that does this.  bad customer service.  we will continue to not patronize them.
author: Genevieve B.

description: Stright over charged me for the pizza. When I asked said it's probably tax. When I explained to the guy at the cash register tax is 9.5% and can't be 40% he just looked at me and told me I don't man sorry. I saw the guy take the money out of the cash register and put it in his tip jar. Shaddy
author: Riaz L.

description: I always order the Penne Chicken and Mushroom.  Great quality and consistent.  A wide variety, like, carbonara stuffed Potato.  I love their bread and pizza too.
author: Jim H.

description: Can't even begin with this place. Warm sourdough loaf with a side of Parmesan cheese. Then they got our order wrong but we couldn't even be mad because the smell inside of the restaurant almost felt like a delicious appetizer. Pizza came and it was perfect, thinly sliced vegetables, perfect sauce on a crispy crust that could only have been baked on the hottest of pizza stones lol I'm dead this place is amazing and their pizza will resurrect any one looking for a reawakening of life !!! Mita is amazing! Best waitress ever, sprinkled parm all over our leftovers (two hungry ladies got a small and had left overs) what is going on!!!! They know pizza very well. A must try for a foodie!
author: Gina G.

description:
Pizza, pasta, sandwiches, beer, and wine! What more can you really ask for from a joint like this?

The interior isn't particularly pleasing, but the service is friendly and the food is pretty darn good.  The house wines are super affordable, and the pastas are excellent!  I gotta say that the lasagna is pretty darn awesome.

Also, the bread is awesome.  It's just bread, but it's sooooo good.  Also, the portions are huge!  They also  heap the toppings on.  There'd be no complaining about scrimping here.  I also think I still have an uneaten slice somewhere... Whoops.

Also great for groups!
author: Emilynne A.

description: Just got the large Chicken Sunset. OMG. So good. Good prices, friendly staff and about 15% cheaper than nearby places. Definitely recommend this place.
author: Ezra C.

description: Could have been a wholly delicious and perfect end to the day pizza if not for the saltiness. Otherwise these pizzAs are a hearty package - crisp crust that keeps you coming back for another bite while you're still working on your last one, and a massive menu for whatever flavor pairings catch your fancy. Great for takeout too and group events. Seems everyone in town knows Pasquales.
author: Grace O.

description: Fabulous pizza!  We be sure to stop in when in San Fran! We get xl size pizza to take home to Sacramento area cuz it is huge! The home made Italian sausage is perfection and the eggplant topping is excellent!  No skimping here - you get a lot!  Staff is very friendly and service is fast.
author: Carol L.

description: Really good pizza. They definitely don't skimp on the toppings. The crust is cruchy and has really good flavor. The only annoying thing is that they don't have a website or online menu. It's 2015, come on!
author: Tanya Y.

description:
Best pizza in the sunset. One of my favorite pizza's in SF. My go to pizza for carry out.  I've never had it delivered...so not sure how long that takes... but a pickup is 10-15 minutes.

Their pasta's are also very good. My wife usually goes with the White (fresh) Clam Sauce or the Carbonara. The carbonara is made with cream...so it's not real 'italian' style...but is still delicious.
author: Zoran L.

description:
I live nearby and my husband and I eat here often.  I've also brought out of towners when we have a larger group and everyone wants pizza and beer.

I have always had wonderful food at Pasquales.  The fresh-baked sourdough bread is soooo good - it's the primary reason why I order a lot of sandwiches off the menu.  In particular, the calamari sandwich (with a super good lemon aioli) and the meatball sandwich are my favorites.  The size and value are great for the price and everything comes out hot and delicious.

The ambiance and service are ok.  They are trying with the decor, but it's an old building and it is what it is.  I've had some waiters/waitresses that are quirky, fun and attentive and some that are pretty bad, but when the place is busy it doesn't bother me much.  For me, Pasquales is one of the highlights of the neighborhood.  I know I will always have a yummy meal that leaves me satisfied and comes out piping hot.
author: Jill H.

description:
I really enjoy Pasquale's and their food. 

I don't think I've had their pizza in quite a while, so I'm not a good person to ask about that, but I really like their pasta. 

The mushroom and chicken penne pasta is one of my faves, as well as the trio with grilled skirt steak, chicken, and sausage. 

I think the prices are fair and reasonable, and service is pretty fast.
author: Alison N.

description: $12.50 for all you can eat pasta (Pesto,white sauce, red sauce) , pizza, and salad..score!  Only thing bad that I can say is not about this place, but parking is a hassle.
author: Justina V.

description: Normally, I would have to say this place is pretty good, however recently I've had a few bad experiences. After placing an order over the phone, I am told a certain amount of time, usually 45mins to an hour. Both times I have ordered, it has been double the time for my food to arrive. I decided to write a review this time because I called and asked the manager if he would give a 10% discount for the inconvenience. I informed him that this is not the first time this has happened, also by the time the food arrives it was after my sons bedtime (on a school night). He straight out said NO, there's nothing he could do, but did I want to cancel my order... Terrible customer service, and terrible service period. I will not be ordering from here again! Also, when the food finally arrived it was COLD!!
author: Ginger L.

description:
Mediocre pizza previously the best in inner sunset. Now dwarfed by Baiano on 9th. 
Pizza itself is okay but the toppings are low quality and the rest of the menu is rather bland. 
The one thing worth mentioning is that they charge FULL PRICE for half toppings. That's such a cheap trick - making pizza myself I hate doing half and half, but when you order over the phone, you don't expect to pay for 6 toppings when you only got three's worth. 
Imagine that. An Italian place with a shady side...
author: Jonathan B.

description:
I. love. Pasquales. 

They are well priced. Every item I have ordered from their menu has been good. They are open late. The servers are always nice. Their free sourdough bread when toasted is great. What more could I ask for? 

They are so close to my house I eat there maybe every 2 weeks. Is it the best italian I've ever had? No, but for the price it's pretty hard to beat. 

Some of my favorites from their menu are
-Linguine with Fresh Clams (white sauce)
-Carbonara  
-Rib Eye Steak Sandwich 
-Beef Lasagna

Too many people complain about their delivery service. Yes, delivery takes a long time, but they are always upfront with me that it will be a 45 minute wait. Also, their food isn't NEARLY as good when it's not served fresh from the kitchen. I also don't think they charge a delivery fee, so how can you complain about a free service?
author: Sam T.

description:
My favorite pizza place in the city. Brought some to my family when they were here visiting from France and they were asking about it the rest of the time they were here. 

Just the way they bake the crust so damn perfect it lets you pick up a slice without it getting floppy, but it's also not over cooked. 

Funny story. One time me and 3 friends went here at like 2am looking for grub. We wanted a Half Hawaiian Half Veggie but the order was mixed up and they just ended up making a veggie with pineapple and ham all over it.... It was probably the greatest pizza I've ever had. So if you're ever there and feel daring get a veggie Hawaiian combo. 

Price is quite fair too, 24$ for a X large I think.
author: Nick O.

description: Best pizza in sf..family run and would not go anywhere else.  Btw the rest of the menu is great too but never venture far from my fav pizza.
author: Kelley B.

description:
Great pizza! I've eaten in and had delivery and both were very tasty. On the delivery, they didn't include silverware for the salad I ordered and left out the cheese and peppers, which why I only gave four stars. 
All in all, this place is great.
author: Alicia J.

description: I absolutely love this place I ordered the house special pizza and the All American burger with all the fixings I can't tell you how many times I crave for the All American burger every week and is fabulous meaty, tasty and more meat than bread and it comes with fries YUM 5 stars all the way everyday thank you pasquales!!!!!!!!
author: Krystle K.

description: My ultimate favorite place. Love the owners... Hi Guy! If I were to die, this would be the place I'd have my last meal.
author: Mrs R.

description:
I love their pizzas here, specific their garlic and clam. Delicious! The crust is good and not overly dense. Sadly they don't have pizza by the slice, but offer personal pizzas instead.

I also come here for their pasta.  I'm always inclined to order a pasta entree and nibble off the shared pizza because the entrees come with bread. Oh my goddd their bread is soooo good. @_@ Not that I need any more carbs, but I can't say no to soft, fresh, warm sourdough french roll.

Service can be hit or miss, but nothing that would really put me off from frequenting again.
author: Jenna H.

description: I rather eat frozen pizza from a cafeteria, this place sucks don't eat there. You'll hate it. Terrible pizza and horrible service
author: Maria J.

description: This place looks like it has been around awhile.  Had a Medium  peparonni pizza and it was good but nothing to write home about.  It has street parking which can be difficult although I snagged a spot right out in front.  Overall a good experience but I would not  make any special trips.
author: Drew M.

description: I'm a huge fan!  My go-to spot for veggie stuffed lasagna or a pizza.  Love the free bread, they even make good appetizers when I feel like indulging.
author: M A.

description:
I have been going here since the early sixties.   It has always been spot on for pizza and the food menu is amazing.   There is nothing on it that I wouldn't recommend.   Hmmm...except maybe if they have eggplant.   Don't like eggplant but I do love linguini frutti de mare and the awesome calamari.  

This is a San Francisco must do.   Ironically, there is another pizza place across the street that is probably almost as good but I always go back to Pasquales.   Pasquales is an icon for the neighborhood and you will see people from all walks eating there.
author: David A.

description:
A solid local pizza place to order from or grab a slice from later on at night. Yancy's the bar just next door - let's you bring in food, so if you're craving a cold drink to go with your tangy sauced pie - just haul it on over.

The nice thing about Pasquale's is that it's laid back and also serves up a plethora of other dishes as well, so if you're a big party looking for some filling Italian food and don't mind lack of atmosphere - Pasquale's will do just fine.

Late at night when the alcohol sets in and places are closing up shop - Pasquale's usually gets hit up by the slurring glassy-eyed, so don't be too surprised if the staff behind the counter get a little short or quick with you. They're just trying to get through orders quickly - so they can head on home too.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Pasquale's has been my go to pizza place in the neighborhood for years now. I have enjoyed both ordering for delivery and eating there. I find the pizza so delicious! My favorite is probably just a classic sausage and cheese pizza. Their sausage is way better than many other pizza places. I really love Pasquale's and it has been in the neighborhood for so many years. If you're looking for delicious pizza for a good price, then head over to Pasquale's! You won't regret it.
author: David P.

description: Pretty good food.  The side salad exceeded my expectations.  This place isn't very nice, but the service and food were ok.
author: Sarah S.

description: Just ordered 2 pizzas. A medium house and a medium pineapple and cheese. What was delivered was a single medium  house with pineapple. After talking to the "supervisor" we were offered another pizza that would take another 30 minutes ( first pizza took 1'15") that we would have to pay for. In addition to already being charged extra for the pineapple on the house pizza. He told us sorry we are really busy. I'm sorry you've lost my business. On top of everything the girl taking our order was so mean. Figures.
author: Tuesday C.

description:
I was here for a late New Year's dinner with a group of close friends. We chose this place because Italian usually has a good variety of vegetarian dishes (a few of us were vegetarian) and meat dishes (veal for the carnivores).

I ordered the spaghetti with pesto, which at best, was alright. There wasn't anything particularly special about this dish. The others ordered veal, meat lasagna, eggplant Parmesan, and pizza. I cannot rate the food my friends ordered but I think they were pretty satisfied with their meals, with the exception of the eggplant, which had way too much cheese. I know Pasquale's is more known for their pizzas and I can say that the presentation of the specialty pizza my friends ordered was amazing.

I think we all agreed that the portions were huge too.
author: Lily Z.

description:
Oh, how I love you Pasquale's.

Pasquale's is my favorite Italian place to eat in SF. It's my backup restaurant when I can't think of anything else to eat. What's to love here? I'll name some of my favorite  menu items:

1) The Meatball Sandwich. Oh my god. I LOVE the meatball sandwich here. From the sourdough bread to the warm cheesy goodness to the french fries that come with it(if you ask!), the sandwich is delicious. This is my go to order when I don't feel like anything else. The best meatball sandwich I've ever eaten. A meatball sandwich to go is only $7.40.

2) The Frutti Di Mare. Now, I'm a big linguine with fresh clams guy myself, but the Frutti Di Mare with red sauce here is awesome. The pasta sauce they use here is just tangy enough to be good and the seafood adds a nice touch.

3) Sausage Pizza. It's simple, yet filling. Pasquale's pizza really hit's the spot. The crust is crispy and thin and not overpowering. The sauce isn't too sweet for the pizza. For the cheese, they use slices, and when it comes to your table, it's melty off the pizza goodness.

My favorite thing to do when I go here is split a meatball sandwich and small or medium sausage pizza. It's definitely enough food and you usually have leftovers.

Pasquale's also has a nice atmosphere. There decor reminds you of the usual Italian place, and they give you free bread like the usual italian restaurant. The bread here is sourdough though and it's delicious. The servers here are also really nice. The Filipino lady is fun to talk to and the man may be a bit awkward, but he is also friendly.

All in all, I give Pasquale's a 5/5. It's one of my favorite restaurants in SF.
author: Courtney Q.

description: Every time me and my boyfriend are in SF we always get some pizza here!!! So delicious and we are big pizza lovers so we know our pizza!!
author: Ericka C.

description: Every time I go to my Dads house in the Inner Sunset we have Pasquales [EVERY TIME].  I feel bad giving them 3-stars because their quantities are large, and their Italian food is good--it's just that I'm lactose intolerant, so I can't have the V.C.E Parmesan(s), white sauce fettuccine or Pizza or garlic bread.  But the rib eye steak is pretty good.  So you can share my pain, of being tempted but not able to eat your food!
author: Joseph T.

description:
I've been eating here since I was a sophomore in high school at Sacred Heart Cathedral about 22 years ago.  Pizza has always been consistently good and at a reasonable price.  It was definitely one of my favorite places to eat pizza around my neighborhood in San Francisco.  

After today, I think Pasquale's has lost my business. I'll stick to the pizza joints on my side of the Park in The Richmond District (Gaspare's and Giorgio's).  No need to cruise over to The Sunset anymore for this place.  

I got a half and half pizza today for the first time.  Normally, I just get one of the specialty pizzas.  I ordered an XL half and half.  I ordered a half specialty (Beef Mexicali - has 4 toppings), which was $25, and I ordered a half four topping custom, which was also $25.  Since they're equal in price, I figured I would pay $25.  But when the bill the came, it said that I owe $34 plus tax.  Wow! $9 extra for a half and half, I said? I asked the waitress why it was so much and she said it was $2.25 each per extra topping (4 toppings = $9). Wait a minute! I didn't get "extra" toppings.  I got a half four topping pizza and a half specialty pizza.  I didn't get a full specialty pizza with four extra toppings on top totaling 8 toppings throughout the whole pizza. I tried to explain to her my rationale about how I should only be charged $25, and that I was being overcharged for what I received. But she wasn't understanding my explanation, nor did she seem to care to rectify the situation to me, the customer, to my satisfaction. She said "that's what it is." I quickly grabbed a menu and read the menu again, and thought, if that's the case on how they charge for half and half pizzas, then it is a ridiculous ripoff!! I've never been to a pizza place that charged half and half pizzas like they do here. I don't feel that I've gotten $9 worth of more pizza with only 4 toppings on each half.

I hate to leave a place feeling I just got taken, but I felt that way after leaving Pasquale's today.  It's the principle of charging me fairly that weighs heavy in my book for patronizing a business as well as good customer service making sure that the customer is happy and satisfied.  I was pissed off for hours thinking that I paid $40 (after tax and tip) for an XL pizza that should've cost $32 (after tax and tip).  And after reading about the recent poor health scores, that helped seal the deal. Goodbye Pasquale's. You've lost the business of this native San Franciscan. Moral of the story, if you do come here for pizza, don't get a half and half, they'll rip you off.
author: Jason Y.

description: Delicious pizza! Get the veggie with pepperoni. Very reasonably priced. $30 for an XL. Hit the spot after a long day of moving!
author: Samantha B.

description: Really good pizza & pasta.... Delivery is usually very timely. Tasty, easy meal when the munchies strike  during the game!
author: J M.

description:
I love Pasquale's Pizza!
I really enjoy their crispy thin crust. My favorite is House Special Pizza: Sausage, mushrooms, pepperoni & salami.
This is my go-to place for weekend pizza night.

Delicious food and great service.
author: Betty O.

description: Had to wait for a seat, but it was well worth it! Food was to die for, authentic Italian... I would highly recommend his place!
author: Rich B.

description: Went to dinner with a group of 10. They tell us we can seat ourselves.  Then no one comes to give us a menu or anything.  Finally we get 2 menus for our 10 person table to share. We order our food which comes out in a good time with good quality but the waiter was the worst. Everyone has warned me about her bad service but man were they right. I asked for a refill and she tells me she knows her job. Then at the end with our bill of o lyrics 35 bucks and her $15 tip she gives it back saying if you weren't leaving a real one we coulda kept it and walked away. Lol you got almost 50% lady. She doest have a name tag but she's the older lady that works the back area alone. You can't miss her
author: Alonzo T.

description: Fast delivery, good drunken pizza fest :) I like the thin crust & lighter cheese fair. It's not a dough explosivo, which is nice!
author: Em L.

description: Great pizza. Nice blackened crust. Incredibly fresh toppings. REAL attentive waiters. Reminds me of being in Italy where waiters actually wait on you. What a concept right?!They don't get chatty or ask you "how is it taste?" right as you take a bite. Nope they just quietly check on you often and notice what you need before you need it. Wish customer service like this was the norm in the USA. I'll be back for sure.
author: Tara P.

description:
DELICIOUS NY STYLE PIZZA.

Order a pie for takeout and mosey on over to Yancy's for a nice cold brew to wash down yer vittles.

'Nuff said.
author: Anthony D.

description:
In my opinion, Pasquale's Pizza is some of the best pizza in the Inner Sunset. The staff have always been quick and friendly. They're one of the few restaurants in the area that stays open a bit later than the others, and the prices are very reasonable. I usually get some combination of sausage, green peppers, pepperoni, and mushrooms, and they have always been fresh and delicious. 

The appearance of the restaurant itself is very casual a little underwhelming, but you come here more for the great food than fancy chairs anyway. Whenever I've ordered for delivery or take-out they're also very quick.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
First off let me start by saying I am a very loyal customer & have been ordering from here for years.

Tonight really disappointed me...

I placed my order for 4 meatball sandwiches for delivery at 7:12pm.
In my previous experiences for delivery they would tell me an hour to an hour and 30 minutes, but the guy said 45mins. So when it was getting past an hour, I just figured they were running late. I called at 8:30pm to check the status on my delivery & was told all the orders were sent out & that it will be there soon. Another 30mintues went by so I called back at 9pm asking about my delivery & was put on hold for 5+ minutes. Frustrated, I called back again & was told that there was a "mix up with the tickets" & that they will start on the sandwiches right now ... SERIOUSLY!! after 2 hours they have not started my order at all & expect me to wait another 45minutes or so, meaning that I wouldn't be eating until almost 10pm.

I am so disappointed about what happened. My family & I love this place... & it's sad to say that I have to reconsider if I will order from them again or not.
author: C A.

description:
More often than not, Thursday nights are my cheat nights.  I drink about a bottle of wine, eat fattening foods, and talk so much sh*t that Karma's given up on coming back to me to make things right in the world.   So when it comes to the fatty food, we almost always choose Pasquale's to indulge in.  

Chessy garlic breaad, pesto garlic bread, spaghetti carbonara, bruschetta sandwich, meaty pizzas are all things i'm obsessed with.  The variety is so large that I can basically have a new item every time i go there.  It's quite a cozy place as well with friendly servers.  

As we pig out on the overly abundant amount of food and drink wine until brain goes numb, I can't help but think DAMN I could eat this forever.
author: Aaron G.

description: A little on the pricey side, but the pizzas are made-to-order, and they're done pretty quickly with loads of toppings. The pizza itself is a standard California slice with a semi-thin crust, but not NY style and toppings everywhere. The pizza could definitely use more tomato sauce, but I really like how flavorful and crispy the crust is.
author: Danny C.

description:
Was in the mood for a drive around town and despite the rainy, windy evening, it was quite a nice drive. I started to get hungry for pizza as I was driving through the Inner Sunset and Yelp for Droid came out for a spin. Clicked "Nearby" "restaurants" and a few pizza places came up. I decided to give this place a whirl despite the fact that Yelpers gave it a lower rating than the place up the street. Sometimes I just like to go against the grain and this was one of those times. 

It was good but not great. Tasty crust, nice and crispy, lots of toppings and greasy enough to not be too greasy. Don't get me wrong, I love the right amount of grease on my pie, but it can easily head over the cliff and become a disaster. Service was really good, young folks with plenty of energy and that's always a good sign. I would probably go back for more, but I saw a lot of giant plates of pasta and other tasty Italian dishes buzzing by the table as I ate my mediocre pie. I knew I should have followed my fellow Yelpers b/c they know best, but once in a great while I like to travel off the path and try something new. 

Good not great, will do the job in a pinch but not exactly what I was hoping for.
author: Hector G.

description: Good, reasonably priced, delicious New York (well, New York-ish) style pizza and open LATE! And there's ample seating as well. Nice to have decent quality pizza late night.
author: Jennie P.

description:
This place is weird. Me and my friend were craving for pizza that night, so we stopped by this place. It was busy, several people were standing near the host stand waiting. There was no host, so we asked the crowd if there a waitlist or something. They had no clue, it seemed they were just waiting for the restaurant staff to notice people crowding. We didn't want just to stand there, so we asked one of the waitresses. She said something like "We are busy, you have to wait". Couldn't give an estimate on wait. So I was ready to leave, but my friend was so hungry so we stayed. Both regreted later. 
Th food was awful. I'm not kidding. Fatty pesto bread. Mashy minestrone soup looked like it was made in the morning and was sitting in a warmer since then. Pizza sauce was sour like it has gone bad already...
Our waitress was not very nice at all. On top of her rushy service, she stopped my friend when we were leaving, and said that we didn't leave enough tip. Wow!
author: Rom M.

description:
Was this the worst night ever at Pasquale's ? When I have eaten with friends in the restaurant, the waitresses have always been really kind and attentive, and the food has been about a 'B." The guys behind the counter usually seem preoccupied and testy. I wanted to have Italian-American food from close to home one night; I decided to give Pasquale's delivery a try.

It was a Tuesday night at 9pm -- fairly early by Pasquale's standards.  I called to order some food for delivery.  The surly woman (no Italian accent there) who answered the phone could barely give me the time of day to take my order, which she got wrong several times, requiring me to clarify repeatedly.  I'm a clear speaker; not sure what her problem was. She was so ready to hang up the phone, she didn't even ask for my credit card number.  I had to ask her to please take the number.  Then she hung up the phone before telling me the time estimate for my food to arrive.

An hour later, the food had still not arrived.  I called to ask where my delivery was.  The same woman answered the phone and told me she would ask.  She put me on hold for a few minutes, then came back on the line to say, "They've already left; it'll be there in a few minutes."  Again, an abrupt hang-up.

About 10 minutes later, the food arrived.  A nice, middle aged man with an Italian accent brought it to the door.  I signed for it, and he left.  When I closed the door and opened my package of food, I discovered that the garlic bread with cheese that I'd ordered had not been included, but I had been charged for it on the bill.

Our fried calamari was tepid and greasy.  The salad had no dressing -- we'd never been asked if we wanted any.  The pasta dishes we'd ordered were hot and tasty -- thank goodness.

I called the restaurant again as we were eating and told the same woman what had happened.  She said, "We'll find it and send it out."  Again, an abrupt hang-up.  When the same man came to the door, he delivered a small pizza box.  No apologies.  Not from him, and not from the woman. He left.

I opened the box to find cold, burned garlic bread with cheese.

That was the last straw for me.

I don't think I'll be ordering delivery from Pasquale's again.
author: Luke A.

description: Just as I remember this pizza is one of the best! Try it you'll like it!!
author: Boss H.

description: FABULOUS food! We are in love with their Linguine w/ Clam Sauce - my husband loves the red sauce, and I, the white. We discovered it via my girlfriend, whose husband works at UCSF hospital, pretty close. We take BART to Embarcadero, go down one level to the Muni N-Judah (light rail) line. It's totally worth it. The clam entree is simply towering with fresh clams, steaming hot.  This is a modest decor 'neighborhood' place, oilcloth tablecloths - but the food - delicious! BTW, Jose, one of their waiters, is terrific. Great guy, good advice on their wines. Buono appetito!
author: Mara B.

description: We were in Golden Gate Park and looking for a place to eat so we walked over to Irving and looked up and down it for a few blocks and decided on Pasquale's.  Part of the reason was the old school Pizzeria look and the neon sign out front.  Being from New York originally, and now a Cali transplant, once I walked inside it reminded me of pizzerias I had been to many times in NYC.  They have a large dining room area off to the side of where the Pizzas are made.  We sat at a table by the window and enjoyed watching the goings on on the street outside as our Veal Parm and Eggplant Parm heroes were prepared.  One came with a salad other with fries.  Both were awesome and at a very reasonable price.  Service and atmosphere were excellent !  We will definitely be back to try one of their pizzas or a meal..  Great place !
author: Patrick C.

description:
Thank you Pasquale's for being consistently being the best pizza in SF!  Had your vegetarian with half Linguica and a mixed green salad.  It was great.
I am so glad you are within walking distance.  And you little single pizzas ROCK!
author: Catania G.

description:
Their Delivery is Faster than Superman on CRACK. :-D

This was tonights dinner:

Plain cheese Pizza for the BF, (and puppy) an order of Garlic Bread with Cheese, and Calamari for myself... SO GOOD.
THe Cheese pizza CRUST is crunchy, just how it should be. The Sauce- Not too much, not too little, JUST RIGHT. The Cheese is not overpowering the Pizza, FANFREAKINTASTIC!!!!
The Garlic bread w/cheese- standard, and not dripping with oil or butter ( winning!)
The Calamari- So, it melts in your mouth, its orgasmic. perfectly done. 

This is where I go on my cheat days from now on....

I've been here for a sit down dinner and their Wine selection is pretty good as well. No long lines to sit down and eat, and quick delivery. Just great service all around!
PARKING CAN SUCK, sooo be aware of your surroundings, you may be around my people on Irving who don't know how to drive.( I swear its our little eyes and bad vision)
author: Jen M.

description: The House Special pizza and baked ziti were awesome. We'll definitely try other items on the menu. Generous servings; their medium pizza seemed like a large. Loved how they baked it the traditional way and it came out evenly cooked, crisp, and the cheese melted with the other ingredients perfectly. You'll like the free bread if you're a sourdough fan. Service was great, the staff didn't rush us although it was a busy Sunday night.
author: Michaella A.

description:
I really like their pizza and their  tasty homemade sausage for it. And a great chicken Parmesan.  I'm sure all the food is good; but those are the things I go for. And I have been for at least 5 years. 

BUT, I'm rating it lower bc of the service. Please, owners, just train your employees to be friendly, a bit courteous and smile once in a while. Some of them are just downright rude. Not looking for 5 star service, just the kind that's nice to get from any decent food establishment.  Hope the owners/mgmt are reading these reviews.
author: M K.

description:
Food here was decent. Everything was good. The wait was incredibly long. The service took forever and I was already starving. Everything was good but not exceptional or extra tasty. I was craving some good food. 

The calamari was good. We also tried the meat sauce tortellini, which was a little bland but it was my favorite of the three. The pizza was good and definitely fresh from the oven. The cheese burned my mouth. It was much larger than expected so I had it for breakfast the next morning. 

For its price, I think the food was only decent. If it were a bit cheaper, I would have loved the food. Maybe I expected more? Which is weird because usually when I'm hungry I think everything is extra delicious :D
author: Josie W.

description:
Garlic bread:  wasn't garlic-y enough.  Great texture of bread though - crunchy and soft at the same time!  It took 15 minutes from the time of ordering to get our appetizer though, very disappointing.

Pizza:  We got the house pizza.  If you like thin-crusted pizza, this is the place for you.  If you love thick-crusted pizza, like me, you'll probably be disappointed.  My boyfriend loved it, and I hated it.  The toppings on the house were pretty good - sausage, pepperoni and mushroom. 

Spaghetti:  So yummy - the highlight of my meal, which seems weird since it is a pizza place.  I ordered the typical spaghetti and meat sauce, which really hit the spot.

I'd come back to try other things offered on their extensive menu, i.e. the veal!  Great family owned place, but needs to work on service a little bit.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Just got asked to leave because my toddler was crying. Your pizzas might be ok but your customer service is horrible. Joy or Joyce , the waitress , was extremely rude to us and was very disrespectful towards children. After coming here for over fifteen years, we are never coming again
author: Ana C.

description: I ordered over phone for pickup. When I brought the order home, I found that my order was basically completely incorrect. I had asked for a pasta with marinara sauce and received a cream sauce instead. Additionally, I had asked for spaghetti and received penne. I called them to inform them of the error, and asked if I could either come exchange the incorrect pasta for what I had actually ordered or if I could receive store credit. They pretty much completely blew me off, said they were too busy to even give me store credit, and told me to call them back tomorrow. Ridiculous.
author: Jamie L.

description:
I've been going to Pasquale's since I was young. Some businesses thrive on boosting a long track record of excellent customer service and a special family recipe; some businesses fall short, they get new ownership, their service worsens, their staff becomes hateful and slow. Through the at least 15 years of coming here... Not Pasquale's! 

They still have the same delicious thin crust pizza, with that unique tasting cheese that no other pizzeria uses! 

They make the pizza at the front, so you could watch. I remember coming here as a child, watching the pizza we ordered being made and the pizza maker would hand over a piece of the mozzarella for me to nibble on.  

I still need to venture through the menu and try other things, but that House Special Pizza is SOOO good!!!
author: Caryl C.

description:
It was bound to happen.  As the body grows older, the appetite grows dimmer.  I've been expecting this to happen for the past two decades as I shoved atomic hot sauced food into my mouth.  I have friends that are very sensitive to food.  I know people who cannot tolerate spice, flavor, texture or grease.  I thought that had happened to me!

One Sunday lunchtime, the BF, Marina and I were scouting the inner sunset for establishments where we could watch FootBall.  None of us had cable.  And we wanted choices.  We also wanted food.  The BF asked for Indian food.  I quickly shut him down.  Not just for my stomach's sake but for the people who may sit next to me in the coming days.  It's not pretty going in, it's even uglier coming out.  No, that's not true.  It looks the same coming and going.  Saucy.

First, we took care of the football watching.  Yancy's was a good choice because the front window room was rather empty except for some Bulgarians.  And they were eating a pizza from Pasquale's.  This inspired us to get some pizza from Pasquale's too.  I can't remember why I wanted to try the pizza.  It probably had to do with me being a big, fat, sloppy pig.  On any given day, melty cheese usually sounds good.  Yum.  Melty cheese.

Marina went down the block and ordered a huge pepperoni and mushroom.  I went with her to pick it up.  The pie was just getting taken out of the oven.  Into the box it went.  Chop chop chop chop chop.  10 slices.  As I carried the pizza box out of the store and back to Yancy's, I had to resist the urge to turn it vertical in order to make a 3rd Rock from the Sun joke.  

The pizza was thin but not paper-like.  The BF likes bready pizza (obviously insane) but even he was pleased with this one.  There was a chewy crunch to the crust.  The upskirt/bottom crust was sufficiently baked to hold up the toppings.  There was not too much cheese rendering the whole thing too salty.  There was a lot more sauce on it than other places but in a good way.  The sauce had zing.  Flavor.  And it did not squirt out.  The sauce was not sweet.  I hate sweet sauces.  Hate.  

The pepperoni had a very smooth salty flavor.  Not overly greasy curled up cups of meat tube.  There was an absence of bright orange oil.  The mushroom had an earthy flavor.  I dislike it when mushrooms are shriveled up and dried out on top of pizzas.  This place did not do that.  The mushrooms were cooked and blended well with the rest of the flavors.  

Since I make very good pizza and have no job, I do not frequently buy pizza.  But this place makes me want to get a job and develop the metabolism of a teenage football player so I can have pizza all the time.  

This pizza was employment-motivating.
author: Christina C.

description:
This review is long over due.

And I have to be fair and disclaim that it is a companion piece to my just previous review of they highly touted and PROFOUNDLY OVERRATED eatery that is Paxti's Pizza. 

This joint is open all the damn time, until they're not, and you won't know it, because they won't be anyone there to pick up the phone and tell you they're closed. Like on holidays - you want pizza on Easter? What's a matter? Don't you got no one to feed you?

The ambiance is Eat and Leave - they don't care about classing the joint up. It's not a 'date' place, unless you're in high school and you grew up in this neighborhood. It's a family joint. A neighborhood joint. It's functional, it's clean - and that's so much more than I can say for most of those take-a-loan restaurants we got around here. The counter girls are competent and quick and brisque. As are most kids forced into the family business when they'd rather be doing ANYTHING else. Never had a wrong order. You can watch them cook while you wait for your pie - I'd fucking hate that. I'll bet they fucking hate that. But I don't know, because I can't tell, because that would be bad for business. Bam. Such clean, assured logic. Love it.

The food is great. It is undeniably, consistantly GOOD.  I've had some pizzas from there where the heavens opened open and a choir of angels sang Ave Maria, I've had a couple that were over cooked or under cooked or cold. I've had cheeseburgers from this place, delivered, that are better than anything I could go out and sit down for - the pastas are the same, consistantly the same, in the restaurant and delivered. The sauce is always exactly what I expect, the pasta always as pasta should be. Al dente. Good balance of sauce to pasta. Great bread. That cannot be overlooked. The bread here is very real, bring a tear to your grandmother's eye. What I love is there is no big swing either way - I always get exactly what I'm expecting - solid, country Italian and hot sandwiches delivered quickly by people who got a job to do, and who care about doing it well. They don't have 'off' nights. Love this joint. 

Don't know why I ever stray --
author: Raina H.

description: The pizza here is pretty good, not bad! It's kinda expensive, but it's somewhat worth it.
author: Cara H.

description: LOVE this restaraunt! It gets packed around 7 pm, so we make sure to come early and always get seated right away. We have been there twice and both times out servers have been extremely knowledgeable and attentive. The menu is large and everything looks delish. We've only been here twice and have tried their shrimp Louie salad ( enough for two) which is served with sliced sourdough bread and butter. It was tasty and comes with dressing on the side. The Meditteranean pizza is soooo flavorful! It has quite a bit of garlic too so if that's not your thing you probably won't like it. We have also made our own pizza with pepperoni, green bell peppers and mushrooms which was delicious as we'll. The atmosphere is kind of hit or miss. The first time we came it was a great date night, but the second time around we had two screaming babies behind us and another 3 kids running around outlet table screaming and playing hide and seek. It was a little hard to keep our conversation going! They serve beer and wines. I will be trying one of their pasta dishes next time. Great pizza, great service- Must try!!
author: Cyn L.

description:
As a San Francisco native, I've visited my fare share of Italian restaurants.  My family always went to the Pasquale's Pizza on Sloat Blvd, but a change in chefs (or the cooking) pushed my family to try the Irving restaurant. To our delight, we liked Irving even better. Hands down my favorite pizza. The "House Special" is my family's pizza of choice.  Growing up in an Italian family, I am picky when it comes to good Italian food. You can't really go wrong here. Whether pasta, sandwiches, salad, or pizza- you get a big, tasty portion every time. For a romantic evening you can get some decent wine or beer. Although, a bottle of wine can get a little pricey.

After a Giants game- Get Pasquale's takeout and bring it to Yancy's (yes, the bar welcomes Pasquale's pizza). 

Big groups: We have celebrated birthdays and family holiday parties here. Why? They have an all you can eat dinner special for larger groups. Including beer and several bottles of wine, all the pasta and pizza you can eat- it normally ends up about $15 per person. If you don't get drinks, you can easily walk out spending under $10. 

Parking: Street, metered. After 6pm it's free. Yes, it can be a hassle because it gets crowded on Irving at night. Normally you can find a spot nearby.

Service: Hit or miss. Sometimes they're quick and on top of everything. Other times the service is a little slow. You don't really notice if you enjoy your company.
author: Mollie C.

description: Great pizza to share with friends and family. The service was kind interchangeable between servers which was a bit confusing but overall great experience. Thanks
author: Eldo G.

description:
$15 for an extra-large pizza? That's a great deal.  $15 for an extra-large and extra-delicious pizza? That's a steal.

If you like thin, italian-styled, non-doughy pizza, this place is calling your name.  Friends and I ate here late night when other options were closed.  At the time, we thought we would "settle" for pizza. Afterward, I was claiming Pasquale's among San Francisco's finest.  Throw in the price and you also have one of San Francisco's best deals. This is the only experience I have had here so I can't speak to the quality or value of their other menu options. 

Patxi's a few doors down is $33 a pie with a 40+ minute wait time and their pizza is nothing too special (very saucy deep-dish style).  If given the choice I prefer Pasquale's.  And that's before factoring in the steep difference in prices.
author: L M.

description: My sister and stopped by here with her kids to have a quick lunch on our break from visiting the Academy of Science.  There were two other parties having lunch so we were a bit hesitant but we only had 1hr meter parking on the street  so we needed eat before we all passed out.   My sister ordered a medium half cheese, half pepperoni for the kids and we ordered a pesto with spinach and tomato.  Well turns out the pizza was pretty good.  The sauce wasn't bitter, had a lot of flavor.  The service was okay but we still enjoyed our pizza and beverages.  The place looks like they are more popular with delivery than people coming in to.  Two more parties came in just as we got our pizza so it was getting a little more busier.  My niece and nephew loved their pizza and would like to go back there again.  :)
author: Liz D.

description:
So my ass thanks their soft sourdough bread. Putting that on the table before a meal is one of those guilty pleasures that define that of which we call life.  Life is bread.  From Pasquale's. 

'Should have ordered the salad' ...  ya right.
I have been a Pasquale's fan since I was 10. I shared a salad twice.  You don't come here for a salad.  
That's what Pluto's across the street is for.

Their pizza is damn yummy.  I have always found it to be consistent.  It's not too thin, not too thick, generous toppings and good texture throughout - 4 stars 

But the real secret about Pasquale's is their hot sandwiches which was our M-O last night ... they are HUGE, carbalicious and absolutely delicious and all are under $9

Also, their house red is surprisingly really great (and this is not post Yancy's Saloon next door talkin') and at $9 a carafe, it's a no brainer.

Turned a few friends onto this place and the collective one day later sentiment is that although nobody wants to eat any carbs today, we're still baffled that the bill for 4 of us was only $52.  That was for 4 very full bellies & we killed 2 carafes of wine, plus I actually knew when to say when so I have sitting next to me a lovely leftover 1/2 meatball sandwich that is large enough to share.  Ahhhh, here's to a kick-my-ass spin class later! Balance.  This is how you keep your figure and still eat what you want.
   
Very reasonably priced neighborhood joint, warm feel, a casual go-to restaurant with plenty of menu variety, great service & staff that won't run you off their table if you want to catch up with friends.
author: Athena S.

description: Ordered a Pizza for delivery.  The pizza never came.  Two hours later I called to inquire. Put on hold. Then told them my story and they put me on hold again. Do not call this place for take out. It is a black hole  , waiting to suck time.
author: John G.

description: I live in the neighborhood, and I've seen a lot of new super douchey places move in.  I go to Pasquale's never for the pizza, but for the pasta and entrees.  Listen, There is nowhere in San Francisco that is a better deal when you look at quantity, price and quality.  And for me that includes a lot of the taquerias too.  Pasquale's will always give you at least two meal's worth for about ten bucks.  Never too crowded, and certainly not douchey.  This is old school italian.  Might be my new go-to spot.
author: Pepper A.

description: We as a family have been coming here for years off and on, tonight that changed... We had the RUDEST waitress ever... We ordered two pizzas but only got one. When we questioned the second pizza, she said "you didn't order another one"... We told her we wanted to place the order and waited. When anout 15 minutes goes by, asked how much longer, she gave an eye roll and said "less than 10 minutes...". Ended up being 15-20... Changed how we feel entirely... It was for a birthday dinner and it kind of ruined the evening.
author: Lauran P.

description:
We came through here extremely hungry and ready to eat.  We first walked in and was at first worried that it didn't have a real restaurant sitting area like their other location off Sloat, but our fears were calmed after we walked to the end of the hallway and to the left we saw all the tables.  We were told to sit anywhere we liked and were given menus.  Their menu and lots of great selections, like many Italian restaurants, but also some unique ones like wings or potatoes.  A very well rounded menu.

We had to wait a while to order our food, get our food, and get our check ... but everything other then that was good.  Our server was very nice and funny.  Our food was good, but my favorite was the different types of breads for the appetizer ... yum!

I would eat here again, but it isn't one of my favorite pizza places.  I'd probably go back here for their appetizers or to try their many other dishes.
author: Pia V.

description:
For reasonable prices and big portions, Pasquales's Pizza is a good place to hit up after a long day in the park. The pizzas are a good size and the pasta is tasty, but my favorite dishes are the baked dishes. I even tried the shrimp salad here on a whim and it was probably the worst salad I've ever bought because it was indeed swimming in dressing and piled high with baby shrimp and not jumbo shrimp. Other than that, I've been here a few times and every time has been a satisfying experience.

Be prepared for friendly waiters and filling plates.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
A stamp of Brooklyn approval for Pasquale's, one of the best pizza places in San Francisco!

I ended up at Pasquale's out of desperation- I had just arrived in San Francisco, I was hungry and I did not know where to turn. I decided to subject myself to west coast pizza, partly out of curiosity and partly out of, I suspect, some sort of subconcious self-hatred (lets be honest here about your pizza reputation, California). I was however very pleasantly surprised- Pasquale's offers a wonderful thin crust pizza, baked to perfection with what tastes like a perfect balance of mozzarella and parmesan cheese on top. 

Somebody in inner sunset got it right because I found myself not only ordering from here over and over, but actually enjoying and looking forward to it. Good prices, great pizza, that's all I need to know. 

Check it out east and west coasters, definitely a great choice.
author: Jenna I.

description:
The house special has become a staple at our house!
XL is the Perfect amount of food for 3 hungry bros or 4 people with normal appetites.
It comes to about $30 (including tip) for delivery.
author: Cody C.

description:
This place has been our go to pizza place for over 20yrs. I really have only ordered pizza and salads from here so this review is for those items. 
The salads are fresh and definitely enough to split with 2 or 3 people. It also comes with their fresh sourdough....yummy.  The ingredients are very fresh and flavorful. 

The Pizza while I like it (House Special or Pesto),is very hit and miss. Let me explain......When its right the crust is just slightly charred on the bottom but the top of the  crust still remains soft and fold-able, the sauce is light.....its flavor really comes through and thats what keeps me coming back. 
But then there are the times when I get the pizza home and the crust is just waaaaaay to crispy and by that I mean the crust snaps when I fold it and its been cooked to the point were the flavor of the sauce is gone and the toppings are over cooked.  With pizza ovens you have to be very vigilant on timing and knowing the hot zones on each deck.
author: Landon T.

description: The bomb individual pizza ! Also the pastas are the FIRE. Plus the service is great ! Highly recommend this spot here
author: Mario S.

description: Favorite pizzeria in the inner sunset. Pasta dishes and appetizers are also pretty good. While next door drinking at Yancy's you can walk over and order food and bring it over to the bar. Ceasar salad is OK,  but nothing special. If you eat here,  make sure you get a pizza. It's NY style with a SF twist (none of this Chicago deep dish stuff).
author: Ken L.

description:
Pasquale's is just up the street from my apartment, and definitely offers up some choice pies. However, what first attracted me to Pasquale's was the fact that an animatronic man of the same name played the drums for the Chuck E. Cheese band. And how could I forsake the man behind the music of so many of my childhood birthday parties. 

In all seriousness, Pasquale's is delicious. Their crust is perfection.I, however, am a thin crust fan, so if you're a Chicago deep-dish diva, this might not be the place for you. 

Here's what I do: 
-Order a pizza with any of the following (not necessarily all at once): sausage, garlic, olives, and pesto sauce. 
-Try out the stuffed potatoes. My friend's boyfriend swears they changed his life. 
-Take it to go. Not a lot of seating options at Pasquale's, and it's more comfortable to eat at home with your own cheap beer anyway.
author: Chanti B.

description: Solidly ok pizza. Chrispy bottom, thinner sauce. They use spices in the correct proportions but the quality is just so so. Decent price for the size though.
author: James V.

description:
I left the Anarchist Book Fair looking for something to eat. We were a party of four adults and 2 babies under the age of 12 months. Not knowing the areas restaurants we opted to go with Pasquale's for are lunchtime meal. First off, I have to say that Pasquale's was family friendly as most Italian restaurants should be. 

We started off our order with the antipasto salad ($9.70) came complete with salami, mortadella, mozzarella slices, romaine lettuce, olives, garbonzo beans, and onions. The salad was a fantastic opening act for the rest of the meal. The next thing that came out was the fettuccine alfredo ($9.65) which was rich and creamy in a cheese sauce that I wanted to baptize my first child in. The last and final dish was the pizza. We order the meat pizza ($23.50) which I was ecstatic about because I didn't know one of the people we were with well and wasn't sure if she was a radical animal liberation vegetarian or vegan, that we picked up from the Anarchist Book Fair.  The meat pizza was a carnivores dream come true. It had salami, pepperoni, beef, and sausage and truly a greasy-meaty masterpiece that would have made Salvador Dali proud. 

I have to admit that I over did it and ate way too much pizza and pasta. My eyes glazed over and the food coma was kicking in. I tried to perk myself up with a second cup of Coke which, as you may already know, was not a well thought out plan. I pulled myself up, put the baby in the stroller and went for a long walk at Golden Gate Park in hopes to instill some life back in me, but all I wanted to do was stuff my face some more. 

I loved Pasquale's and would definitely come back again. Is it the best pizza or pasta I ever had? No, but the food is delicious, tasty, and a great value at the prices. To me, there is nothing better than sharing a bowl of pasta, salad, and slices of delicious pizza with friends and family at a place as comfortable and welcoming as Pasquale's. So next time you're in the Sunset and in the mood for a hearty meal with large portions, come to Pasquale's. You will not be disappointed.
author: Maurice L.

description:
So one late Sunday I was looking for running shoes. So now it's dark and the exhaust from the restaurants are pumping out food smell like east coast coal burning factories. 

The night air was warm and and blowing slower than a snails crawl. With that being said, the smell of Chinese food, steaks grilling, Kurry, pasta, and coffee was just running wild in the area. This was not helping my appetite or or my decision making. 

I turn the corner and saw an old neon light sign shining Pizzeria in the middle. Right above Pizzeria I read in cursive Pasquale's. Being a sucker for old style neon signs and Italian names I said why not. While walking up, I yelped this place and almost everyone was talking about the pizza. 

So I walk across the street and saw the whole pizza making area from the sidewalk. The pizza lab was well lit, clean, and you can just tell these guys know what they were doing. So I now walk in and saw walk past the pizza lab and juke box. The hostess that night was nice and led me to a table. So I'm walking across the room and saw that everyone is digging on the pizza. I'm thinking to myself "All they have is pizza". I'm seated and open the menu. Wow they have more than pizza. 

I love pizza, but I when I read the menu and saw this place had more to offer I figure why not try a plate. Pasta, salads, and sandwiches........ooooh grilled chicken with fried prawn. When the server came back to take my order she brought a basket of toasted soar dough bread. Ahhhhh sour dough bread I love sour dough bread. 

So 10-15 minutes pass and I'm sipping on my tea, and digging on the bread. BAM my meal arrives, hot, steaming, and looking good. So I was happy to see my order of grilled chicken and fried prawns was accompanied by mushrooms, steam veggie, and a plate of pasta with meat sauce. 

To make a long story short, the chicken was moist and had flavor. I don't like mushrooms but the mixture of the chicken complimented it each other and the prawns were a delightful. All in all everything tasted fresh, and better than most places I've been to. For the quality and amount of food, the price was great. 

I've so far have been to Pasquale's a total of 3 times and have tried the chicken parmigiana and bruschetta. Needless to say they were was hella good . The only bad thing is parking. 

I'll try the pizza next time and see if that will give it the big cinco star. 

My next review will be short
author: Danny G.

description:
In my opinion, you can tell a good pizza by it's crust and bread.

I've ordered delivery and dined in. Neither were great.

FOOD - 
This is a bit over-the-top, but the pizza dough was almost like cardboard. Good dough adds to the flavor of a pizza IMO, and this just was a base for the cheese. Some good options in variety, just not sure that it all taste that good.


SERVICE - is meh. The place lacks any real customer service. If you order delivery, give them your number. I ordered, and when I arrived to pick it up, they didn't have it ready b/c they didn't have the ingredients. They didn't have a # to call me back at. They shrugged it off.

AMBIANCE - 
Hmm ... not sure what they are going for? Old-school or just old? Usually fairly empty.

DRINKS -
Not really a drinking ground, but beer and wine is available.

SUGGESTION - 
Try Cybelle's up the street on 9th and Judah. The food is just as good or better, with more options, and a much better atmosphere for pizza and beer.
author: Good U.

description: Besides always getting put on hold for way to long this place is pretty solid. I get pesto linguine with chicken delivered all the time and have never received disappointing meal.
author: Billy H.

description: Pasquale's is my favorite restaurant to eat at.  The food is DELICIOUS I'm getting hungry just thinking about it :-) -- best restaurant of all time.  The service is great...managers and staff are very friendly and treat you like family.  It's impressive how fast the food comes because Pasquale's can get extremely busy (because the food is AMAZING).  My favorite things on the menu are the broccoli potato, all of the pastas, and the pizza (I always request mine to be made with thick crust!).  I have never once been disappointed with my food or the service. It is a very clean restaurant. Definitely five stars. If you haven't tried Pasquale's you are missing out!!!!
author: Bee D.

description: Very good pizza and fair price. Better than Cybelle's in my opinion. Ordered ahead and was ready when we picked up. Service was nice. THANKS!
author: Anna B.

description:
I've been eating pasquale's since i was young. I would go there for the veal parmigiana and to the Villa for the pizza. Pasquale's food is pretty good but lately their service is subpar. The wait staff is okay but the pizza side and the clerks make you feel like your in a skateboard shop. They treat you like they're doing you a favor and don't even dare to get their delivery because the phone staff is awful. I don't usually complain about companies ever because I think that the better option is just not to eat there but I do't want to lose this one based on the bad staff. Hopefully they get their act together.
I'm adding to this review because clearly i was hoping for too much thinking they might change. This is what happens when you hire angry hipsters to work in the front. They could care less about their mistakes and god forbid they hear a complaint because they simply don't care. They messed up my delivery again and then started to blame me for their inadequacies. I'm done here for good.
author: M T.

description: This is great pizza place. A staple of the Sunset district. I like going to the bar on the same block to get a drink and maybe watch a big sports game, Yancy's. The bar doesn't serve food. No problem! I walk over to Pasquale's, order a pizza, and pick it up in 20 minutes. That's usually the wait time even when they are busy. These guys are just quick, have great customer service, and make amazing pizza. My favorite is their seafood pizza. I know, a bit strange. But, its unique. With that being said, you cant go wrong with a pepperoni or whatever else you prefer. You'll be happy. I dont know if they do deep dish or thin crust, or whatever else gets offered at other places. I order a regular pizza with what I want and it's always enjoyable. Keep up the good work!
author: Yevgeniy K.

description: Great place - speaking for delivery only. The pepperoni pizza is delicious and the delivery time is usually within an hour. Everyone I've ever spoken with on the phone is polite and professional. The prices are also ridiculously low considering the quality. Check them out!
author: Mike F.

description: Good pizza, fries & salad. The baked stuffed potatoes were unique & the highlight of the meal. Friendly service & good prices. Nice place for a quick family meal.
author: Joel D.

description:
This place deserves 5 stars for dealing with me and my friend Hannah being complete shitshows on our birthdays. I find it a minor miracle that we did not get kicked out or arrested when there were two cops sitting ten feet away as Hannah tipped over their gelato scoop container and I broke the door to the gelato case. We didn't even order gelato! Mostly all the pizza cooks just laughed at us. 

But they still served a really rockin pepperoni pizza. A personal pan pizza consisting of more than the 4 dinky slices that Round Table gives you on their personal pizzas, only runs you $5 and comes with 1 topping. To my drunken mind, this was a STEAL and my sober mind has to agree. The crust was thin but not too crispy (I don't remember if we asked for that specifically). Special thanks to the guy at the register with pretty sweet plugs who made our night (and pizza) memorable. 

Also god, I'm so glad that we didn't get kicked out. Did I mention that already? Seriously, Pasquale's high tolerance for drunken people experiencing cheesy, greasy cravings deserves 2 stars on its own.
author: Dena R.

description:
Kids wanted to eat at Pasquale's and I didn't want to drive far for a good pie.  I should've stood my ground, "Momma's boss, no Pasquale's".  Like all parents, we give in to our kids.  

There was a semi-big party in the 2nd dining room when we arrived. A dad, his 2 sons & nephew were off to a 13K mile run the next day starting from West to East coast, finishing in mid-November and promoting "natural medicine".  That's a lot of running shoes dying along the way and sore feet.  Their t shirts all promoted www.therun.org to raise $$.

We tried the fried calamari, $9.  The batter had too much flour, not flaky enough (add some corn starch, will ya? That's the trick).  Lots of tentacles, which freaks out Jr. Yelper #2 (spiders!).   
The Caesar salad was dull, lemony, and sprinkling of cheese.  An uneventful concert.  The sourdough bread at the table would put a pucker on your lips. 

The grilled chicken pizza arrived hot, with melty cheese.  The grilled chix breasts (Jr. Yelper #1 wanted to eat healthy) were sliced into chunks, tossed on top with tart tomatoes and green onions.  For over $23 for a XL, I expected a better crust.  It was crunchy, in a dry bread crust way and could be summarized as "taste like cardboard".  Jr Yelper #2 questioned if I've ever tasted cardboard.  We can only imagine....

Service was slow, even with 3 wait staff.  A couple across the room got frustrated w/the delay in taking their order, spoke to each other and agreed to leave.  Our waitress was very friendly and kept our water glasses full. 

Told the Jr. Yelpers that 'momma's a food snob', gonna have to make me eat better pie than this.
author: Ry T.

description: I love this place! But for a specific couple items. Not to say the rest might also be great, but I always order the side of garlic bread with extra garlic. Then I get a bowl of minestrone soup. That's it, and that's all I want! After eating, I walk out of there steaming of garlic and God help anyone who crosses the path if my mouth. It's usually busy because they are the real deal here. I have gone here 30 years ago, and as recent as a couple weeks ago. Not much has changed, and I like that. I like to grab a coffee gelato one block over after eating here, and my night is complete.
author: Jeff H.

description:
This is my go-to place for family parties that are craving pasta and pizza. Big servings, big space and great food! This place doesnt disappoint and take out for the house is always on speed dial as well. 

They got a little juke box in the front if youre bored or want to keep the kids entertained. If that doesnt do the trick than maybe the pizza guy making the pizza will. Watch him roll the dough, throw it and spread the sauces on it!
author: Tim M.

description: Woohoo! Chose something different. Did not want just spaghetti. This time I tried the Spaghetti Alla Louisiana with tomatoes, bell peppers, large shrimps,onions, and sausage in a light Cajun sauce that was midly spicy. Oh, boy, it was so good.  Have enough for another dinner.
author: Judy K.

description:
I have been here several times in the past when I used to live in the Bay Area.  Through the years what I have loved about Pasquale's is that I feel they have maintained their quality!

My parents, fiance, and a few other relatives met here for my dad's birthday lunch!  Was very quiet as we came early on a Monday!  The waiter there seemed a little new, not that there was a lot to do but he seemed overburdened and rushed.

I ordered an extra large house special pizza because my dad wanted some leftovers.  Three of the eight of us ordered Veal Scallopini which I feel they prepare excellently since I first came here back in the 80s.  My fiance had Linguini with Clams, which is one of my mom's favorite dishes.

The food did not disappoint and their portions are still as hearty as ever.  The veal scallopini was excellent as usual!  My fiance had so many clams with her Linguini, which tasted very nice!  My pizza was smothered with toppings and I love the crust here as well, one of the best I would say for California pizza crust.  It was a little salty, but all in all I was very satisfied!

This will probably remain at the top of my list for Italian food in San Francisco as I know it is my parents' favorite!



6 - Ambiance (Typical pizzeria setting)
6 - Service (Wasn't crowded, waiter seemed new, but did ok)
9 - Price (Excellent prices for Italian/Pizza dishes)
9 - Portions (very large portions for pastas and pizza toppings)
8 - Quality (Excellent veal scallopini, linguini, and pizzas)

Lunch on Monday, July 18, 2011
author: Bryan W.

description: Favorite pizza place in the city. Love the service! The meat pizza with pepperoni, salami, sausage, etc. is the best!
author: Courtney L.

description: Waited 1hr. for our pizza. Called to check up on it. They claimed someone in our apartment building paid for it. Bullshit. They asked for our order AGAIN, which obviously lead me to believe they never took it in the 1st place or forgot about it and they said to give them 20minutes. It took 40. When they finally arrived. They forgot our sodas. Called them again and they said they forgot to write it down and to give them time to send the driver back with them. That took another 20min. Pizza was alright. Disappointing overall experience. Won't b ordering from there again.
author: Roxy D.

description:
I smelled pizza from a block away that smelled so delicious that I just couldn't pass this place up. My bff and I walked in and the owner greeted us. Very friendly place.

PIZZA PIZZA PIZZA. Get on it!!

Only thing I didn't like - the service. She was forgetful and slow. T_T**
author: Leena N.

description:
Pizza tastes almost alright when fresh. Very touristy place.

Lack of anything authentic. They openly (you can see it thru the window) use overprocessed sliced cheese from the huge brick and tomato sauce straight outta the huge nameless can. Perhaps the only good thing noted was the sturdy cardboard box.

Does it cost any less than any good pizza? NO!

In the next few hours pizza leftovers were as hard and tasty as that sturdy cardboard box.

Staff there wasn't all that friendly or pleasant - only one tall white guy at the register spoke English and he looked very unhappy.

Earned two solid stars: for location and hours of operations.
author: Andy M.

description:
Well I must say.....Pasquale's delivers an EXCELLENT pizza. Way better than Irving Pizza, for instance. Chances are if you're reading this you can choose between the two.

Choose Pasquale's.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Solid Italian food.  Big fan of the pizza and pastas.  Friendly staff.  Always take-out so never actually dined in but always quick (under 30 min), hearty and hot. 

Recommend the pizza, the subs and the lasagna.
author: Kelly H.

description:
I admit it, I grew up in Brooklyn, so I'm a New York Pizza snob.
And a lot of place claim to have New York style pizza, and they fall short. 
Pasquale's hits the target dead on. Great thin crust cheese pizza, and as an added bonus, they have a terrific Baked Ziti, another of my New York comfort foods you don't see out here.
The only small gripe - they don't sell pizza by the slice. Their solutions is a personal pie, about the size of a dinner plate, and it's cut into 8 little slices. Likewise the medium pie comes with slices that are not the conventional NY Pizza slice size, so it doesn't lend itself to picking up the slice, folding it in half, and starting at the tip and working your way down. Other than that, great burn the roof of your mouth NY cheese pizza! I will be back
author: Mark S.

description: Decent pizza, good delivery.  They've never messed up an order and they're consistent.
author: Sheila G.

description: 5 stars for the broccoli, squash & garlic sandwich (add marinara). HOLY MOLY. I put it up there as one of the top ten sandwiches I've ever had. And I've had  a lot.
author: K. H.

description:
Wow good stuff! I have yet to step foot in this joint but I have been assured by locals and east coasters that this is some of the best pizza in town.
