Then I mentioned my love of pizza to an Italian while I was at Lucky Duck bar nearby and he straight up ordered me a personal pan and brought it to the bar. I must say, that was delicious enough for me to yelp about. The dough is so good and flour-y, the pie the perfect toastiness to get toasted with.

Come eat here!
author: Nicole B.

description:
Their pizzas were decent for what I interpret as a "family-style" pizza place.  I think I've eaten at dozens of pizza places like this across the country. They have checkered table cloths, plastic cups with the Coca-Cola logo on it, and cheese and red pepper in the cute little cylindrical shakers. 

We got a Hawaiian, pepperoni, and anchovy pizza, and all three were adequate in all ways.
author: Andy J.

description:
I tried this restaurant with my friends because they keep raving how awesome the food is. Pffft! Yea, right. I ordered 1/2 ravioli and speghetti. I did not like how the marinara sauce was diluted and the pasta was over done. And my plate came out first before my friends' pizzas came. 

The server was nice until she yelled at my friends and me. She offered my table bread which I later learned was for MY pasta. She expressed how my friends' pizzas are still cooking so they can work on the bread. On the third time my table asked for bread, the waitress scowled at us and said the bread is for me because I'm having pasta. In addition to that, this woman in her 40s was being immature and called my friends "bread-hogs." Mind you, she's the one who offered bread to the community in the first place. Plus, my friends didn't eat my bread once they got their pizza. She was totally making false assumptions without understanding what's going on. In the end, I was still hungry and I didn't get bread anymore. 

Agism is definitely a factor at this location. I noticed the servers are more accomadating to the middle-aged adults rather than young adults. For instance, they made a college girl move across the room while SHE WAS IN THE MIDDLE OF HER DINNER! I was furious FOR her. The servers totally did not respect her space AND the fact how she hasn't finished her meal. I hope she tipped them less than needed. They deserved it. 

Another thing that bothered me was their floor. Their carpet is NASTY. Have you ever accidently stepped on gum? Try dining with gum under your shoe. Definitely cannot keep my mind off my sticky soles while trying to enjoy my dinner. 

Although I may have listed multiple cons, I have discovered a couple of pros in this "fine" dining restaurant. The cashier ladies are nice and friendly. (Maybe because they are my peers, in their 20s.) Aaaand they are open until midnight. 

Overall, I will not revisit this restaurant. I will not waste my time and money here.
author: Winn D.

description:
After living in the Sunset from the last 3 years, Pasquale's has become my all time favorite stand-by place to order in from. My boyfriend and I both love their pastas and sandwiches - favorites are the Neapolitan Steak Sandwich and the Linguini with Pesto. By far, they have the best pesto sauce around (my ultimate comfort dish is a good spaghetti with pesto), and they're always very generous with their delicious sourdough bread.

Food is always delivered within the promised window, the delivery guys are all super nice, the sodas are always chilled, and the food is always, ALWAYS steaming hot when I open it up in my apartment. It's fun to dine in as well, and is great for large groups. I love Pasquale's and if I ever left SF, I would miss it more than any other restaurant!
author: Rachel A.

description: Great neighborhood pizza place.  Been coming here for years!  Love their pizza!  Chewy and crisp and not too thick crust!
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
My First Yelp Review. 

I find out about Pasquale's Pizza because my co-workers from work would order pizza from here once a while. I thought it was great and I like it. However, I ordered an three items medium pizza tonight for dinner and I was very disappointed. The pizza was 30% burnt and black crumbs was all over the place. It was oily and the crust very hard to chew. It was the worst pizza I have ever eaten.
author: Ada L.

description: The pizza at Pasquale's is fantastic. The Greek, Mediterranean, and just plain cheese pizza'a are tasty-riffic.However, do yourself a favor and get your pie to go, because the service stinks.
author: Matt T.

description: Best pizza ive had in sf, its up there with the ranks of victors and little joes. The delivery is always extra fast, and everyones always cool on the phone. Pasquale is champion!
author: Ryan S.

description:
When I first moved into the inner sunset area, my boyfriend and I were looking a good pizza place.  We walked into Pasquale's and looked around, but decided that it seemed just ok, so we walked out and decided to try somewhere else.  

But the other day, I received a gift certificate for Pasquale's, so it was time to finally try it out.  As with our first impression of the place, Pasquale's doesn't really look like much.  It's kind of different because you walk into an area where they make the pizzas and then turn a corner to wait for a table.  The place is actually fairly sized and was pretty lively when we went for dinner, Friday night around 8:30.  

Since we had the gift certificate, my boyfriend and I went all out and way over-ordered.  My boyfriend got the antipasto salad and I ordered the caesar salad.  As our main dishes, my boyfriend got the Shrimp linguine and I ordered the seafood platter entree with a side of gnocchi ($1 extra, because penne with marinara is the standard side).

We also each ordered a soda ($1.50) and drank it all pretty quickly because we were pretty thirsty, and then were informed that they don't offer refills. Bummer.

They started us off with some fresh sourdough bread and butter, which was pretty decent, but we were trying to save room for the feast we were about to devour.  Our salads came really quickly, within 5 minutes of placing our order, and they were humongous.  They were huge plates, piled and piled with food.  Honestly, these salads could have been our meals and we would have been pretty much stuffed.  We could have even shared one and been adequately full.  

Caesar salad: very cheesy, lots of croutons, a fair amount of dressing.  Pretty standard.

Antipasto salad: slices of tomato, slices of cheese, olives, slices of different deli meats, a fair amount of italian dressing.  This salad was extra huge.

Then, came our entrees.

Seafood platter: about a third of the plate was covered in lightly fried calamari, about 6 deep fried shrimp, and maybe about 15 small deep fried scallops.  The scallops were my favorite, very juicy and coated in seasoning/breadcrumbs.  There was also a portion of veggies (broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots).  I also had a side of gnocchi; it tasted fresh and was pretty doughy.  Not the best, but definitely a nice change from the usual penne pasta.

Seafood linguine: this was the highlight of the meal.  The 6 large butterflied shrimp were delicious.  The sauce was very buttery and very creamy and very cheesy, pretty much everything you'd want from a good alfredo sauce.  My boyfriend was already full before his pasta arrived, but this didn't stop him from eating about half of the plate, and the plate was huge.  

After finishing eating, we still had about half of the meal.  The waitresses took our plates away and boxed everything for us.  

Overall, Pasquale's offers good food, large portions, fair prices and good service.  It's definitely worth a try (even though it doesn't look like much from the front).  I'll be back to try the pizza soon.

Notes: 
-They don't have a parking lot, look for street parking.
-Consider sharing a salad and/or an entree.  The portions are really big.
-You can upgrade the side of penne to a side of gnocchi for $1.
-They don't have free soda refills (even though they have a fountain dispenser).
author: Samantha L.

description:
This is strictly about the pasta and the service. I've been in here a few times over the last several years, and they've always been friendly. Not a fancy place, but a casual laidback atmosphere.

I went here a few nights ago, and was immediately greeted. My family and I were accommodated the entire time we were there. My 6 year old had specific instructions with her spaghetti and meatballs, and they were very attentive to her. :) Everyone in my party ordered pasta (no pizza), and were all pretty satisfied. The portions are generous, and I was definitely full. Prices are decent. 

This place has a diverse group of diners. There were families with young children and groups of adults. It's definitely a place you can chatter away. Nothing bad to say at all!
author: Lani S.

description:
Beware: 38 % surcharge for a half and half pizza. 

An order was placed by phone for a x-large half & half (meat eater & vegetarian) pasquale's specialties pizza for pick-up tonight.  When I picked up the pizza, I was charged $37 (yes, THIRTY-SEVEN dollars) instead of ~ $27 as mentioned when order was placed (price on menu before tax = $25) 

As explained by Alex to me, the pizza was $37 because "half and half pizza are charged by toppings":
*  x-large veggie specialty = $25
* plus 4 additional toppings for the meat eater ($2.25 x 4) = $9
* plus tax for a total of $37

I think I can understand a reasonable surcharge for a half and half pizza but 38% is quite excessive.  Not only was it not clear on the menu, but it almost feels like a bait and switch ($27 on phone and $37 at pick up).  Is this reportable?  If so, to whom?
author: Diana N.

description:
I don't understand why this place doesn't have a higher rating. Theres little else you could ask for from a restraunt. It is old school, inexpensive, and excellent. 

I came here with a total of four people. We came late and you could tell they were a little mad but hey, i work in the restraunt biz and i know how much that sucks so it didn't bother me, nor did it affect the service in any way which was there when you needed it and gone when you didn't. 

Meal
Spagetti carbonara: Easily one of the best things on the menu. Subtle flavors of garlic and cream, excellent portion size

Spagetti w/ meatballs: Classic, obviously home-made sauce and a generous amount of it. Home made meatballs too. Just hit the spot ya know?

Large pizza. Great crust, good amount of sauce and the sausage was to die for. Tasted good in the morning too.

We also got a bottle of something, i didn't order it so i don't know what it was but it was decent and italian.

Total bill: 72 dollars. Now for 4 people with a bottle of wine that's rediculous especialy with the quality we had. Excellent place for tasty, inexpensive homey food. Soo soo good.
author: Logan H.

description:
Straight up huge portions of Italian food.  I really enjoyed the cheese ravioli with marinara.  It was exactly how you want pasta to taste, and I loved the marinara.  Beers are cheap, and service is good.

The pizza is also good, although I think I'd try the thin crust next time.
author: Cara M.

description:
I came here a couple times after a bit of drinking. This place DOES close at 1, so only come here if you've got to sober up a bit on a night that you're trying to end a bit early. 

It's great for drunk food. I find that it's your typical pizza parlor, nothing mouth-watering amazing, but it will definitely work. I would definitely stop by here for some mid-drinking munchies if I'm bar-hopping around Irving & 9th.
author: Stacy X.

description: We were only in town for a week and the food was good enough to take extended family and go back for a second meal.  Pizza and Veal Parmesan were really good and the pesto sauce was really good too.  Meatball sandwich was only ok.
author: Sue S.

description:
I was in the mood for mexican food, cruising down Irving St and looking for La Fonda (which I read about in Yelp). I noticed it to be very busy so plan B. Next door was the smell of Italian food and it was luring me in. It was kinda confusing which door was the entry door but I finally found my way in. After seeing all of the smaller eating establishments this place looked humongous. The fellow diner I was with noticed the mountain of pizza boxes but I was not in the mood for pizza so time to check out their pasta dishes which seemed reasonably priced.

We were seated and the waitor asked what we wanted to drink. I said Pelligrino, and he said No. Something similar No. I was going to say Peroni but I didn't want to hear No.  OK ... diet coke. I was waiting for the waitor to say Pepsi Pepsi but he didn't. So much for the start of the drinks. Anyways we ordered the bruschetta $6.95 because of the Yelp reviews saying it was yummy. Lots of garlic and tomatoes...yummy. 

My fellow diner order the gnocchi (sorry no price) and I ordered the ravoli (beef) with the marinara. The raviolis ($9.25) were of the round variety (not the square). They were flavorful and the marinara was not too heavy and sweet. Plentiful servings but I was half full after eating the bruschetta. 

Just a note, I been to the Italian restuarant across the street and you spend a little more but this place sufficed for the moment.
author: Jim D.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place. At least one person inside is Italian, but the pizza is sub-par, which makes it irritating (I am Italian). I was there with my wife and we had a pepperoni pizza. The sauce was really too sweet and the crust was just as good as any other fake Italian pizza places (or a Safeway pizza, for that matter). And that's a real shame. 

Luckily, SF offers much better Italian pizza places.

We will not go back.
author: Simone B.

description: Just say no. This place is terrible. The only thing worse than the iced tea was the service. The iced tea tasted like mold (it had a strong flavor of hydrogen peroxide, it could have been a cleaning residue left in the glasses or pitcher, but it was likely mold in their drink dispensing lines). The servers were very disinterested in performing their task, we did have a large party but if you are not equipped or willing to serve a large group, then don't make a reservation for that size. The food was mediocre at best but the extremely slow service and needing to ask 4 times for something to be delivered to the table was what made this a clear 1 star.
author: Kyle S.

description:
When i go to heaven
 the first thing that i want is a Pasquale's Pizza
author: Henry D.

description: AS GOOD AS IT GETS!!!   My family has been eating Pasquale's Pizza for over 50 years!!!  Love the FAMILY, pizza, pasta, sandwiches, salads and service!  They hand make their own Italian sausage...a must order!  They are one of the very few pizza makers left in SF that use the highest quality "old school" mozzarella cheese slices, not prepackaged shredded oil filled cheese out of a bag.  The weight of the box will prove the highest bang for the buck.  The dough is perfection...order it thin, original or thick ~  it's ALL good!  Ravioli's with meat sauce, Caesar salad and the BEST freshly baked "HOT out of the oven" sourdough bread with melted butter...DEELISH!  Need comfort food, look NO further!  There is NO other pizza place in San Francisco that can compare to this staple.  This is SAN FRANCISCO STYLE PIZZA, not NY nor Chicago...enough said!  XX
author: Nene H.

description: Very "old school" pizza/Italian place. The food's pretty good but not amazing, and the vibe is of the old school style Italian places one would have gone to 40, 50, 60 years ago.....but really that's part of the charm of this place. I really wouldn't want it to change!
author: Desmond G.

description: Out of all the Pizzeria's in San Francisco, this is my favorite GO TO for a nice mushroom only pizza.  Something about their sauce, not too tangy or sweet.  I grew up on this Pizza in high school and still come back 30 years later!  My youngest daughter loves it too and reminds me to get Pasquale's when in SF.  Latest price was $16.99 for a large mushroom, which went a long way!  Locations on Sloat and one on Irving (harder to park).
author: Daphnie A.

description:
I came here a while back and I remember being really happy with my meal of lasagna and house combination pizza.  However, I've been here a couple of times more recently, and it doesn't seem to be as good as I remember.  

Ordered the Sausage and Mushroom and Meat Eater pizzas the last couple of times, and they were pretty decent.  However, I wasn't overwhelmed at all...probably because I'm not a fan of their red sauce after the second slice or so.  The pies are still okay overall, but nothing I would be craving for.

The pasta dishes, on the other hand, are not too shabby.  On the most recent trip, we ordered the Spaghetti with Pesto Sauce, which was a nice dish that wasn't drowning in sauce.  Also, the aforementioned lasagna plate is tasty as well.  I saw a neighboring couple order the Spagetti Alla Carbonara, and I've already tabbed that as my next order - no need for the menu!  The fact that they have Sapporo and Peroni bottles available with your pizza are also a definite plus though - how often can you get your Italian food with an Italian AND Japanese beer at the same time?
author: Mike L.

description: I always order takeout from Pasquale's.  The Mediterranean pizza IS THE BEST! The crust is very thin & the pizza itself not too oily like a lot of other pizzerias. Even my asian parents who normally hate eating pizza enjoyed pasquale's pizza. Another good item on their menu is the ceasar salad w/beef strips. Pasquales stays being one of my favorite takeout places & they deliver.
author: Kristy L.

description: i drive to san francisco about six times a year for food and this place has the pizza. the house special is awesome hot and just as good cold. i must have walked by this place a dozen times thinking i've gotta stop glad i finally did.
author: Steve M.

description:
This review/rating is only for the seated restaurant service. 

The server was rude when he was asking me how many people would be seated. When I replied, 'One", he gave me this look...like just one person, is that so odd? It was a cold day and I wanted comfort food. Anyway, the busboy who brought me a glass of water did not want to take my order down, "I don't do that" (Yes, ok maybe that is not in your job description but is it really that hard to take down one order considering the place was NOT BUSY? Maybe 5 tables were occupied) 

When the waiter finally gets to me (5 mins), I order and he brings out some bread. I ate the bread while waiting and waiting... the table that ordered after me got ALL their food first. I ordered 1 dish, linguine with clams, and the table with three people get their food before me even though they ordered AFTER me. Waited so long that I ate all the bread in the basket and waited some more. The waiter takes away the bread basket but never returned with another one.  Meanwhile the table that got their order before me had their bread basket replace immediately. When my order finally came, the waiter just says, "it's hot" and plunks it down on the other side of the small table. I'm sorry, is that where I was sitting? 

Throughout the entire service, I have not complained once. I was still waiting for more bread...finally had to ask him to bring more. The food tasted good but the service was so bad that it made it seem like it wasn't as tasty but I was just sad that the service was so terrible. When I was ready for the check, the waiter comes over and says, "You know, you will get faster service if you bring it to the cashier yourself." I don't know why I still left him a $2 tip. Honestly, I would not come back to sit down and eat at the restaurant, only to order pizza to go. I haven't experienced anything wrong with the pickup to-go service so I'll be sticking with that in the future.
author: Carol C.

description:
Had a personal pizza.  Ate the whole thing (bye-bye waistline!).

The tomato sauce is like crack.  Mmmmmmm.
author: InannaMouse M.

description:
I ordered delivery from Pasquale's in the past, and decided to order it again tonight. The pizza also satisfied my Italian cravings, and did the job. 

Tonight when I ordered my pizza I realized I only had exact change, and it was cold out, so I didn't want to go to an ATM. But in the past I've always tipped well above average!

When the door bell rang I opened the door and expected to see the older gentleman who is always very nice. This was not the case. I gave the guy my money, which he counted in front of me. He then said very rudely, "next time I will not deliver here. do you think I work for free." 

Now this doesn't detract from their pizza, which hits the spot every time, but in this day and age with so many people looking for work, you would think that they could employ people that have basic customer service skills. 

The pizza is good, and they are open fairly late, so I will probably order from them again. But this delivery experience left a bad taste in my mouth.
author: Sara K.

description:
I LOOOOOOVE Pasquale's!!

You can't go wrong with the House Special.

The smell is as good as the taste!!
author: Joe M.

description:
Delicious pizza and salads. 
Quick and free delivery.  Gave three stars only because I've never been to the restaurant, only ordered from work and had delivery -- but, food is always hot and fresh.  Nice over the phone, easy to converse with.
author: Jess A.

description:
The first time I had Pasquale's was when my roommate ordered delivery.  We got the Mediterranean pizza(spinach, tomatoes, onions, pesto and garlic) and garlic bread with cheese(note:  do not eat before going on a date....major garlic breath!).  The pizza was delicious!  All the ingredients complemented each other really well.  I love cheese and the garlic bread was definitely cheeeeeesy( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/jiW_pHMeasZd46mTaiwLEw/l )!  

I finally dined at the restaurant a few months ago and was able to sample other items on the menu.  There's alot to choose from, and when you're hungry, everything looks goooood!  

Here are some of the dishes I've sampled lately:
-Calamari(looks like a good portion, but its on a bed of lettuce)
-Garlic bread with pesto
-House special pizza...sausage, mushrooms, pepperoni, and salami( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/J79s4XsiuM_7BajCtBFgbQ/l )
-Charbroiled chicken pizza...chicken, green onions, garlic, and tomatoes
-Spaghetti with mushroom sauce
-Spaghetti alla carbonara( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/kSUmFAJLh9RAa3A26U1CDg/l )

I'm a meat-a-tarean, so the house special pizza was especially yummy.  I couldn't resist all that meat and cheeeeesy goodness!
author: Patra I.

description: One of the best pizzas in the city, and their white sauce in the linguine alle vongole IS the best in the city.  I can just drink it by itself, as the clams are so fresh.  Low-key and reasonably priced.
author: Gregory N.

description: Absolutely terrible service. Called in an order tonight and got a girl who was just nasty. Really Pasquale's...hire some decent people that aren't slowly losing you business. I was a big fan until I got treated like sh*t...I definitely won't be back and I'm going to make sure my friends aren't either.
author: Hernan V.

description: Nothing is better for wrapping up a night of happy-hour-turned-later-hour drinking that an 11:30pm Mediterranean (vegetarian + pesto) pizza at Pasquale's. Piping hot; melting cheese mingling with the pesto ...hit the spot! High recommend the pizza.
author: Yekaterina M.

description:
Went here kinda tipsy, and still didn't think that their melted cheese on top of carbs was very good, so you know that is a bad sign.....

We were hungry as usual, with drunken munchies, and what sounds better than late night pizza? This was one of the few places open when we left the last bar around 1am but it still didn't really leave us satisfied.....We got a peperoni pizza, classic but always wanted at late night, a medium and three of us barely finished it, but it just wasn't amazing at all. Not quite enough sauce, not quite enough cheese, I don't really know how to describe it, but for a place where outside it says, "You have tried the rest, now try the best" it sure does not match up!!! That slogan must have been leftover from the last place that was here in this location, because this is definitely not the best at all. I prefer Blondies!!!

My friend Sarah got their spaghetti and meat sauce and she was not impressed by that either.....the only reason it gets 2 stars is for being open and having waiter service, other than that....just come here for water for hydration purposes!
author: Sarah G.

description: These guys are great at dealing with me and my girlfriend when we walk in inebriated and making out.  We love to order in our code language, "POM well done".  That is pepperoni, olive, and mushroom, well done. Well done here is perfect to my tastes, it has a crispy crust on the bottom and still has the soft doughy middle.
author: Skye P.

description:
I think the 3 stars describes it best. A-OK. It's definitely not the best food in the world, but it was horrible either. Service was just decent. I mean everything was just okay. Perhaps, my whole evening was tainted by fights and arguments and a massive headache from finals studying, but really, it could have been much better.

Food:
Veal Dore: There are two options - either you can get it with pasta and vegetables or French fries. Really? French fries? That seems so...classless to get French fries at a Italian restaurant. It was weird to get my pasta first, which seems like underdone pasta with some marinara sauce on top. The pasta might have been "al dente" but it was WAY too chewy for my tastes. Maybe 30 secs to 1 min more in the boiling water would have been good. The veal was pretty good; it was tender, but had a nice bite to it, but the sauce was way to powerful. There were just way too many herbs in the lemon butter sauce. Just not good. Big portions though for its price.

Service:
It was decent I guess. Since it was basically empty when we showed up at around 7pm which seems like prime time for dinner. We were allowed to sit anywhere. Water was served right away, soon after the waitress took our order for dinner. Everything was served pretty timely, but it was just average. They weren't particularly nice...nor mean.

Overall, I don't know if I'll be back. I mean I like other Italian restaurants much more. I'm not sure about in the Sunset area, but in Berkeley, I have couple of restaurants that I just always go to. They may not have the best service, but I'm not expecting it. I'm getting something to go since I have a millions of other things to do as a college student.
author: Nina Y.

description: Great consistent pizza and delivery. I rediscovered then when the place I usually ordered from was closed. It superior than my regular place. I love their pepperoni not too greasy but a little spicy. The great thing is their open till midnight sometimes later so it's great for late night which is rare out here. They are also great for parties!!
author: Nadia N.

description: We tried the house special pizza. So good!! The crust was soft and they were pretty generous with the toppings- pepperoni, mushroom, sausage, etc. Will definitely be back for more!
author: Jaclyn Y.

description: Terrible pizza, waited 45 mins after they told me it would only take 15, they gave me wax paper when I asked for plates, when I asked for ranch they said it was $.25 and I said I had a $20 and the cashier said "bummer". 1 star. But hey who am I? Just a customer with a yelp account, no biggie
author: Pedro C.

description: This place is great. It's just a bummer you have to order on the phone. Great toasty sandwiches and the pizza is solid.
author: Dan D.

description: Been going there for the past 20 years. Tonight was the first time I heard there were no free soda refills. Pretty bad to lose a loyal customer over a .25 soda. I even asked and instead of just giving the soda, the guy behind the cash register just reiterates the no free refill policy. It terrible when the food is good but Owner/Manager doesn't care. I'm probably done with Pasquales. So many other good places to eat.
author: Rod W.

description:
No, seriously, to die for. This has got to be one of my favorite restaurants of all time.

First came here with my sister and her boyfriend who had been coming for more than 10 years. I think it's family-owned. Everyone is super friendly.

They have a separate place for the pizza bar and then a sit-down dine-in experience. $14 for a delicious pasta. My favorite is their clam linguine with white sauce...drooooool. It also comes with a side of bread so you can dip the bread in the saucy pasta also. 

Don't miss it when you're on Irving! I never do.

Edited:
Recently came here and they changed up my fave dish - will have to ask for extra sauce in the clam linguine next time!
author: Cookie M.

description:
I am a regular here. Here are seven reasons I quite like Pasquale's

1)Delicious personal pizzas for those of us who live with cheese-haters.

2) Delicious pasta items for cheese lovers and haters.

3) Open later than a lot of other restaurants.

4) Quick and friendly service.

5) Free bread

6)They deliver

7) Awesome old-fashioned cash register

If you haven't been, go check it out. You won't be disappointed.
author: Sarah M.

description: My friends and I call this place Fatsquale's cuz we love the pizza so much!  And it does a number on your waistline!  We got delivery last Friday and it wasn't as good as I remember it.  I normally go there to eat and drink wine, but we were lazy last week.  The pizza took over an hour to get to my apartment and it wasn't really hot.  Plus for some reason, the flavors of our pepperoni, sausage and mushroom pizza didn't blend well at all.  It might have been an off night, but I've had better pizza here, so I'm only giving it 3 stars.
author: Elena N.

description:
I have to say, walking in it smelled good.  Waited in line to get seated for a few minutes.  We ended getting a seat and the waiter tossed the menus on the table and walked away.  No biggie, they are busy.  Ordered food:
1.  Minestrone soup.  The soup was not the normal red one but pea style.  This was just ok soup.
2.  Hawaiian pizza.  The pizza was average.
3.  Penne pasta with meat balls.  Yuck, the sauce was so watered down nothing would stay on the pasta and the meat balls, no.

I'd say this place could a good pizza joint only but their pizza prices are too high for what you get.
author: James H.

description: Veal Parm and Italian Sausage Sandwiches did not disappoint. Large portions left us with another half a sandwich for later!
author: Adam B.

description:
Went again before the SF Pro-Am championship game at Kezar.  Now, just for the record, I have always LOVED Pasquale's.  Always fresh, always fast, always good (even sober).  This last time, the crust was still thin, the ingredients still good, but.... there was a pool of grease/oil in the middle of the pizza.  Now granted, given what toppings you order, you can end up with some liquid fat, but, c'mon!  This was a half cheese, half sausage/schroom.  This big dog shouldn't have been so greasy.

Still tasty, but, I didn't order "The Gulf Oil Spill Special."

Ya feel me?
author: Johnny L.

description:
The Best Pizza i have had in a LONG TIME! I am huge fan of pizza of all varieties. i really dont favor one style over another; deep dish-thin crust because when it is done right i will like each one equally. 
Now the standard crust here is right up my ally as it is not super thick or thin. Sauce is robust and has a slightly tangy and keeps me wanting more. Toppings are as good as they need to be, becasue fresh ingredients basically enhance the sauce the same on every pizza.
I have found my go-to Pizza joint
author: Stephen C.

description:
It was 10 pm and we were hungry. Hurray for Pasquale's!!

The pasta was perfectly cooked (ala dente!) and the portions were generous and filling. Service was excellent. The food itself, while not five star, is definitely like it came out of grandma's kitchen. Quality, hearty and delicious food. 

We will definitely be back!!
author: Melissa K.

description:
shitty service! i ordered pizza the night before my daughter's birthday...they called me in the morning, 10 minutes before delivery, to tell me they under-charged me $50. at that point, i had no choice but to say "okay". WRONG. 

THEN, although the party was just up the road, and they *promised* delivery by 11:30 latest, they arrived much later.

would not recommend!
author: discerning p.

description: I came here for a friends bday lunch because she said she wanted pasta and pizza. We ordered a vegetarian pizza and the chicken pasta...BOTH were really good...I LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOVE pasta!! Service was quick, friendly and even though we were kind of being a pain the server was still really nice about it and even joked with us. Portions are huge! 3 girls shared a medium pizza and a pasta and we had left over.
author: Nancy Y.

description:
YOU MUST ORDER: Pesto/Cheese Bread appetizer !!!!!!!!





****note: on the menu they only says "pesto bread"  or "cheese bread" ask for BOTH PESTO AND CHEESE.....

Amazing! Love the place. If you go to Yancy's bar, Pasquale's will delivery to the bar, I highly recommend if you watching a game or chilling with friends :) 

-JF
author: Jenna F.

description:
For 2 people, I ordered a medium pizza with pesto, mushrooms, and sausage. I love this combo!! it's my favorite pizza combo at any pizza place. So i had to try it here again and compare.

A small pizza is 6 slices.
A medium pizza is 8 slices.

For the medium pizza with 3 toppings + tax and tip = came out to $21.00.

The pizza: I loved the crust! i love somwhat thin, crunchy, crust. It tasted fresh and just how i like it. Even with my favorite toppings though, the pizza wasn't my favorite per say. I've had better. But overall, i was left satisfied.

The waitress was nice and chill too :)
author: Samantha L.

description:
Pasquale's Pizza was a big part of my pizza childhood.  Growing up, my non-foodie parents used to get me cardboard crust pizza from Petrini's until one day I discovered Uncle Vito's in the sunset.  When that place dropped the ball, we found Pasquale's.

Anyway, had a long and tiring day the other day and the one thing that kept me going was that I had the strangest craving for Pasquale's pizza.  I told myself that if I could get through the day, I would reward myself with a takeout order for a Pasquale's Special.  The pizza gods were smiling and I even found a parking space right across the street on Irving (truly a miracle!) when I stopped to pick it up.  If you saw a guy in black Corvette with a big smile go flying by, that was me rushing home with my pizza.  Look out...my pizza is getting cold!!!

Got home, pulled a couple nice bottles from the wine cellar and was so happy chomping and sipping...life is good again!
author: Roy N.

description: Mediocre Italian food. Service is hit or miss here.
author: Jenn T.

description: Best pizza in the neighborhood. Although the chicken they serve on a Casear salad has the texture and flavor of an eraser.
author: Tom H.

description: The fried chicken wings are so damn good! Pizza is good too! Mmmmm mmmm.
author: David D.

description: I haven't tried the restaurant, but I frequently order pizza for pick-up. I think this is one of the better pizza places in the inner sunset (at least within the Irving and 9th avenue area) Everyone working here is nice, gets the orders made in time, and has never made a mistake on a pizza I have ordered.
author: H C.

description:
We stepped inside Pasquale's one strange night. The food was solid, if not particularly memorable. 

If you want to escape the city and feel like you'e in some strange backwater while you eat your pizza, Pasquale's is the place for you.
author: Miriam W.

description: When I Yelp, I (try to) follow these rules (which I wish Yelp would implement): keep it short, don't name names or descriptions of people,  keep it positive, and I'm no professional, so why pretend and write some crazy review. So, here it is: food hit the spot, service good. Place is rustic, kids are welcome. They serve family style, and pizza was fresh and tasty. I would return considering I don't like pizza or old looking places. Basically, the food made me ignore all my dislikes.
author: Lindsey R.

description:
Why no half stars, Yelp?  Whhyyyyy?

'cause gosh knows it's been long enough since my original review of Pasquale's that it's time for a revision.

Short story - best crust in the neighborhood.   I've tried 'em all.  

Plus, "real" Italian sausage.  With fennel and everything.

I've only had the pizza - and mozzarella/tomato salad - both good.  There's a huge menu of other stuff too - some of which also might be good.

It's often a madhouse here when I stop in to place a to go order, and so I have a little more patience for the phone experience of my previous review. 

In person, the people working the register are generally good and move the orders through quickly without rushing.
author: Rick C.

description:
I have to say
The personal meat eater is my favourite always fresh and so flavourful 
Really good italian food  
Spaghetti and Alfredo are also good also
Not a fan of the garlic bread but aside that, one of my fav..
author: Alejandro C.

description: Terrible service. We ordered pizzas for delivery, they delivered something completely different (meat filled pizzas for a vegetarian), charged us too much money, refused to correct their mistake, then the manager hung up on us when we called to have them fix it. Just astounded right now, literally the worst service I've ever encountered.
author: Mike Y.

description: Time must heal all wounds because the family and I went back to Pasquale's Pizza last night after a 5+ year hiatus.  Not my choice mind you, but I guess I'm lucky we didn't get as sick as our last meal here: Their cardboard crust and acidic sauce doesn't slide down smooth.  I'll end this snarky review by repeating some pearls of wisdom from my sister: "It smells like shame in here."  Shame, indeed.
author: Michael D.

description: Pasquale's is still my fav late night food around.  Perfect for late dinner after leaving Yancy's.  I usually walk in and order to go which takes about 10-15 minutes.
author: Heather S.

description: This place is pretty good, been here 3 times already and i'm a fan. Had House Pizza, pesto garlic bread, spaghetti and ravioli.  My friends agree that the half and half was really good. Spaghetti was al dente - perfectly cooked.  Pesto garlic bread was all gone before the pizza came. Pizza did not take too long to make. Serve was ok - didn't expect too much. But came here for the food. Definitely will be back. Thanks so much!
author: Thomas C.

description:
my friend who lives nearby introduced me to this place. didn't realize that it has a seating area for dine-in. looks like a take-out place in the front. the pizza was yummy. and had some chicken pasta. that was good too. but i think the pizza was the best. (it was the house special pizza or something like that.)

def plan on going back again when im in the area. street parking is not too bad but just pray you are lucky. circle around a couple more times, you will find it.
author: Ai L.

description: We were seated as soon as we walked in. We browsed the menu while waiting for the wait staff to come by. Nothing happened for ten minutes and the restaurant wasn't even packed. Thinking that closing our menus would send a signal, we did so as we watched the table that came in after us get their drinks. We waited over 15 minutes and just got up and left. Service absolutely sucks.
author: Esther C.

description: Yummmmy food!!! The personal pizza are the best. But all their food is really good. I love the ravioli. Good neighborhood restaurant!!
author: Kristi K.

description:
It was a hot lazy afternoon during one of those rare heatwaves we get here in San Francisco. I was hankering for a pizza. Usually I prefer the Napoli-style but sometimes just a simple greasy thin crust does the job. So I rang Pasquale's and placed the order. I had no access to ice and was **dying** for an icy cold soda with my pizza. I explained my predicament to the man taking the order, asked for two cups of ice and offered to pay extra for them. He said it was no problem and that they'd deliver in 45 minutes.
Less than 3/4 hour passes and the pizza delivery man arrives. The pie is hot, and he hands me a cold plastic bag that contained another plastic bag- FILLED with ice cubes. This was about 5 lbs worth! It was free, too.
For that kind gesture on such a scorcher of a day, they won my loyalty. And the pizza was absolutely delicious too.

Pasquale's delivers- on all counts!
author: Rachel D.

description:
I was hesitant to come to Pasquale's with Milano's, which has yet to disappoint, nearby.  Pasquale's put up a decent fight though.

The best quality a Pasquale's pizza offers is the crust.  If you leave the crust regular (you have to option to customize its thickness), it provides a consistent, delightful blend of crunchiness and chewiness throughout your pizza experience.  The crust's consistency remains from your initial bite at the tip of the slice to when you polish off the ends that you are holding.  It is able to withstand the strain of sauces and oils that rest on top.

We ordered the all meat pizza and Mediterranean pizza.  One of the downsides of the menu is that if you wish to have different halves on the same pizza, they will charge you extra for any topping that is not shared between the halves.  This is the first time I have been to a pizza place where they do not simply charge you for the more expensive half.  This would have been a greater inconvenience if we did not have enough people to order two pizzas.

The flavor of the toppings on both pizzas were also a slight disappointment.  Although the toppings were plentiful on both pies, it seemed like salt was the main topping on the all meat pizza, and the pesto flavor was masked on the Mediterranean.  I could understand an all meat pizza being a little salty, but I was chugging water from the first bite on like I had just finished crossing the Sahara desert.  I am a huge fan of pesto pizzas, but on the Mediterranean, the other toppings had a more prominent role, making the pesto seem like an afterthought.

The service was very friendly, and we were seated immediately, but there is some left to be desired if you are here to try the pizza.
author: Andrew M.

description: This is mediocre pizza, which is fine if that's what you want, but arrived completely cold.  Does it take 45 minutes to move a pizza from the oven to a house a mile away?  Sometimes, and that's what a hot box is for.   Not acceptable, but also, the pizza was borderline disgusting.
author: Nathan B.

description:
Absolutely awesome pizza!  The couple next to me had pasta, which looked and smelled delicious.  Friendly staff, prompt service.

Highly recommend!
author: Chris C.

description: Possibly the best pizza in the Sunset. I haven't tried anything else from their menu but their pizza is delicious. We usually take it to go so I can't comment on the ambiance or service - they are super nice on the phone and food is always ready pretty quickly.
author: Kasia G.

description:
I REALLY want to give this place five stars, but they don't do refills on soda. COME ON.

I love the minestrone here. Almost every time I've had it, it warmed up MY SOUL. The sandwiches here are fantastic and a GREAT value. $8-9 gets you a HUGE chicken parmigiana/neapolitan steak/veal sandwich + fries/salad. They're all tasty, and the bread is super good sourdough. The only thing the bread lacks is crunch, but they have that SF sourdough taste down to a T. I love coming here with my friends because we all leave happy and full, and it's light on the old wallet. Pizza is very good as well, but I come for the sandwiches and the minestrone.

Best story I have about this place is when I was hanging around, waiting for my takeout order, and I talked to the owner. I told him how much I loved his minestrone. And he had a big to-go bowl of it just packed up in a paper bag, ready for someone else to take home, but he just gave it to me, and said, "Enjoy." The pride he takes in the soup... he probably knew it would end up in me blabbering about how awesome this place is.

Almost legendary status. Just give me the Coke, dammit.
author: Warren L.

description: The broccoli and squash sandwich was amazing. I can't really speak to anything else on the menu, but as a vegetarian, I'm both glad they had a lot of choices and glad I chose the broccoli and squash sandwich. It was everything a sandwich should be and more. It set a model for vegetable content and deliciousness that all other restaurants should aspire to.
author: Tim C.

description: I love this place. It's so comfy and service is great. I've been coming here since I was 4 or 5 and I still love it. pizza's are delicious and piping hot! the chicken wings are the BEST... especially before or after a night at yancy's. also, pasta dishes are pretty damn good! a big plus is that they're open til 1am!
author: Ann T.

description:
Pros:
Outstanding selection of pastas and pizzas; Excellent Cajun-inspired spaghetti; Great, fresh, hand-tossed pizza pie dough; Terrific family-style environment.

Cons:
Decor is run-down; Wine by the glass is very expensive.
author: Gabriel A.

description: You know what's cool about this place? You can buy the food and bring it to yancy's ... well i guess that's why i think Yancy's is pretty cool as well.  You can buy a slice or a whole pizza here. They also have chicken wings. Its pretty decent and the same goes for their pizza.  You can also dine-in if you want.  The place reminds me of the old Straw Hat pizza in Westlake.  It's not fancy but it's very pizza diner like. I think most of their customers are from the surrounding neighborhoods because i see lots of To-Go orders.  Overall, this is one place i will pick before hitting up the bars.
author: Belinda C.

description:
I don't know why I love this place so much but I do. I lie, I know why.  It's their fabulously rich spaghetti carbonara.  I ALWAYS get the spaghetti carbonara which they make perfectly. 

Al dente spaghetti, big pieces of pancetta, green onion and the perfect carbonara sauce(not too eggy, not too dry and not too wet). 

Portions are pretty huge and I always have leftovers for home.
author: Christine I.

description:
So I've been coming here for decades.  (Remember the fire they had that closed them down for a while back in the '80's.)  Even way before that.  
I love their pizza crust.  Kinda has that Acme bread, oven charred taste on their crust.  I always order the vegetarian variety of assorted veggies and it never disappoints.  

Generally recommend eating the pizza in the restaurant since at times the center of the pizza gets too moist from the steam in the box.  I also love their onion and tomato salad with the anchovies and my favorite is their ravioli with marinara sauce.   No one else makes it that good that I can find.

Old fashion decor, great for young families and large parties like my son's old high school baseball team.  Very family style type of place. Parking can be difficult during the evenings on weekends.
author: Doug I.

description:
Pizza is my favorite food! Is that lame?

I like to think I know a great pizza when I taste it, so take my word for it when I say each slice of Pasquale's pizza is straight from Heaven! 

Fresh ingredients are key to good pizza but even more so is the sauce! Everything about this pizza is perfect. 

The service is great here: fast and friendly! Dining in is fun and you get your food very quickly.
author: Natalie F.

description: Just found my new favorite pizza place.  Great pizza, apps, salads and sandos.  Nothing fancy.  Just the way I like it.
author: Eric O.

description: Great food, HORRIBLE service. And, what's too bad is that it really doesn't seem like they care. :/
author: Princess D.

description:
I don't know what's more iconic in the inner sunset: the neon Pasquale's sign or the take-out pizza boxes awkwardly wedged under the arm of every other passerby.  And yet, I know multiple long-time Inner Sunset residents who've barely (if ever) made a visit here, thanks to the availability of superb pizza at both Milano's and Arizmendi.  Though naturally I had to see for myself.

My conclusion wasn't much of a surprise: Pasquale's is popular simply because it's highly visible, it's known for delivery, and it's a large space (though a Sunday night can fill it up easily with extended families and girl scout troops and the like).  The pizza's not bad, but then I hardly ever think pizza is bad, so that doesn't say much, especially considering the competition around the corner.  And their house red is some of the cheapest (and cheapest-tasting) wine I've ever had in the city.  I was surprised to see a full menu of pasta and italian entrees, but I think I'll save it for the far more atmospheric Villa Romana across the street.
author: Wes M.

description: We had my Son's and Daughter in Law rehearsal Dinner there we had 22 people. It was amazing. The food was soooo good the guests took the leftovers home. The fried calamari was excellent, the garlic bread was amazing, the chicken parmigana was so tasty, and the chicken with mushrooms in wine sauce had fresh mushrooms and was soo good I could have eaten the whole plate.The snervice was awesome very atentative to all our needs. All in all I would recommed this place to anyone one I know and also the best pizza in San Francisco.
author: Dana H.

description: We were wandering around San Francisco and decided to check out the pizza for a quick lunch.  The prices are reasonable,  the pizzas are HUGE, and ours was the best we have had anywhere in the U.S.  We came back the next day for some other Italian food. Both of the items we ordered were fantastic. We also loved the great service. We'll be back the next time we are in the Bay area.
author: Casey W.

description: Great lunch ... very busy but we still got good service from Joy .... unfortunately we had a family with a shrieking child that didn't even have the decency to take the kid outside.  Luckily the staff politely asked them if they might be able to calm the kid down and they got pushed out of shape and left.  Oh well .... I'm sure they will write a bad review of this place but maybe they should remember to think of other people when they're out in a public place .... we want to enjoy a nice meal and not have to listen to their unruly kid.
author: tammy c.

description:
When I walked by this place I thought it was going to be mediocre at best from the looks of it. I was wrong though!

The food was sooo good and the portion sizes were great for the price. I've been to three italian/pizza places in the neighborhood and this one is the best. The waitress was really friendly, but when I got take out the service was a little less friendly. Good prices.

The Fettuccine Alfredo was really good and the pizza is also good. You CAN'T get it by-the-slice to go, but you can get a personal size pizza.

Also, yes parking is difficult in inner sunset. 

Lost a star for ambiance. Like I said, I was not  expecting the food to be as good as it was when I walked in because the place looked a little shabby.
author: Carly J.

description:
this pizza hasn't change in 20years and i hope it never will. the delivery can get tricky at times cus if your order around dinner time you have to think about how many other people are ordering too.

the pasta here is great i always like to order with a small or medium pizza.
author: Seaera T.

description: I have been coming here since I was a kid.  I've eaten in, ordered to go, and have done take out.  All have been good experiences.  The service is always fast and the service is friendly.  It's not the best pizza in the whole wide world but it's good enough to be on my pizza list.  I just broke away from the pizza menu for the first time ever and sampled my friends burger and sloppy giuseppe.  I have been missing out! But I'll never ditch their pizza.
author: Britt B.

description:
Place is opened late, never packed, reasonably price.

Ordered the meat-lover and house special, meat-lover is def. much better.
author: Roll N.

description: I loved the Pizza as Pasquales.  Came here from my friend's recommendation and loved the crust - it was thin crust but not overly chewy or paper thin.  It still had some density to it and god, when you eat it fresh out of the oven it's amazing.  I had gone simple and just tried the pepperoni but loved it.  I would love to come again and get some more pizza.
author: Anna V.

description:
SERVICE:  Quick and efficient, meaning they weren't super friendly.
AMBIANCE: Family restaurant, causal dining
PARKING: Horrible, so if you're in a big group, I suggest you cram everyone in the least amount of cars

ORDER: Linguine with Clams (White Sauce)
REVIEW: It was different then I imagined. First, white sauce I thought would be cream based, was really some butter garlic sort of sauce, which was fine, still delicious. Only complaint was even though it had yummy clam flavor in the sauce, it was too runny. They keep the shells with the clams which I actually prefer since it means they use fresh clams verses canned. There was about 20 clams which I think is pretty decent for the price.
author: Jess H.

description:
I came here last winter with a friend who had been raving about this place. Needless to say, I was not super impressed. 

We ordered the House Special pizza and some penne pasta dish. The prices were decent and the portions were huge. However, the quality was pretty typical, nothing that stood out.
author: K W.

description:
The pizza is good when I'm intoxicated, but what I really like (when I'm sober) is their pasta! If you like clams, try the linguine with baby clam sauce--both the red and white sauces are delicious. If you want a heartier pasta dish, go for the Penne Alla Siciliano (Italian sausage, peppers, onions?, garlic!, tomatoes), or the Spaghetti Alla Louisiana (a little spicier, and with shrimp). 

About the portions: they are humongous. Enough for two meals..so now I just get the half order of pasta (note: I think only the Traditional Pasta Dishes come in half orders!--so the Penne Alla Siciliano/Spaghetti Alla Louisiana (Specialty Pasta Dishes) are full orders only). Prices are excellent considering the amount of food you get. 

The atmosphere is family-friendly, and it's a good place to hang out and eat with some friends.
author: Liz L.

description:
I've been going to Pasquale's since I was a kid growing up in the Sunset.   While, this neighborhood has changed dramatically over the past 30 years, thank goodness Pasquale's has remained a model of consistency.

GREAT pizzas and salads!    Excellent and friendly service.    If you're looking for a good solid, flavorful pizzeria in the Sunset Dist, this is your place.
author: Joe K.

description:
came here with my two friends.

1.) my two friends and I ordered a large pizza with onions and bell peppers, garlic bread and cheese and lemonade. the pizza was cooked perfectly and was very good and large enough for all three of us. garlic bread was good and the marinara sauce was nice. 

2.) service was good. waiter refilled our lemonade twice.

overall a good place to eat pizza and I would come back if I was in the area.
author: Mohammad A.

description:
Pros: Open late, unlike most food spots in this area. Delivery is reliable. Nothing else too noteable.

Cons: 
Food is pretty average. I don't really think I can cook and I could make something better. I wouldn't take anyone there that you'd want to impress.
The lighting inside is a turn off, not very flattering at all.
author: Shayna Y.

description:
Every now and then I get a craving for some GOOD pizza...not just any pizza will suffice. 

Today, I had one of those cravings and I put my faith in Pasquale's - a place I'd never tried. 

Friends had always said this was a good place and they didn't lie. GREAT pizza, good service, tasty bread and salad...not too much $$. 

Go! Get thehouse special and side salad...and then let the meal satisfaction begin. yum!
author: Tracy K.

description: It's a shame I haven't written a review for this place sooner because this place is the bomb.com. Their pizza is delicious, but their lasagna is amazzzzzzzing (if you've seen the Kroll show you'll understand *~Publizity~*(if you haven't, google it)) They never disappoint  when I want to get my italian fix going. Pasquale's keep doing your thang! You're making Mario and Luigi proud.
author: Brenda L.

description:
Watch out!   Pasquale's add tax to each dish and round up the tax.  They even tax you for delivery charge. Although it is only $ 0.30. The main point is unethical for over charging the customer. When you calculate hundreds of items they sell in a day, that is skimming.
In the past, I always notice the price is higher than I mentally calculate the bill, but  I do not use a calculator  to calculate the detail bill.  This time I am teaching a child to calculate the cost, and I thought she does the math wrong. Only when I calculate myself , then I notice the discrepancy  and I ask the cashier to break down the price of each dish.
It is then that I find out that they round up tax on each dish and then round up again at the end of the bill.  The delivery charge is $1.00 and they add tax on it.  When I ask the delivery guy for the receipt, he refuse to give it to me and was very rude and ask me to sign on the receipt for the bill because I am paying with a credit card.  There is no amount  stated and I sign it with no copy or the amount adding the tips.They can overcharge me on my credit card and I have no way to even disputes it when I get my credit card statement  with no copy and signing on the bill.  I called the restaurant  to ask for a copy of my charge.
I have a right to have a copy of my bill. At the least a copy of my credit card charge.
When I confront the owner on the phone, he gives me excuse as it is convenient  for the cashier  to do it as individual item with the tax included with rounding up or down.  I do not buy the excuse.
Just be aware of their business practice.
I am sure most people do not care about paying extra chump change on the bill.
I am writing this review for the principle of business practice.
author: Philo T.

description:
Walked by the joint just as it was opening

The smell was incredible.  Pizza...(drool)

Ordered a small pie to go.  Freshly made. Super nice service.

It looked beautiful

It smelled perfect.

Then I got it home...I took a bite...disappointed.  

It was the tangiest pizza slice I had ever had.  If tangy is your thing, you'll love it.
author: lily l.

description:
We went in craving pasta and salad, but once seated we came to a mutual agreement to sample all the pizza we were seeing on the tables around us.

The food itself was done well. The Italian sausage on our pizza was a little too greasy, but otherwise it was good. It wasn't great, but it did have a unique flavor to it which does make it stand out. We also ordered a salad, which had a lot of ingredients such as beans to spice it up. However, they did drown it in a bit too much dressing for our liking.

The service itself was... passing, but not great. To its credit, it was fast, but we had trouble flagging down the waitress when needed. Plus, when we asked for more bread, she flashed us a look like we had just killed a cat...which was odd.

Overall, the place was okay. Not bad pizza, but probably a location that works better for delivery than dine in for those interested.
author: Sami R.

description:
By far, the best pizza I have had that was not in Italy. I really can't say enough good things about this place.

Everything I've had here has been great. The location near the zoo is much more "casual" and I would suggest taking that one home, just know that your car will smell like pizza for days. They have some great special pizzas but creating your own is always an option.

This place is so good that I actually drive from Burlingame to San Francisco just to get it and it is worth the trip every time.
author: rebecca p.

description:
I don't think I've ever had to walk to physicall get pizza from Pasquale's.  But luckily, I have my good friends who will always step next door from Yancy's to complete the delivery for us while we have our drinks ready.  

On this particular night, we had come to yancy's for a "few" drinks (yes those are quotations) after the Yelp Elite party at Westin which was amazing btw.  We had the pizza with sausage, mushroom, pepperoni-now lets stop there.  I am one to believe that sausage and mushrooms are key essentials to a good pizza.  No matter how ever many other different toppings are placed on the pizza, one without either mushroom or sausage is absolutely a failure.  This was no exception.  The cheesy goodness with the simple roasted mushrom and tender sausage on top of the pepperoni made every bite of crunch and slurp so good.  

And even better, they've never failed on me.
author: Vincent K.

description:
I'm gonna give them three stars because I have had better, and I found the pizza to be salty.  It was the house special with sausage, pepperoni, salami, mushrooms and an addition of black olives. 

Though I haven't  given them the best rating, I will give them the benefit of the doubt.

The pizza was take out, and it was lukewarm by the time we got it home because we drove it to Berkeley. I like the crust and the toppings were plentiful.  Also I'm more a thick Chicago style type of girl, not NY style. AND I really don't have a palette for salt, I rarely use it in my cooking so its probably normal for most.

So this is just MY opinion, you should still try it because I've been known to be wrong.... Like once..... ;)
author: Tawnya C.

description:
Since I've always passed this place and saw a few good things on Yelp, I came here on a weekday night where we only spotted about 3 other tables being occupied. 

Initial thought - less people, less wait time on food.... right? WRONG, the garlic bread took 40 minutes to come out. To make things worse, a couple of folks came about 30mins after we did, ordered garlic bread, got their order of garlic bread in about 5 minutes.

Entree time - this was one of the worst Italian entrees that I've had, I've order creme broccoli w/ pasta (forgot the exact dish name). I literally saw lumps of oil on my pasta and broccoli. 

Check please - I waited about 10mins to get the check, when it finally showed up, I paid with my credit card. Gave the check back to another waitress, she insisted that I didn't pay even though I signed the receipt... Then comes running the other waitress, having to explain to the other waitress that we've paid already.... and here I am leaving with a exit note of  "does clowns operate this restaurant? The food is a joke, the waitresses are confused, and barely touched the laughable entree."
author: Ming S.

description:
This place is always packed. 

Get the Mediterranean pizza (PERSONAL 12") so you don't have to share.  I like it with super thin and crispy crust, but they'll custom make your pizza however you like.
author: Harriet T.

description:
All you need to know is Carbonara Stuffed Potato.  Do not question it, just order it.  Smashed potato covered in Carbonara sauce.  This gut buster is best shared as no human alive should finish it.  

After that, and some salad, I could barely get in a few bites of pizza.  But the few bites I did get were very good.  Don't even remember what kind of pizza we had, due to the food coma.
author: Michael M.

description: Delicious Pizza, very good Sourdough Bread, the Minestrone is a winner. The burgers are delicious, you can taste the fire on them.  I got mine on the french bread, also highly recommended.  The pasta is to die for, comparable to any place in my old neck of the woods in the Bronx, Arthur Ave.
author: Earl B.

description: Probably my top 5 pizza in the city. Good price. Good quality pizza, great cheese and excellent crust.
author: Jack S.

description: Pizza had very little taste. Quick service for pick up but expensive. Would not return for pizza.
author: Meredith S.

description:
Always the best. Best pizza, best service, best waitstaff, best pizza, best delivery, best delivery-phone person, best pizza, best salads, best pizza. The best.

I like consistency.
author: Josephine L.

description: The all meat treat pizza was way too oily and greasy to be enjoyable, even at 1AM after heavy drinking. That said, major props for being open late and making fresh pizza fast. Maybe the quality, and the other kinds of food here, are better during the day, but my experience was not so great.
author: Palash A.

description:
Up another star!  Dining in at pasquale's is where it's at.  I love their entrees!  Their chicken cacciatore is awesome!  Chicken dore (lemon caper sauce), chicken with mushrooms, seafood entrees.  I've had them all now and they are all really really good.  Excellent dinner salad w/ italian and caesar salad.  I am a huge fan of this place!  

The service is also really great.  The woman server is seriously the nicest lady and is great at her job.  I love that blue fluorescent light in the dining room that makes the clear plastic water glasses glow.  I love the painting on the wall.  I'm so glad I didn't give up on pasquale's after that one pizza was delivered and I gave pasquale's only 2 stars.
author: Staci M.

description: The food is good but not amazing. We started with brushetta and cheesy garlic bread which were both very tasty, but then again how can you go wrong? I had the chicken dore which was okay but a bit too much lemon. My mom had the gnocci and loved it. My roommate had a mushroom and olive pizza and she wasnt thrilled because the middle was very soggy. Her mom had the linguini frutti dimare and she said it was amazing! Our server was very sweet and friendly. She also was on top of refills, which is something I pay close attention to. Her name was Michelle, I would recommend to ask for her as your server. Very solid Italian food. The portion sizes were very big as well I will definitely come again!
author: Kristen M.

description: My quest to find a decent pizzeria in Sunset has ended ... Pasquale's rocks!  Their pizzas are the closest to the pizzas I used to have in NY ... minus the napkin full of grease.  I haven't really tried other items on the menu, but their pizzas, which I've had almost every combination of, are fantastic!  Also a sign of great pizzeria ... they don't sell pizza by slices but you can have individualized pizza made fresh for around $5 with any toppings you want.
author: S. I.

description:
I like this place for the mere fact that they're open late and they deliver! At least if you're close by anyway. This comes in real handy for my coworkers and I. What's more convenient when you're working the night shift and forgot to bring a dinner? 

As for the food... Well... the pizza is meh... It's not great. There are better options. It is convenient though. What I usually end up getting is the Caesar Salad. It's pretty good actually, and you can have your choice of either chicken, steak, or shrimp... And it's under ten dollars. More recently, Ive been addicted to the All American Burger- really really good. 

I especially recommend this place to all the night shift employees who work in the vicinity. They deliver up to midnight, so it's perfect for a lunch/dinner break.
author: Nathan S.

description:
After a long day at the Alice Radio Now / Zen Fest 2009 free concert in Golden Gate Park, we were exhausted and looking for a place relatively close to eat. After a decidedly indecisive period of deliberating, we agreed to go to get Italian upon seeing Pasquale's. Pasta and pizza is always a good/safe choice for everyone. It looked pretty nondescript on the outside and seemed pretty mellow, which was perfect for us.

Upon setting foot inside, the place immediately gave off this indescribable aura of "legit-ness". Its hard to describe. There is the counter at the entrance where you see people hand preparing pizzas, the decorations inside, and just the overall atmosphere. Maybe it was just the crowd and the time we went, but it was a very calm and friendly environment.

Upon sitting, we got promptly served some very sour sourdough. It may have been my imagination, but maybe our bread was a taaad bit underbaked? I dunno. It was pretty tasty anyway, no real complaints. it went great with the butter they provided and was gone pretty quickly. Our group ordered some pizzas and a friend ordered a shrimp salad. I must say though, this place makes some impressive thin crust pizza. The crust was very crisp, the ingredients were quality, and it came fairly promptly. I got the mushroom, peperonni, and salami (?) pizza. It is worth noting they give a loooot of toppings, which is a huge plus in my eyes. I finished about half the pizza and took the rest home and a day later,  I was pleasantly surprised that it reheats VERY well. Yay.

I don't go out to that area of SF very often and I prefer trying new places before going to a place I've eaten at before, so I don't know if i'll return anytime soon. I dunno if I  say the same about their other offerings (pasta, salad, etc), but if you have a urge to get some good thin crust pizza, Pasquale's is a very good choice to get your fix.
author: Andrew M.

description: This place is definitely a step above your typical pizza joint, but it's not gourmet or anything.  Came here with a friend to pick up a pizza to bring back to Yancy's Saloon.  I think it's pretty good for the price.  As suggested, we made sure to get their homemade sausage as a topping.  I wasn't disappointed, but it could have been late night drunchies =p  Either way, I'll definitely be stopping by every time I'm at Yancy's!  I like that they aren't too heavy on the marinara or pesto that there's separation of toppings and crust.  I also like that the crust isn't too doughy and chewy.
author: Christopher L.

description: What a great place! I read the yelp reviews and decided to give this restaurant a try and so glad I did. Very reasonable prices, extensive menu, huge portions, tasty food, friendly server, kid friendly, couldn't ask for any more. The only thing negative thing I would say is they should have a children's menu, even the half size portions are a bit large for the smaller kids, other than that, it's wonderful!
author: Ray B.

description:
Took home an extra large combination pizza, green bell peppers, sausage, olives, tomatoes, and pepperoni. Not the best or worst pizza in town. It was good yet tasted strangely familiar to Sabarro's, and trust me when I say I know Sabarro's. My past roommate used to bring home Sabarro's from work every Thursday. How I miss those days.

One problem with the pizza. By the time the pizza made it home, the center of the pizza pie had fused itself to the box. When we tried to take a slice the center would not free itself. An annoyance that could probably be avoided by wax paper.
author: Michael H.

description: Good pizza is hard to come by in San Francisco. This is certainly the best option (non-deep dish division) in the Sunset. Their Italian dishes hold up pretty well too.
author: Howie N.

description: Over rated. At 3 1/2 stars in San Fran I expected more. If this was in a small rural place maybe. Its solid basic pizza. Nothing wrong with it. But in a city full of great restaurants I expect more.
author: Craig R.

description:
My friends came over with a pie one night a while back and it was wrong.  I feel like if you're not marketing yourself as a specialty or gourmet pizza place, please do not put seafood on your pizzas.

Pasquale's pizza looked and smelled like a cheese-of-the-sea pizza.  Watching a lot of Lydia Bastianich growing up, she taught that true Italians do not put cheese products in certain seafood dishes, one of them being clams.  The clams baked into the cheese gave the pizza a gummy look and sour smell, but my friends ate it while I found something else to eat.

I have actually dined inside Pasquale's but that was such a long time ago I barely remember what we ate there.  Obviously it didn't stick with me because I never went back and the only reason I was re-introduced was because my friends brought it.  Oh well, you can't be good at everything.

I do remember the wait staff being very nice and the Latino dough guys were super sweet.
author: Susan C.

description:
Used to come here after grammar school basketball and grade school Cub Scouts.

Definitely a classic Sunset joint.  To be honest, if you're not from around here, the decor may fool ya.  But it's actually an UPGRADE from "back in the days when I was young, I'm not a kid anymore but some days I sit wish I was a kid again".

The pizza they still got on lock, this is a no brainer.  You don't stick around for decades serving janky pies.  The pies are legit.

But what I discovered today were the: 1.  antipasto salad which was tart, colorful, Italian, and large and in charge.  I was wowed by the fresh chop, salami, cheese, pepperoncinis, garbanzo beans, kidney beans, and a ton more.  Great starter.  2.  the salami and cheese melt - sure you can make it home but do you have the 5000 degree afterburner contraption to get that authentic crust and oozing cheese?   Comes on a French roll, with just enough salami to warrant a great 'wich.  But 3. the chicken wings (see photo) are off the chain.  The  batter is pretty full on like Darla's down the street - fried hard and probably double battered.  Double battered in a good way - not too thick but enough.  It's seasoned with a hint of heat.  Really really good.  4.  I had the spaghetti carbonara and man, it's pretty rich but it was done perfectly with sizzled pancetta in a medium cream sauce.  Serving size to satisfy two easy.

Sometimes good things don't gotta change.
author: Isaac L.

description:
Good ol' classic pizza. I always get the mushroom pizza and it always hits the spot!

I would honestly NEVER go with the pasta dishes, 'cause that honestly is not their forte' and the pasta isn't special...
author: Eryn K.

description: Great pizza but pretty mediocre service. I guess its not the worst service I've ever had but not the best by any means. That being said, the pizza came at the time they said (in a relatively quick 45 minutes for Friday night) and it tasted delicious. Sometimes you have to suffer okay service for good pizza.
author: Tina C.

description:
I wanted to try Milano's but it was closed for Memorial day. My friends were still in the mood for pizza so we headed to Pasquale's. I've never tried this place, but always saw the guys kneading and pounding dough when I used to live in the area.

We got a table in the back room. I don't know why it's so dark back there. All the tables by the windows were taken so we sat underneath the black light which made our water cups glow a florescent purple.

We ordered one of the 12" (6 slices) specialty pizzas. It had mushrooms, sausages and pepperoni (forgot the name). Our pizza came out late (my other friends had ordered entrees and were about half way done with it before the pizza came out) but it came out hot. Maybe a bit too hot? The pie dough was crust (I looked underneath my slice) and was not that impressed with the dough. It is a thin pizza but the pizza was over cooked and the cheese tasted rubbery. I've definitely had better...

I did like the sourdough bread they brought out for you though. They warm it up for you and it was definitely fresh. I think I ate the whole loaf myself! Service was okay...two guys serving. We got our waters with lemons (because we asked for them) and he even gave us a plate full of extras.
author: Janel Y.

description: If I could give zero stars I would. Horrible service. My friend made reservations the day before and we all got there on the dot and it took 20 minutes for them to get us seated. It was a relatively empty restaurant. When we were finally seated the waitress never came around and even yelled at us to wait when we tried to flag her down. When she finally came over she told us we were getting the all you can eat special and we were confused because we didn't order yet! We said no that's not what we wanted and she got really huffy and kept insisting that's what we ordered over the phone  my friend said she did nothing of that sort and only made reservations. The waitress walked away. It took another 10 minutes for her to come back and take our order. We were so tempted to get up and walk away but we waited so long already and were starving. Ridiculous. The pizza wasn't even that good.
author: Al T.

description:
I don't understand.  I've had their pizza a number of times and it was always so good but the other day, we went and ordered a mushroom and olive pizza and it was wet.  The middle of the pizza had a pool of water on it and there was no way we were going to be able to eat the whole thing before it got soggy.  The caesar salad, however, was large and tasty.

I oversold the pizza though.  So disappointing.
author: Seong P.

description:
June 1 update from my last update
Dang.  Read my update below.  Ok, so tonight, after having a horrible day and no time to hunt for an alternative I called Pasquale's again.  I ordered, and I also told the guy that my last pizza came burnt, and the topping were skimpy.  I was nice about it figuring that good manners always gets you very far.   He assured me he'd watch over it himself.

Nice

BUT ok, the toppings were perfect the pizza was burnt on the bottom.  Yet it was undercooked.  

Ok - I give up.  Villa Romano I'll try you next.   This is a very sad day for me as I've been eating this pizza for . . . .I won't say, it will disclose my age.  But let's just say, you weren't born yet.

here's my last update
BOO !

After raving about Pasquales to a friend we ordered in.
The pizza blew.
Dry
A smattering of toppings
Tasteless
Awful

I'm so bummed
There goes my reputation
author: Cinnamon Z.

description: Pasquale's is my favorite traditional style pizzeria in the city.  I usually get a good size personal pizza with Pepperoni, Olives, and Homemade Sausage for only six bucks!
author: Andy Z.

description:
Mediterrean (spinach, tomatoes, onions, pesto and garlic) pizza with a thin crust... DELICIOUS!!  I would order from this place all the time if they were open late night!  I mean like 2 or 3am for some good drunken pizza.  

They have a pretty extensive menu, going from fried calamari appetizers, garlic bread to sandwiches to pastas, entrees, and pizzas.  Their specialty pizzas run from $16-24.  The prices are pretty decent, and won't break your wallet.  I haven't had much aside from their pizzas, but their specialty pizzas are delicious!  They can accommodate large groups.  What's best of all is that you can order pizza and bring it over to Yancy's!  Great for any sports game at Yancy's.

I would definitely choose this place over Milano's ANY DAY.  Only thing is that they don't serve pizza by the slice, nor do they do delivery.  It's not a fancy restaurant, just average looking, but it's a good place to go if you're craving pizza!
author: Diane L.
