We ordered the house special and it was good, but nothing terribly exciting.  The top was a bit watery which must make the pizza a bit soggy if you had it delivered or took it to go, I suspect
author: J L.

description:
I think Pasquale's might be my favorite regular pizza.  I LOVE LOVE LOVE their garlicy pizzas.  I used to get the individual pies all the time for a while, and the prices are similar to chain pizza places, but way more fresh and delicious.  I went with my mom and sister a few months ago, and we ate in, getting a medium veggie.  The crust was pretty great, as usual, as was the sauce.  The surprising thing was the amount of vegetables on that thing-it was packed!

I went there again, trying a chicken pizza, and it was also pretty great.  I don't know why, but I'm not a big fan of chicken on pizza, but the people I went with are, and that is the pizza we could all come to a common consensus on.  

Either way, Pasquale's has the power to take over any other pizza in my mind.  When I eat pizza from elsewhere, I dream it's really Pasquale's.  That is now the only way I like to think of how pizza tastes.
author: P S.

description: Best pizza in SF! I lived there in my teens, and recently returned and the unique pizza flavored are just as I remembered them! Great family business for over 50 years!
author: Alice A.

description: Apparently Yelp suggests I refresh my review. Well since April of 2008 I have been back to Pasquale's at least a half a dozen times if not more. Still hands down my FAVORITE pizza in the City. Call me a sentimental sap or just a woman with good taste, but I dare you to find a better tasting sausage or fresher tasting mozzarella! Thank you Pasquale's for still being wonderful you. After all these years, you still manage to delight my palate every single time!
author: Susan B.

description: Their Mediterranean pizza is absolutely delicious...all the toppings tasted so fresh and the crust was at perfect consistency. Their antipasto salad with mortadella, salami, and mozzarella cheese was also fantastic. It was a HUGE salad for $10. Great service, great food.
author: Katie S.

description:
Salad and Italian dressing was garlicky...just how i Like it!
Fried Calamari was melt in your mouth goodness.
And the House Pizza had an nice thin crust and was a little salty (which for me was absolutely perfect).

Besides the difficult issue of parking in that part of town, I think it's a decent place to grab a pizza with friends and family!
author: Alex D.

description:
I like this place and, as I've said elsewhere, I'm not a big pizza person.  But, the crust crispiness is just right for me and I like that they put tons of toppings on the pizza.  
However, when we ate at the restaurant, friends who've ordered the entrees have complained that the meals were flavorless, oily, and not too tasty.  I haven't had an entree, so that's all second-hand report.  
But, they deliver, and since that is so rare in the Sunset, I had to give an extra star for that.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Very good pizza. You don't see many people tossing there dough in the air but they do it here. The sausage is dipped in some garlic than thrown on the pizza. 

They have a good amount of food on there menu which is tasty and the prices are reasonable. Their entrees come in HUGE portions!!!
author: Keoni U.

description:
According to the Yancy's review, this is the pizza I ate after drinking and walking around at B2B with YELP (yay)

I hope I got the right place, but this pizza was amazing.  I snarfed down two slices and they were amazing.  Of course taking into consideration this was the hunger (the best seasoning!) and alcohol (the best... uh aweomeness) talking, I kept eating despite being pretty full (the American way!)  Even after being pretty full, this Pizza was still delicious.  I had the pepperoni and sausage, and it was juicy and salty and in my belly.  The veggie pizza was great as well, huge mouth watering pieces of veggies in piles of cheese.

Even the crust was great!  I don't mind pizza crust but I tend to not eat it because it gets too hard or I just prefer eating the toppings... but I finished my crust as well.  Yum, I salivate at just thought.

I really hope I got the right restaurant, but thanks to Pasquale's and to Yelp for introducing me to this tasty goodness.
author: Van W.

description:
You pretty much can't get pizza like Pasquale's pizza anywhere else in the city. It's exactly everything you'd want your pizza to be. As prone as I am to hyperbole and exaggeration, I'll leave you with an anecdote as opposed to a detailed description of their pizza to convey my message.

When I was little, my grandmother would always take us to the Round Table Pizza on 16th and Geary. We'd actually spend a lot of time there eating and playing games. After a time though, we stopped going. I guess when my grandmother passed, it just wasn't the same. It turns out that my dad hated pizza all along, as he had some aversion to tomato sauce and generally had a very Asian leaning palette. Well, my sister likes to order take out, and one day, she ordered pizza from Pasquale's. When my dad came home he saw that he didn't want to eat any of the leftovers in the fridge. After he saw our pizza, I guess he felt tempted enough by the aroma of the piping fresh pepperoni and softly fresh baked crust of our pizza to give it a try. He then went back for another one and then another. I can remember him saying specifically that Pasquale's pizza was better than pizza.

And on a rainy day like today, when you don't want to step outside for dinner...there really isn't anything like having fresh baked Pasquale's pizza delivered to your door. My only real complaint would be that it's kinda expensive. I used to think it was worth it...but after trying other pizza joints that are a little more moderately priced, I find I'm beginning to weigh my options more and more (which isn't something I used to do). Still, I'd recommend Pasquale's, and if you're wondering why the 4 stars and not 5 after a glowing review...you'll know why after you get the bill.
author: Philip W.

description: Service was great.  Waitress was friendly and attentive.  We ordered the house special pizza (sausage, pepperoni, salami & mushroom) and a meatloaf sandwich.    I thought the meatloaf was quite bland it wasn't flavorful and I had to add some pepper and salt to it.   I thought the pizza was sloggy that the bread was wet and it was quite salty the pizza.
author: pengrin ..

description:
I ordered this To Go last night ... I ordered:
Fresh Mozzarella, Tomatoes, Basil & Olive Oil $7.25
Gnocchi with Marinara, Parmigiano and a Touch of Cream $8.50
Total they charged me $18.00 (+$4.00 tip for delivery)

Instead of getting Fresh Mozzarella, I got Bruschetta with Tomatoes & Fresh Basil and my Gnocchi. I called back and I said you guys sent me the wrong one appetizer. The guy on the line says to me well what did you order? I said Fresh Mozzarella, not Bruschetta!!! He goes okay let me send someone back with your order, 20 minutes later I get my appetizer.. I wasn't even hungry anymore. -sigh- 

Not an interesting experience considering he repeated the order to me and on the receipt it says Bruschetta .. he wrote the wrong thing down, after repeating the correct order to me over the phone. Fail!!!
author: Linda X.

description: The pizza in San Francisco comes in extremes, its either wretched or life-changing. Pasquale's is definitely one of the better places I've been to in the city. I came here late last night and midway through our dinner the waitress started blasting disco from a stereo and singing along. It was exactly what I would imagine it would be like if I took my mom to a karaoke bar. I appreciate people who seem to be enjoying their jobs, and the food was tasty (maybe not spectacular, but certainly satisfying) and cheap. I would definitely go back, and I love that they are open late. Grab a Caesar salad salad and house special pizza with some friends, and it is sure to be a great way to end a night.
author: Molly O.

description:
I STRONGLY recommend ordering:
pesto with red sauce, garlic, sausage and tomatoes... you will not be disappointed (ps: you can replace the tomatoes topping with spinach)

Although the pizza is best when you eat it there they do decent delivery as well... Whenever ordering you need to repeat the pesto and red sauce together at least three times... and, tell the to make it with love (they'll laugh a little but it will pay off).
author: David S.

description:
It's one of the few places in Inner Sunset that's open late.  So if you're looking for a late-night snack, it might do the trick.  If you're looking for good food, you're better off going home and making some pasta yourself.

The menu is extensive, but that's easy when nearly every dish involves red sauce.  The pizza was doughy and fairly tasteless.  Next time it's late and I'm in Inner Sunset, I'm walking straight home for a snack.
author: Jamie Y.

description: I've been going to this place since I was 12 and now I'm in my 40's. My pizza had hardly any cheese on it. The girl said she felt bad and wanted to do something. But when she came back her boss said no you have to call right away to switch it because they can't tell what's wrong with pizza. I also purchase about two pizzas a week for my family and those pizza aren't cheap. That's how I get treated for giving this place buisiness for 30 years. I will never ever order anything from them again. Also last the last time I ordered baked tortellini it tasted like dish soap. This place has gone down hill. No wonder the management sucks!
author: Lia P.

description: Good pies.  Service sucked that day with a large party that was there.   I still liked it.
author: Rob C.

description: I have yet to have had a bad meal hear and I have been coming to Pasquale's since the 80's as a kid.  The pizza's here blow me away and Spaghetti Alla Carbonara is awsome for lack of a better word.
author: Mike B.

description:
I always get sausage and mushroom for toppings. Sometimes it is hit or miss. More than once, it was kind of soggy and slippery. It never happens when I oder take out, though. And sometimes they sneak in some garlic salt or something even if you didn't ask for any. Some people can't eat garlic...

Otherwise, if it's a good day, I love it.
author: Lola S.

description:
We had a family routine for a while where we'd be in Sausalito, Golden Gate Park, and/or the Exploratorium and we'd stop here for dinner on the way home.  Given the number of good restaurants in SF, why here?  Location and pizza-tossing.  Small kids, tired out from an outing can watch the pizzas get tossed in the air.  Kids like burgers too, but getting from the bridge to Joe's Cable Car was hard - the kids would be asleep in their carseats by the time we got there.

So this place: kind of a dive, but it was OUR dive, and the food was cheap, and good enough for kids.  It's not a chain, the place has character, it's more or less possible to park, and accessible from our weekend outings.  This weekend I went again, and WTF?  The place was packed with twentysomethings.  It has been empty on Sunday afternoons as long as I can remember.

So I figure that it's been "discovered" and I should yelp a warning.  This is not fine cuisine.  This is Italian food your Norwegian grandmother would be comfortable with.  Italian food suitable for young children.  And the bathroom is not suitable for anyone.

The extra star is for pizza-tossing.
author: Kristina P.

description:
Worst pizza we ever had. Thin crust was burnt, tastes bitter and dry like eating a cardboard. Very disappointed. First time we tried this Irving store,
Sloat Blvd store is much better.
author: Hanako S.

description: very tasty pizza .Good crispy crust fresh toppings and pretty cheap-around 20$ for a large three topping pizza. i've noticed some reviewers stating they thought it was expensive , I guess they are used to dominos or pizza hut. It's cheaper than round table and much much better. I will contibue to come here when in the area , going to the one on sloat is more convenient for pick up
author: Biggwally K.

description: Decent pizza, open late but not ~authentic~. We had a carafe of their house wine, only $9 for plenty of wine for two aka feeling good, granted not the best wine ever. We ordered their fresh mozz appetizer and a medium pizza with mushrooms and black olives. They bring you bread pre-meal, too bad it's sourdough and butter; NOT italian. Disappointing. You need to be serving some rustic italian shit with olive oil and herbs, not the equivalent of american dinner rolls and butter. The mozz app was ok, they diced the tomatoes rather than keeping them in slices, which is preferred. The pizza was also just ok, it was pipping hot, thin-ish and large. It could have had more flavor, it be garlic or maybe the sauce just wasn't good enough. Not bad but obviously SF has much better.
author: Cori W.

description:
Personally, I would rather have cafeteria pizza than this anytime. (I'm talking about the taste here) Enough said! 

But since it has a 3 1/2 star rating, I guess the stuff's to some people's liking.
author: Lauren V.

description: Really good pizza, but don't get it delivered - it always comes lukewarm with a slightly burnt crust. Plus there is no menu for this place online. Eat-in is the way to go.
author: Athena K.

description: Delicious pizza and pasta.  It's a distance from where I live and work in SOMA/Financial District.  But, a delicious Italian place nonetheless.  Prices are decent and it's got that downright, hole in the wall feel to it.
author: Christine E.

description: Great Pizza! Great Prices! The crust is nice, crispy, and light! The sauce is fresh, and the homemade sausage taste great on top. The rest of the menu is great too. The house dressing is great!
author: Kris J.

description:
Absolutely the best. My hubby went to College here and knew Pasquale's then. When he moved back to the area (from DC) in 1984 (with me :-) we went to Pasquale's and have been going back ever since. They make The World's Best Pizza. I almost never eat pizza anywhere else. (Try the ravioloi too. The sauce is heavenly.)

We have been trying, unsuccessfully, to locate the World's Second Best Pizza somewhere on the upper penninsula. Sometimes we want pizza on a rainy night when we don't want to drive into the City. if anyone has a suggestion...?
author: Vicki B.

description:
Lots of menu choices. 
This last time I just got spumoni. 
Always delicious.
My friends got linguine and clams with the white sauce.
They loved it. 
We'll be back for sure.
author: Amanda R.

description:
Medium House Special was around $20.

I thought it was salty. 

Crust was thin, but a lot of toppings.
author: Joseph F.

description: This place is more than a late night drunken pizza joint. It's a down home neighborhood eatery with Italian families galore.  Eggplant parmigiana was a little mushy, skin on, but had a great smoky flavour.  The stuffed potatoes weren't really stuffed potatoes but the alla carbonara was cheesy and delicious.
author: Joseph C.

description:
Haven't tried the pizza.  But the food is consistantly good and always at a reasonable price.  They have an EXCELLENT Bruchetta!

Most the servers seem like there still training, but they are not bad  they get the drinks/refills on time and dont mess up any of the orders.  One female server is really Awesome there and makes us feel very welcomed.

This place is also kid friendly.
author: Lil Jinni L.

description:
The only thing I like here is the pizza.  I don't know what it is about it but I really like their style.  

Aside from that I don't think their other items are all that great.

So go for the pizza and try to get it delivered because it's not that fun to sit in there either.

Even though I just sounded really negative I order Pasquales at least once every two months so I hope I didn't sound like I disliked it too much.
author: Nick L.

description: Authentic Italian atmosphere. Good Pizza & Meatball sandwich.
author: Edgar G.

description:
I'm giving them two stars because the pizza came within a reasonable time and the delivery guy was nice.  We called to order a pizza with half and half toppings and got told a really high price.  I call them back and ask them if I heard correctly and why was it so much.  The lady said that for half and half they still charge for the whole topping - so if you order half one topping and half another topping you will get charged for two, and if you order half two toppings and the other half two toppings you get charged four toppings, and half three and three you get charged 6 toppings.  You get the idea.  If that's the case then I might as well get the actual 6 toppings on the whole pizza if I'm already paying for it.  I have ordered many pizza pies around the city and have never encountered a charge scale like that.  Anyway, I tell her that forget the half and half - we'll just do a whole pie with the same thing.  

The pizza arrives.  They still manage to charge me a dollar extra than their menu prices - but I pay it because I don't feel like arguing with the delivery guy or calling them back.  We open the box and the pizza is burnt on the bottom.  Black.  I don't know if this is the way they typically do pizzas or if this was a mistake on their part, but the pizza was borderline edible.  It was very very well done.  I didn't feel like dealing with them and we paid in cash so we suffered with the burnt pizza.  I will never get pizza here again.
author: Helga B.

description:
Delicious pizza....homemade unlike the chain restuarant's back home.  Love the aroma :)
+ = lots of yummy veggies!
- = pizza sticking to the box. cardboard anyone?
author: Jen T.

description: been way too long since I've had Pizza there. I recommend the home made sausages on their pizzas.
author: Erich D.

description: Pretty good pizza place that also serves other italian dishes. Both the dishes and pizza are tasty and worth a try if you are in the area. Its a good alternative to olive garden and I would come here again if I was in the neighborhood. They do take out also. Parking can be a hassle though.
author: Robert Y.

description: You know, I like Pasquale's when I dine at the restaurant.  But when it's delivered (6 min drive), the crust gets too soggy for my liking.  Besides that, the toppings are great.  We usually get something along the lines of a meat lovers (is that what it's called?).  The house salad is great with some salami, cheese and a bean salad on top of the traditional salad items.  My BF's mom loves this place, but I'd be more inclined to eat at any of the other local pizza places.
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
I live 1 1/2 blocks from Pasquale's so we order from them quite often.  With that being said, I've only eaten in the restaurant once.  See, I'm lazy.  I actually get it delivered because I'm too lazy to walk the total 3 blocks (round-trip) to pick up my food.  I know, it's sad. 

I always feel like a complete slob when I call and order for delivery and for a long time I dreaded the delivery guy, always afraid they'd look at me like I'm a pitiful human being for having them walk the food over when the restaurant is so close.  So, I always tip them really well to make up for my guilt.  Last time, though, the delivery guy actually told me that he loves delivering to us because we're so close and he doesn't need to drive, so I'm not feeling so guilty anymore.  I still tip good, though because they're always so nice.

Anyways....the food is decent.  We always order the house pizza with bel peppers.  This is a good pizza, not too tomatoey or greasy, good amount of toppings, overall, very yummy.  And, it's always hot when it arrives.  I've also ordered some of the pasta's, which are obviously not super amazingly awesome and authentically Italian, but they're good and they're simple and they're affordable.  My fave is the carbonara.  We recently tried the chicken wings.  Now, the bf loves hot wings, and I mean flaming hot wings, so he was really reluctant to try the wings because they're not hot, they're just basic wings.   He ended up really liking them.  The skin's got a little bit of a crunch, the inside is tender and the flavor is good.  If you want hot wings, bust out your own hot sauce and use it as a dip, it actually does the trick.  I prefer these with a side of my own hot sauce over most of the hot wings I've tried recently.

Good, easy, affordable.  I like it!
author: Melissa A.

description:
What i like about Pasquale's is the skinny little pizza.  Now you might scream about how your not getting as much for your money, but i say its perfect for the way i eat pizza: order a medium linguisa eat the whole thing
$12-14. Is that really that bad? i don't think so plus they are super friendly and talkative, unlike many "by the slice pizza dives in the city"
author: Adam F.

description:
No more Domino's or Round Table!! This place rocks!!
I went there few days ago and I just ate their pizza like a messy little boy. Me and my buddy just kept eating while his g/f was telling us to slow down. I have settled with those franchise chains when it comes to pizza way too many times so it was a real joy to eat pizza at Pasquale's.

They offer pasta and sandwiches as well but you should just stick with pizza. They only have 6 kinds of pizza so you should probably make your own. We ordered XL with 4 toppings for $22.50 and it was huge.
Their pizza is on authentic side with think crust but not too thin as they make in Napoli.
author: Shumi S.

description:
If I could rate this place 0 stars, I would.

My friend has his birthday dinner here, and at the end of the night the owner kicked us out for taking maybe 3 slices of pizza to go. That we paid for. Really? Who does that? Jerks do that. Happy 26th bday Alex, you got banned from your favorite pizzeria for no reason.

I'll never go here again. But I guess I'm also not allowed to.
author: Allison M.

description: If you like your pizza on the thin side, Pasquale's must not be missed. They do make a special ultra-thin crust pizza upon request and they don't scrimp on the toppings. The ambiance is simple and wanting (thus the four stars) but the taste and portions are enormous and reasonably priced. If you want pizza + pasta, a half order of any of the noodle dishes on the menu will suffice in addition to the pizza. Trust me on this one. Their half orders are the equivalent of a regular order anywhere else.
author: Janine K.

description: My husband and I like the pizza here. This place makes good pizza. However, there's a middle age Russian delivery guy who always seems upset about coming to the lower Sunset. Several times he asked me why don't I order from their location on Sloat. I tell him I don't like their pizza. He gets mad and claims its the same pizza. I tell him it's not and he wants to argue about it.. Dude needs to talk to his boss and not me. Good pizza and punk ass delivery guy!!!!!!!!
author: Mee N.

description: You know, I really wanted to love Pasquale's since it smells so garlic-y and enticing every time you walk past it.  But alas, it was ok.  Just ok.  It had potential for deliciousness, but there was WAY too much garlic on the pizza (that's a serious statement coming from me - I LOVE garlic).  We ended up picking a lot of the garlic off so that we could taste the other ingredients on the pizza.  I would go here again, but I would ask that they go WAY lighter on the garlic next time.
author: Julie S.

description: Pizza is like sex. . .even when it's bad, it's still good.  Well, Pasquale's is kinda like that ex that you keep going back to when you're lonely and need something comforting.  It hits the spot and satisfies a craving for the time being, but is really not spectacular.  Luckily, the only guilt with which you may be left after eating this pizza is thinking that maybe you should have eaten something a bit healthier.
author: Danielle B.

description: Pizza they cook is eatable, but it is not tasty at all. And for that level of quality it is very very expensive. The only thing that might force me to go there again if I were very hungry and all other places to eat were closed.
author: Darwin B.

description:
The one and only item I like is their plain cheese pizza. I've tried many of their vegetarian entrees and am continually disappointed. 

When the cheese pizza is good, it's really good! Most of the time it's great, but occasionally there is thick crust and cheese.
author: Louis C.

description:
My default go to pizza joint.
Here's the way my 7 step program works:
1. Hmmmmm...I'm in the mood for pizza.
2. I pick up the phone.
3. I dial 661-2140.
4. I order my pizza du jour.
5. I pick it up 20 minutes later.
6. I drool while driving it home.
7. I enjoy a hot and delicious pizza
Pasquale's is always good. I've been going there all of my life.
author: SF N.

description:
It's not the kind of pizza that makes you want to kiss your mom or anything, but it's pretty good.  If you're anything like me you like to mix it up when you're ordering pizza.  Consider adding Pasquales to a 3 pizza place rotation and you'll enjoy it.  Plus, there delivery is rock solid.

Besides, Californians are about as good at making pizza as eskimos are at making sand castles...so it's not like you'll expect it to be amazing in the first place.  Like my father always said, "keep you expectations low so you won't be disappointed."
author: John H.

description:
Dear Parents of Room 33

This last Tuesday, after the great Jack and the Beanstalk play and the promotion ceremony for our amazing 1st graders, we planned on a special lunch treat of pizza for the class.  I had arranged (and confirmed that morning) with Pasquale's Pizza on Irving to deliver the pizza by 12:15pm so that the children could enjoy their pizza during their lunch break from 12:30-1pm before heading outside to play.  Unfortunately the pizza was not delivered until 12:45pm and by the time the kids got the pizza and sat down to eat it was late into the break and many were rushed to eat because they wanted to go out to play.  

I am very upset with Pasquale's Pizza since I called 4 times between 12:15pm and 12:45pm and each time I was lied to regarding the whereabouts of the driver.  One such lie was that the Pasquale's employee was on the phone with the driver and that the driver was looking for parking.  I was at that moment, standing in front of the school next to two or three open spaces.  When the driver finally arrived, I asked him when he had left the restaurant and he replied that the pizza was just finished and that he had rushed straight to school.

After delivering the pizza to the kids, I went back to Pasquales to complain to the owner/manager, Joe.  He told me that he will give ME a free pizza next time I call.  I told him that the pizza was not for me, but for 23 1st grade students and that they were the ones that were missing lunch and had missed out on their eating/playing time.  He didn't care.  I told him that if he really wanted to make it up to the kids, that he would deliver 3 large cheese pizzas (about $50 worth) to school ON TIME on the last day of school.  He told me that there was NO WAY he would do that, again saying he would give me a free pizza.  I told him again that it was not me that was hurt by his lack of good business and that I would never order pizza from Pasquale's again because of his attitude towards children and a school.  I would like to encourage all of you to think about this situation next time you are thinking about ordering a pizza, and I hope that you will consider another restaurant and NOT Pasqualle's on Irving. 

Thank you for your time.
author: Irene M.

description: Great home made sausage, crispy crust. damn great any time. it is surprisingly good, probably the one of best in the city.  O and i like their meatballs too.
author: Quailty P.

description: DELICIOUS pizza and affordable price! I love this place. I am a pepperoni and mushroom kind of girl, so I've only had their pizza and salad, but the times I've dined there the other dishes look wonderful as well. They're pretty speedy with delivery as well. YUM!
author: Amy A.

description: The small cheese pizza tasted better than the XL cheese pizza.  Every Italian restaurant needs to be able to make good spaghetti and meats balls.  This place fell short.  The sauce was ok.  It was on the watery side.  The meat ball was really good.  The sourdough bread that came with it was to die for.  If you can't make good spaghetti and meat balls then the rest of the dishes must suck.  The spaghetti and meat ball delivery tray also go my Jennifer Love Hewitt maxim soiled.  No good.  Actually it may have not been Spaghetti and meat ball tray related.  -____-  I will only be back for a small cheese pizza.
author: Fatty A.

description: Good pasta and portions large enough to feed 2 with one dish. good pesto pasta and good linguini with clams. the pizza here is good too, but i personally would rather get a slice from arizmendi up the block unless i had a large group. the service was really fast and the basket of bread was good. i would say this is a great place for family or large group occasions, but maybe not so much for a date or grabbing a quick bite on your own.
author: Brian T.

description:
This places pizza is very impressive for the price.

Usually order a 3 topping X Lrg and it's huges and filled with toppings.

Only downside is sometimes if you call to make a ordered you have to hold for a long time. So do what I do, when on their busy days I go in and order in person.
author: MysticZ T.

description: everything is perfect. my all time favorite place to eat. i come here for birthdays and anniversaries !!!! we love it!!!
author: Tyler S.

description: Can't be more disappointed. I ordered  artichoke hearts, mushroom, and black olives.  Sounds moist right?  Nope.   Rock hard crust, and cold.  When I called to complain, I learned that they didn't want to send the driver out again in the rain (isn't that why we order delivery?), then put on hold,  then mysteriously disconnected.  Guess it's cereal for dinner...
author: Maureen P.

description: When I was little the only pizza I ate was Pasquale's but from the Sloat blvd Pasquales, that's where my parents used to order it from. Now that I'm all grown up I come to the one at Irving, it's as good as I remember and then some! Pizza is good, solid here but nothing WOW! But I do love their spaghetti and meatballs, one of the best lasagnas! Also large portions and spacious place.
author: Karen T.

description: I love this place even though it isn't perfect.  The spaghetti carbonara is sooo good but I feel super guilty after eating it...wish they had a half order.  Also love the caesar salad and garlic bread, although it drives me nuts that they don't ever cut it into slices.  Also, no refills on soda which is :(
author: Maureen K.

description: I always think I like this place more than I actually do.  Their pizza is "okay", it smells better than it tastes unfortunately.  And it is always wet and soggy in the middle, like it wasn't cooked enough.  But pizza is pizza.  They have a kickass waitress though, too bad I forget her name.
author: Rachelle P.

description: Their pizza is consistently good, which I can not say for other pizza places in San Francisco.  Even though other pizzas may periodically be better than Pasquales, they have always disappointed me when I've gone back, which Pasquales never has done. Now they have an awesome mosaic Jester eating a slice near the entrance of their building. Adding art to our neighborhood is worth at least two stars!
author: Ichiban H.

description: Hmmm. I walked by this place with my kid about a month ago, we already ate so we didn't partake at that time, but as we walked by I noticed 4 police taking time to share a pizza. I put this place on my radar for my next visit in the city.   When I returned to the burbs I immediately told my New York BF that this place may be the pizzeria we've been looking for in SF.  All we want is a meatball pizza and some more tomato sauce on a pizza, Is that too much to ask of a west coast pizzeria? One weekend on our way back from partying in the city, we decided to swing by Pasquales and pick up a sausage pizza to take back to the burbs. It was torture sitting in the car, not able to dig in, I so wanted to but my BF wouldn't let me, so I had to sit their like a well behaved human and wait til we arrived at our destination,which was 40 minutes away.  What's the lure: A frenzy of smells and flavors filling the street, cause they keep their doors flung open and the waft of pizza dough baking, herbs and spices bursting open by the heated oven beckon you to come forward, a perfect street corner location and giant windows for viewing pleasure of the kitchen staff making and baking the pizzas.  What I like, great pizza crust and all around pizza but could you please put more tomato sauce on the pizza and please, please offer a meatball pizza too.
author: Susan S.

description:
This is my favorite Pizza place in San Francisco. Thin crust, fresh ingredients, NOT greasy and when you order feta chesse they just put as much on it as it is makes sense (other places would just bury it in feta).

The place itself is somewhat 'cozy' (run down so to speak) and the waiters are real characters but all I care about is that the ingredients are top quality.

I just love it. There is another place in Denver called Enzo's, their pizzas are similar (top quality, run down place).

My fav pizza is: ham, mushrooms, feta chesse and olives. Small pizzas are large enough for one person, medium is definitely too much and should be shared.
author: Peter K.

description: Just ok pizza nothing great.  I ordered a vegetarian pizza and it was more like a cheese pizza with very little vegetables. And for some reason it was full tomatoes. So it was more like a cheese pizza with tomatoes !
author: George S.

description: Been coming here since 1994!!!  One of many wonderful places that SF Chronicle Food Critic, Micheal Bauer, passed up year after year.  Best Italian Food in SF!!!  My favorite dish is Frutti De Mar.  It is a must have with the red sauce.  The big plus is that Pasquales is open till 1:30 PM and they deliver!!!
author: Cross S.

description: Picked up a pizza from here the last night while hanging out at Fireside with a buddy.  A small was more than enough for two hungry guys, the crust was nice and thin but held up to the toppings well, and the toppings were plentiful.  It was good enough that I'll probably order from here the next time I want pizza even if I'm not in the neighborhood.
author: Joshua W.

description: I don't get it. I don't get the raving reviews. You have several, far better, pizza joints within walking distance. The place "looks" good from the outside, but the pizza is so-so and the price and service is ok. I've even gone back just to make sure I wasn't unlucky. I guess pizza is in the taste buds of the beholder.
author: Rich M.

description: Pizza wasn't too bad. Not the best but with the toppings pretty good. Artichoke and feta. The service was great. My nephews and my niece were so happy to see the jukebox had promiscuous girl, London bridge, and sexyback on the jukebox. The only thing was that it was hot as hell in there. I was sweating the whole time. I know it's a pizza joint but it seemed exceptionally hot in that place.
author: Jhoe G.

description: The tacky decor reminds me of dozens of pizza joints on Long Island and - surprise - so does the pizza. Not-too-thin crust, a zesty sauce with just enough olive oil, and generous toppings add up to one of the better pies in town. (For those who are wondering, Pasquale's No. 2 is on Sloat Boulevard, out by the zoo.)
author: Gourmet G.

description: I think this place is great for what it is, which is a low key pizza joint, good prices and decent service.  I love the pizza, they will make it just the way I request and I also think that their caesar salad is delicious if you like lots of dressing on your caesar salad, it's also a very large!
author: Erin S.

description:
I don' t want to hate this place... It has a farting pizza man on the side!
I have had decent pizza here in the past but my last meal was completely god awful.
I was sitting in front of the kitchen and I could see a bunch of vegetables on the floor and a moldy trash can.. It looked like something out of "Kitchen Nightmares."  The calamari appetizer was super greasy and served with cocktail sauce.  Huh??  When I tried the marinara sauce I realized why... it tastes like shit.   
I admit I made a grave error in ordering spaghetti carbonara in a place like this, since it is a rather tricky dish to prepare, but Jesus Christ!  I could not eat it.  I am NOT a picky eater.  But it was inedible-- soggy spaghetti with green onions and bacon and whipping cream and that's about it.  Not even pepper.  These are not the ingredients in carbonara!  The flavorless cream was totally disgusting.  I really needed to get out of there and my peabrained waitress was nowhere in sight.  Staring at the disgusting dish before me, I yearned to bolt for the door without paying.  But that got me banned from Chevy's (that's another story).  So I waited for an agonizing 20 minutes, staring at the full plate of slop, shelled out $36, and spent the next 24 hours wishing I'd just puke.
Don't go here.
author: Vanessa B.

description:
hmm, tasty. the chicken parmesan is finger lickin' good - that is, if you'd eat it with your hands. they serve great portions for the amount of food you get and refill your drinks and bread constantly. waiters could be a tad bit more alive or cheery, but the sight of our tattooed waiter was as delicious as the food. haha. friend ordered the lasagna - was purdy damn tasty, too. they also have a great selection of pizzas if you'd rather just get something to go. check 'em out. you won't be disappointed.

oooh, the only bad thing: parking. good luck with that.
author: Diego T.

description: Your basic, unpretentious, eat till you pass out Italian joint. I was most impressed by the fact that the ceasar salad we ordered for an appetizer was actually a SALAD, and not iceberg lettuce with kraft dressing, which is what many restaurants of this nature do when you order anything that is not based on carbs. Meat sauce was great, house wine was drinkable and we actually had leftovers. Will be returning.
author: Maria D.

description: Pasquale's is one of those classic neighborhood Italian joints. Great pizza, very traditional, made fresh. You can eat in like we did, or order for take-out or delivery. The pastas are solid options too, and do yourself a favor and get some garlic bread with cheese as well. Nothing fancy, but a good place for a casual meal with friends. Only complaint - I would have loved to have eaten a calzone, something that I think they could make pretty easily but just don't.
author: Nish N.

description: Another authentic old Irving Street italian landmark, there are a number of these types in this area.  This one is just fair, but they do have a spacious and comfortable dining room and plentiful tv ads.
author: Rick H.

description: This place will deliver small orders (under $10) to my work (which is about 2 blocks from the restaurant), which means a lot to me now that I have a broken foot... My office is up a flight of stairs, and there's no way I'm going to hop down the stairs on my lunch break!  I love that they'll bring my spaghetti and meatballs straight to my office door. :-)
author: Jane A.

description: This place is good, and the staff is very friendly. I've only gotten take out, but they are always very nice. The pizza is good, although not the best I've ever had. Only downside? They don't sell by the slice. But they do make personal pies, and that means it's made fresh, so I guess that's good. I would definitely go back.
author: Elena B.

description: Friday is pizza and movie night at our home.  We've been doing it for two years now.  So, EVERY Friday at 5:30 p.m SHARP. I call Pasquale's to order our pizza.  And EVERY Friday I get this : "Pasquale's pick-up or delivery?"  I respond, "delivery."  And every Friday, a 5:30  for two years now, I give the same guy my address.  Every single time he says, "Oh, I don't know if we delivery to that address."  At that point, he puts me on hold to ask someone if they delivery to the Upper Market area.  You would think that after more than a year, this guy would remember my address or my voice.  CAN WE SAY BRAIN DEAD?  Talk about having a lack of enthusiam!  They are all that way.  I have yet to get a nice person who is happy to work there.  THEIR PIZZA IS NOT EVEN THAT GOOD.  So, why do I still call them?  One reason: I can't find anyone else who delivers to the Upper Market area.
author: Lyanne M.

description: Horrible service!!  The wait is terribly long...An hour or more for a Pizza when the place is practically empty?  No thanks!!  Sure the Pizza is pretty good, but not worth the wait or putting up with the staff.  The cons outweigh the Pizza...Stress and food never complement each other.
author: LoveFood I.

description: This is the best pizza in the entire world.  My family has been coming here since it opened.  My Grandparents had one of their first dates there.  I've grown up on this pizza, and they always deliver the best!  This is REAL pizza with lots of good stuff.  Try the Special w/ garlic.... you'll thank me later.
author: Laura B.

description: Yummy italian food! I'm such a sucker for pizza and this place makes a good pizza. The pizza is thin and fresh and you can create your own! I love how when you ask for garlic they just pile it on! Only giving this place 4 stars because getting half & half and then additional toppings cost a million dollars AND they forgot our pizza last time we dined in. I was literally sitting there pizza-less as the waitress sat a couple tables away eating her dinner. Considering my luck with waitresses forgetting my order this was a once in a million mistake and I took one for the team!
author: Jackie M.

description: This place can deliver to the beach in less than thirty minutes... consistently. More than once I order, then order a final drink at the local. The delivery guy is calling me when I am still a block or so from home. I usually stick with the pizza, thin crust light on the cheese, but I've had good luck with their dinners, Char-Broil Misto, as well. I've tried to order form the one on Sloat, and given up for good. They end up calling me back to tell me they're out of a topping or, "I asked once, "Can I get a delivery?..reply ..."No" , So I stick with Irving St, they seem to have it together. Usually very good with few misfires / mistakes.
author: Sleepy T.

description:
what happens when you get the 'Chef' from the Olive Garden and team up with an Army Cook?

you get this place. eating here made me crave Army Food with Olive Garden Bread Sticks and a piece of hospitaliano.

is that even a word?

ugh.
author: Derek Alistair J.

description: Great authentic food but horrible HORRIBLE service from the waiters!!!!
author: Ed J.

description: So I am actually changing my review, I used to rant and rave about this spot, they have good sandwiches the pizza is good too, but the service is horrible and non respncive, I ordered a sandwich they said the wait would be 30 min, after an hour I called and the guy was like so 10 more min, called back 20 min later and was like forget it I don't want the order anymore he was rude and all I can say is forget Pasquale's, go to Villa Roma accross the street or better yet order domino's same quality better service.
author: rob a.

description: Had the raviolis... not that great, had a chunk of motzzarella cheese on top that I couldn't get offa the raviolis itself. I was fighting with the cheese to get to the ravs. The service was nice, the place opens late... Can't really complain.. I guess.. The food was really greasy for me.. I like how they give you complimentary bread. haha.
author: Johnny T.

description:
Best delivery pizza I've had here in the city. Good crust, pizza doesn't fall apart as you grab a slice, good ingredients, just the right amount of cheese. Definitely my go to.

AND, it also has the best chicken parm sandwich in SF.
author: Kaveh A.

description: Pretty decent delivery.  And it wasn't that expensive.  Nothing special.  Although I did like the thin crust.  There's something about that chewy cardboard texture that makes my mouth water.  But it was late.
author: Ryan T.

description: I came here for the pizza, but fell in love with their potato dish. We got the meat lovers pizza which is always on point with their thin crust and piles of meat, but we also got some potato dish which I thought first was a baked potato. When it came out it was this diced potatoes in this cream sauce with bacon and green onions and cheese. Very rich and good and it definitely went well with our salad that cut through all the richness. So come for the pizza, but give the potato a try you might love it as much as I did.
author: Chris O.

description: Great pizza.  I love the pesto bread and pesto pizza.  Service was fast and I could tell the staff worked hard.  I now go back weekly to study and eat.
author: Matt S.

description: Well, the soda was pretty good.  Other than that, if you want better pizza than this, go to Safeway, get something from the frozen food aisle, preheat oven to 425, place in oven for 8-10 minutes, and you have a pizza that is far superior to this place.  I ate here almost a week ago and will never go back.  Hardly any sauce on the goddamn pizza, and that's just for starters.  I don't know these people giving it more than 2 stars.  They must have grown up eating things out of an Easy Bake Oven in Bangladesh.  The soda is pretty good though.
author: Christopher G.

description: No doubt the best pizza in the entire Sunset!
author: Delaine H.

description:
well pasqualie's pizza has been around since i can remember living in the sunset which is over 30+ years.  all i can say is the pizza is great & it continues to be so.  my family really enjoys their food which keeps us coming back.  

the decor really has not changed much since the 70's.  i remember much of the same decor, its abit dated but rustic at the same time.  there is booth & table seating, the restaurant is fairly good sized so there is typically no wait to get seated.  

they offer a fairly large variety of pizza & topping options to almost suit everyone.  the pizzas are fairly good sized, tasty, not overly cheesy nor is the crust too crisp or thick.  there is a good meat to cheese to crust ratio.  the waitstaff is pretty helpful, friendly & courteous.  the prices are reasonable & the pizza is great.  they accept cash & credit cards.

the street parking in the area is almost non existent.  best to get there kinda early to try to find street parking or just pay the 10.00 on 9th & irving (between irving & lincoln way) for the parking lot after 6 pm.   there are several muni stops in the area.  

delivery is pretty quick & fast, usually in about 30 minutes or less.
author: larry s.

description:
bad -- very bad.

this used to be my last minute, one-stop italian place in the hood.  located right around the corner from where i live, they even delivered -- no problemo.  yesterday however, the bf and i decided to order out.  we called and placed the order like we usually do.  when we got there, there wasn't a long queue.  when it was time for me to pay, they over charged me -- lame.  after having to explain myself to the owner, he gave in and fixed the bill.  this was not the worst.

when we got home and opened up our bag, my order was completely wrong.  we called, got hung up on -- TWICE.  the owner actually hung up on us... instead of him fixing the problem and having one of his goon's walk around the corner to exchange meals with us, he balked and hung up on us -- the customers.

if you want cheap Italian, this is an ok place to stop by last minute.  if you want somewhere to go where locality and loyalty play part in the service, stay away.

i will never go back.
author: Andre S.

description: Delicious sandwiches !!!!  And enough food for two or three meals for a person on a tight budget !
author: Katie L.

description: Pasquale's pizza was my favorite childhood pizza. I honestly can't remember why..perhaps because it was the first pizza I had on a regular basis with my family? We used to order this every weekend, an extra large with veggies and salami and I swear at only 6 or 7 I could eat the whole thing on my own. I couldn't stand my dad, he always made me eat it with a knife and fork, but I ignored him (he's another horrible story all together though which I won't share on here) Anyway, I haven't been here since I was about 10 or 11 and I guess I should go to see if it's changed at all. I think they may have changed owners or pizza chefs since then. But as far as how I remember the pizza, it was medium thin, crispy crust and a good amount of cheese and the owners and servers there knew us well as we were regulars. It's just full of memories for me, so no matter if it's the same or not it's getting 4 stars for now until I try it again, for giving me an ounce of joy while growing up in a chaotic and dysfunctional household.
author: Petra S.

description: Still tasty after all these years, even when the one by the beach has gone down hill. I love their mediterranean pizza and the mushroom sandwich on that HUGE hunk of sourdough. It's just a smidge pricey for the typical Friday delivery option though.
author: Dixon T.

description: I ordered house salad extra large with chicken. When I said extra large, they made it EXTRA LARGE. I know people go here for the pizza but they have other foods as other pizzerias have. The salad was delicious. Also, order the garlic bread. That was good as well.
author: Larry W.

description: I love the crust on their pizza's, but i wouldn't recomend their pasta dishes.  I had a birthday party there last September and they made my husband some really salty pasta that was supposed to be spicey.  They were nice enough to take it off of our bill.... but I think i'll stick with their pizza from now on.
author: Sheenie L.

description: I kinda' feel guilty for yelping Pasquale's. I mean, it's like rating an old friend or family member. "Dad, look you've been great, but would it kill you to dress up every once in a while?!? 3 stars for you." Plus, it's not like you're going to take an N ride out the Inner Sunset for some Pasquale's. Are you? Anyway, do you like pizza? Do you live around 9th Ave.? If you do then go to Pasquale's and have their special pizza and meat ravioli with meat sauce (not as hedonistic as it sounds). It's a good place and better than Villa or Milano. Why not a higher rating? Well, no calzone for one. For two, not the most friendly place in the world. Not rude either, just not great service. Still, on a foggy and cold night, nothing beats taking a hot pizza back to the apartment and sitting down to a Le Video marathon sesh.
author: michael c.

description:
quite average, i've got to say. i did not enjoy the pizza. it was mediocore. 

my friends have raved about this place. now i know, they are in bad taste! haha! j/k friends!
author: Regina C.

description: Their pizza's not too bad, but let me tell you what just happened.  We ordered a pizza for delivery about an hour ago.  It was supposed to get here in 40 mins, but it's Friday so we expected it to take longer.  Anyway, the delivery guy shows up with someone else's pizza.  When we explain to the delivery guy, "this isn't our pizza."  He says, "I don't care, call the manager."  He won't take it back, he doesn't even apologize.  So, we call the manager, who after confirming that we have someone else's pizza, asks if we'd like to keep it, and when we tell him, "No," says that in another 40 mins they'll bring us the right pizza, but we'll have to return the wrong pizza to them.  Seriously, people, get your shit together.  It's bad business to treat your regular paying customers like this.
author: Kate M.

description: The pizza, while good, is a little pricey.  The ambiance is lacking, but the staff is friendly.  Better for takeout.  Absolute favorite item: eggplant parmesan sandwich; they have the best bread! And the eggplant is grilled, not breaded, and on top of that its a good deal. Definitely something I crave and so end up going there every other week.
author: Natalie J.

description: A cold Friday dinner march around the inner sunset landed us here. After a short wait we were seated (note, it was crazy busy everywhere that night, so I didn't mind the wait). We had a medium choose-your-own-toppings pizza and a ceasar salad. For some reason, I love drinking regular coke with pizza. I usually don't drink soda at all, and may occasionally have a diet coke at work, but for some reason, I ONLY want regular coke with pizza. Anyways, I ordered a regular coke, and to my dismay, it was from their fountain and only midly carbonated. Bleh, way to make me waste some calories, Pasquales! Moving on, the ceasar salad was humongous, but overly cheesy and with about 50% limp lettuce. There was no discernable anchovy taste either, so it didn't really seem like a ceasar, but when you're starving, you just go with it. The pizza came out, solid 3 stars. The crust was crispy, and with a good distribution of ingredients so you got all the toppings in each bite. Yay! I was all set to give this place 2.5 stars (rounded up to to three because I thought the servers were very nice), but near the end of the meal, the door leading to a back room kept opening up mysteriously and letting in seriously drafty air. I didn't really understand it, and at one point actually got up, walked halfway across the room to close it. Thirty seconds later, it opened again. Maybe it was a ghost? Anyways, we were almost done with our meal, otherwise, I would have said something, though I did notice that even the other patrons sitting near the door kept themselves bundled up because it was freezing in there. Pretty lame.
author: Nora G.

description: This place does it just how I like it--Mostly sauce and runny cheese! Delish!
author: Morence L.

description: Simple, straightforward italian food.  Easily equal or better than 90% of the places in north beach.  Plus I dug all the older italian gents at a table in the back corner laughing and bs-ing the night away.
author: Curtis H.

description: Got the Hawaiian pizza to go. Pretty good and I like their crust. They also have seating if you want to eat in as well. Quick and friendly service.
author: Linda C.

description:
best pizza in the city.

sausage, pepperoni, and mushroom thin crust is absolute best.
we get it delivered even tho were only 3 blocks away. theyre always so nice!
author: Bee F.

description: Stopped here while on a long bike ride and got a mini personal pizza for $4.50 and it was delicious. Piping hot and fresh and even good for two people. I wish they delivered to the mission.
author: Julian M.

description: Like my Yelp rating suggests, Pasquale's Pizza is A-OK.  The food's not crazy good but it's decent.  I liked their Chicken Pesto Pizza, but I didn't like their tomato-based pizzas.  I've only dined-in here, not take-out like most people.  Prices are reasonable, maybe a little cheaper than other pizza places by a dollar to two for the same size.  I don't think their pasta is worth it.  So, pesto pizza is the best thing they have to offer!
author: Stephen H.

description:
their pizzas are sometimes great and sometimes so-so. it has to do with sogginess though, not rancid cheese or toppings (like milano's, ew) so it's always edible . 

decent pasta dishes and super fast (and late!!) delivery seal the deal.
author: kittenfart s.

description: The bread makes up for anything that is wrong with this place. I've heard it is home made but I can't confirm that. I've never had the pizza, but I dream about their cheesy garlic bread. I usually order the lasagna, but the meatball sub is great (because it's on the bread) and cheap! Under $7.00 I think.
author: Emily W.

description:
I forgot how good the pizza was here.  The first time I had it was about 3 yrs ago and things have not changed.  Their medium was like a large.  The crust, thin with just enough crispness.  The sauce was fresh and not too salty like some places.  The house special came loaded with meats and mushrooms (it was actually a little too much).  We also had an order of the Frutti di Marre Linguini.  I could not believe how much seafood was in the dish.  Not your avg. 2-3 pieces of each shellfish; the plate was loaded with clams, mussels, scallops, and squid (I forgot if there were prawns).  We had to wonder if they got the linguini portions mixed up with the seafood.  I don't know about others, but our server was very responsive and cordial.  The owner even helped seat us.  I did notice that some of the younger waitresses looked like they didn't like the work, but we didn't have to deal with them.  I'm coming back for the Rib-eye...

After coming back here recently (9/1), and having gone to Gaspare's the previous week, I'm going to have to take Pasquale's down a notch.  The pizza this time came out a little chewey and not as great as before.  I still really enjoy this place though, so I still give it high marks...maybe a half-star less.
author: JeFF T.

description: I ordered Hawaiian for delivery: pineapple and ham. It was very soggy pizza. And very salty!! Pasquale's make their sauce "old traditional way"? Pizza sauce tested like some canned marinara used well beyond its expiration date. I only added one more star - because customer service was nice on the phone and delivery took about 40 min, as promised
author: Natalya C.

description: I'm a big fan of this place.  My first love is Giorgio's (closest I've come to my hometown pizza in New Haven, CT).  But when I'm having a lazy rainy Sunday home watching movies, this place is great because they deliver and they always tell me about 40 minutes, and then my doorbell rings in about 20 minutes.  I get a sausage and onion pizza with extra cheese EVERY time... and holy crap it hits the spot EVERY time.
author: Matt L.

description: 5 stars because I was named here.  My parents were contemplating what name to give me over a couple slices.  It was Lauren or Sarah.  Personally, I think Lauren was the right choice.
author: Lauren S.

description: I think I'm probably the only one here who never had nor will have pizza at Pasquale's. I always sit down when I'm here and usually order the chicken parmigiana or strip steak. Entrees typically range from 9-15 depending on what you get, steak is obviously more expensive. The food and service is good in the restaurant.  The atmosphere is okay, it's not top notch facilities but it's always packed. It also caters to a lot of people I've seen just as many couples there as I have families and friends.
author: Catherine M.

description: Wow..I'm really surprised with some of the positive reviews.  I've been here twice.  While the pizza was just okay, the entrees were really disappointing.  The dinner rolls were dry and hard as rocks.  I ordered the meat lasagna, which barely had any sauce and cheese was not thoroughly melted .  The bf had the linguine clams with white sauce, it was so bland it tasted like cardboard.  I would have rather bought a frozen Sara Lee's lasagna from my local groceries.  Or even yet, I would have made one myself and it would have tasted better.....AND I don't even know how to cook.  Btw, I saved my leftovers for my dog...well at least she enjoyed it..
author: hello k.

description: This is my all time favorite neighborhood pizza place. I'm a huge fan of pizza and have tried a lot of places everywhere but I always crave Pasquale's.
author: Deb C.

description: One of our go to places when we feel like eating pizza. We usually get a mushroom pizza and sometimes we'll get the antipasto salad which is huge.  Last time I made the mistake of asking for double mushroom... I was really craving mushrooms and thought what would be the harm in order more mushroom.  Don't do it guys! It makes the pizza soggy.  I was slightly disappointed and wanted to hit myself for making that choice.  It's all about the crust and when its soggy it's bad news.  I won't blame them for my bad choice, but now I know and knowing is half the battle!
author: Alice C.

description: The pizza is just okay... I'm giving this place 4 stars just for their french burger. It's fingerlickin' good. Smothered in mushrooms, bread that's crunchy on the outside/squishy on the inside, and CHEESE. So damn good.
author: Julie M.

description: Everything written here is true: there are a lot of elderly people, the decor is really old, and the waitresses are super nice and have been there forever. It feels like eating with a group of your parents' friends who all only want to spend $5. However, the food is pretty decent. The pizza is pretty good. The pasta dishes are really good. The hot melted sandwiches are great. There are definitely some bad pizza places in the Sunset. We are quite picky and we happen to like this one. I usually get takeout or delivery (see sentence 2 above).
author: p v.

description: i've been coming here since i was a kid.  i always felt at home here.  during my last visit my baby made a big mess & i felt bad but the waiter assured me that it was ok & not to worry! pizza is always good, salads are always fresh, bread is just so warm & yummy when it comes to the table! never a hair in our food! i will definately come again!
author: Angel G.

description: after a long day at work, lots of walking, and three bars worth of drinking; a slice of this pizza is divine! six of us shared a small pizza and it was pretty big. the staff was very nice, they were closing in about 10 mins by the time we sat down to eat and were extremely kind& warm to us. the pizza made our tummies happy, and probably prevented many-a-hangover/roadside vomit.
author: Stella C.

description: Rivals "Two Boots" in Brooklyn for the BEST pizza I've ever had. Make sure you try a pizza with sausage!
author: Megan S.

description: The beers in here are cheaper than at Yancy's Saloon a few doors down.  Service is quick and the pizzas are never disappointing from my experiences there -I've been there many times for eat-in and take-out.        Plenty of seating assures never a wait in line.
author: Marjorie B.

description: The pizza is okay. Notihng super special. Kinda awkward in there though cause everyone was elderly... Could've went to Cybelle's for cheaper and more distinctive pizza.
author: Katherine C.

description: We love this pizza at the Academy, from the first time I ordered it everyone has loved it.  I have even put on a party there for the Aquarium dept.  Good food.
author: Candace B.

description: I always go here with my girlfriend when we want a nice hearty Italian meal.  Their sandwiches and pastas make a good lunch and their portions are super huge!  Although I've never had their pizza, it smells pretty good in the dining room. If you want takeout for a family dinner, they also sell a whole or half roast chicken.  They also have Italian beers and wines.  The dining room is spacious and service is adequate.
author: Chi N.

description:
I absolutely love the pizza crust, the sauce, the cheese....really great, classic pizza. I order the pepperoni and jalapeno and my boyfriend always gets his half with the house special. I really don't think I've ever had better. 

They are always busy so this should tell you something about why they might have issues with keeping up with everyone's orders, so we always pick-up or dine-in and have never had an issue. When we choose to pick-up they have it ready withing 10-20 minutes, even on their busy Friday nights.

Pasquale's is definitely my favorite pizza place!!
author: sherri s.

description: For the best thin crust around with a super friendly staff, we always trust Pasquale's.  They make an awesome garlic and pineapple
author: Andrea M.

description: For a total dive of a pizza joint, this place isn't bad. It's actually surprisingly good. The late hours make it a great destination after a few drinks at Yancy's too. Sure the atmosphere is...simple....but the staff is friendly, and the food is good, and served quickly.
author: Barbs J.

description: This place is OK.  I prefer Milano's around the corner.
author: Larry A.

description:
pasquales makes pizza, but ive never had it. 

they also make other stuff... which ive had... some of it anyway. and you know what? that some stuff ive had was kinda, you know, pretty good.

actually, ive only been here once... and that was earlier today.

yes, this review is lame. no, it probably wont help you. if you want to know how pasquales is, go eat there. you probably wont be dissapointed, but you probably wont be wowed. at least youll probably be full. and if you arent... i dont know... i cant really help you then. gastric bypass, maybe?
author: N. B. K.

description: This is a terrific family style, cozy pizza joint.  I've never been disappointed in anything I've ordered here. Good for groups, good house white wine, really yummy pizzas and pastas.  The staff is also very friendly and I have no complaints about the service.
author: Audacity L.

description: Really great pizza!  The service is also very nice and attentive in a very laid back and relaxed environment.  Sometimes hard to find parking so take the N Line if you can.
author: Denny R.

description: Actually not as good as I expected from the reviews.  It was ok.  But certainly not a pizza I HAVE to have again.  It is conveniently located though and is open late, both pluses.
author: A L.

description:
5 stars for courtesy and speedy delivery.  2 stars for the food, based on: a) greasy pizza (grease literally soaked through a corner of the box -- I soaked up grease from the pizza with paper towels); b) pizza was really, really salty (pizza is usually salty, but whoa!); c); soggy crust; and d) an odd taste in the garlic bread that left me unable to eat it (and I rarely encounter the garlic bread that I dislike).

Overall, probaby fine if you're 17, drunk, or eating at 2 am.  If you're older, sober, fully awake, or more discerning, well...
author: Steve R.

description:
Food Great

Usually the service is great.

I thought I was going to flip out when they said that free refills for soda were not a custom in SF.  How many places do you know that don't give free refills?  I got the tea instead, looked over for the pink sugar, all there was was Equal.  I asked for some SweetnLow or Splenda.  THey didn't have either.  I sent the tea back, and then they wanted to charge me for it.

Last night's service sucked.  Regarding the beverage service the server took a little bit of attitude.  

Overall I just didn't feel like they wanted my business.  I give them something for the good food.
author: Stu J.

description: When I order out this is who I call. The pizza is pretty decent here. They don't typically depend on all the crazy toppings to make the pizza good. The crust is good, and made correctly. Their pasta is decent too. Boy if they could be open late night I would be set.
author: malarky j.

description: This is your classic hole-in-the-wall Italian restaurant. The portions are huge, their pizza is one of the best in the City and their prices are reasonable. Bonus points for the mural of the Coliseum on the wall with the black light above it.
author: Ken S.

description: I've only had the pizza delivered, so I will not go into too great a detail.  I must say though that they use round slices of cheese on their pizza instead of the shredded sort and that makes them righteous.  most righteous.
author: Charley B.

description: So I use to live a block away from this gem and would alwaysssssssss go there after coming home from a booze cruise or just if i was plane starving.  The pizza is stellar.  If you are a meat eater have the house special or anything having to do w/ meat.  I am sure the veggie pizzas are great but I want the carnage.  The older gentleman who is always behind the register is the owner I am guessing.  We would always make sure "we" single gals got our to go orders first.  I am a happy customer.  Keep the slices coming!
author: Nicole F.

description: Ehh...too hyped up for what it really is..Just a typical pizza/Italian restaurant. The pizza really isn't that great and the prices are more expensive than, let's say Senoire's. I have also ordered from here, and it still wasn't great...The pizza is bland..the only flavor there is is from the toppings itself, which doesn't really constitute as a good slice of pizza.
author: Jessica h.

description: When I was younger I use to come to this place alot.  Like every week.  Of course when I got married things changed.  Well five years later, I was excited to find out it was still in business.  I was impressed the ambiance didn't change.  I was disappointed with the pizza though, it had a burnt taste and was kind of chewy.  I probably would try it again but I would have to convinced my hubby....
author: May A.

description:
Pasquales is as close to NY style pizza as you can get.

It's long soggy but yet slightly crisp slices w/real cheese..heavy ingredients and a hearty sauce make it truly worth coming too.

I prefer thinner slices of pizza and Pasquales is that...w/lots of rich hearty toppings.

Parking is a BYOTCH in this area of San Francisco.  You're battlling for position w/ all of these watered down sushi joints..another pizza place that's not so good, and an irish pub down the street.  Not to mention a jamba juice, starbucks etc etc.   

I dated a girl who lived around here and it took 30 minutes to just PARK..That didn't last very long...

Turns out also that the owner of Pasquales is my parent's neighbor over in Belmont!   He's a really pleasant man, and loves golf, his family and his restaurant.   

one note.  the pizza is BEST when he's there....
When he overseas the pizza..it turns out richly sauced and very flavorful.

For some reason..when his workers are by themselves..the pizzas tend to be doughy and less sauced.

YOu take your pick..but I'll go when he's there..
author: Michael L.

description:
lately, i've been disappointed with this place.  its in my neighborhood so i' ve always been pretty loyal to it.  and i'm from Chicago so i have so strong opinions about pizza - most importantly, that I love it in just about all forms.  

that said, the past few times i've ordered, the toppings have been cut way way too big making the pizza wet and under cooked.  for delivery, you pretty much have to put it in the oven to finish it off  and make sure that it isn't soggy.  ;et's face it - soggy is never a good word for pizza.  

i'm going to try a few other places in the hood before I order from here again.  sorrry, pasquale's.
author: Erin K.

description: We used to order delivery from here all the time. The pizza is OK it comes warm...I used to love the Chicken Parmesan sandwich it would last me at least 2 days, huge and super yummy...then it became inconsistent, the salad I ordered was nasty and now I am scared to order again, I do not like to be disappointed.
author: Dee D.

description: 4 stars for the ridiculously large portions of everything on their menu: if you need food that stretches a couple of servings, this is the place to doggie bag your leftovers, the loaded baked potatoes are huge, pizza is always good, and their chicken parm sandwich is yummy, entrees are always huge and come with pasta w/red sauce on the side and steamed vegetables, staff is great when you catch them before peak times, but when it's peak times its a whole new ballgame, it gets really loud and hot in the dining room, staff always seems shorthanded, and some of them can get really moody, don't get me wrong, most of them are great and friendly, but when it gets crowded after you get served your food, you are on your own.....
author: Jenniflava R.

description: In this area you have better options for pizza (mainly Milano's) but this is a nice place to get a hot Italian sandwich and a beer, lots of seating space, very friendly atmosphere and service.
author: Alex K.

description: Whenever I am back in the city, it is a must to eat here. Prices never change, quality is still heart clogging good. I still see the same cashiers and cooks from the past decade so it just brings back memories. Their meatball sandwich is something to live for, I even ask people to drive down with one to So Cal so I can take a munch outta that hoagie from heaven.
author: Ray H.

description: I've been going to Pasquale's for quite a while now, it's an excellent place to grab some take out, and although I do enjoy the pizzas, my latest discovery was that they have some nice sandwiches as well.  I've really been into the rib-eye steak sandwich of late.  The area is usually pretty hard to park, so if you are just picking up, I'd suggest having someone along with you to hop out and grab the food.
author: Kenton W.

description:
this place serves good food for a almost good price.  the thing is...it never lets me down if i'm hungry.  

And i like waiting for my to go order, listening to the old italian guy exercise his sailor's mouth.  I did not know you could integrate so many swear words into one sentance....
author: william c.

description: I was sick at home today and DYING for some eggplant parmesan/parmiagno (sp) and this was the only place I could find that would deliver to me at 2 pm in the outer richmond. It was exactly what I was craving! The dish was huge and came with pasta on the side as well as veggies, and a huge thing of bread. To really pig out, I got the bruschetta too, which was excellent. They delivered in about 40 minutes.
author: Jen L.

description: I seriously wish Yelp would allow half-stars because that's what this place deserves. I attempted to have dinner here this past Friday, but seeing as how no one ever came to our table to even say hello or anything, I left and I won't be back.
author: Lola D.

description:
i've been here a couple times and it was always good!

the pizza was great the first time i went there and i had cheese ravioli with pesto sauce this time around. Loved it!

the waitress was really friendly and made us laugh! the service always makes it a great experience. we're gonna go back everytime we have a craving for pizza or pasta. =)
author: Anthony H.

description:
I am thoroughly confused by the reasonably high ratings here, I would swear we were talking about a different place.  

Looking at it, it looks I should serve a decent slice of pie.  I love the cheesy tablecloths, the entire vibe of the place.  BUT - I order pizza.  And it defines mediocre.  The cheese was okay, the sauce was even pretty good.  But the crust - you could get better crust taking a supermarket pizza home.  I am seriously disapointed....
author: Charles V.

description: I love Pasquale's salami pastrami green pepper mushroom pizza.
author: miriam b.

description: I really have no complaints here.  Pasquale's is quick, cheap, and delicious.  I've never eaten at the actual restaurant, but I can (and do) wholeheartedly recommend delivery.  Good stuff.
author: Kevin G.

description: Everything looked apetizing reading the menu, but when we got our food. I was pretty dissapointed. We ordered the penne w/ chicken & mushroom, Eggplant parmigiana and calamari. The calamari was good, but the rest was very bland. It looked like they had excess pasta sauce and just threw in on there. There was no taste at all. I figured if you have a 4 page menu, the food will be a hit or miss. Unfortunately we got all the misses. A friend recommended this place so I was expecting more. It also seems like people here are talking more about the pizza rather than pasta. Well, maybe next time.
author: Jonathan C.

description: I'm not going to write about the pizza. I want to write about how awesome the pasta is here. I always order the Penne and get it with white sauce, It's one of my favorite items in there next to I guess...their pizza. The service is flawless, they treat you like family in there and that is even when you are ordering to go. Soda in a can for a dollar and some of their food item prices is what gives this place an almost perfect score, but of course you shouldn't let that deter you from eating here. It's great...beware the atmosphere though.
author: James J.

description: personal thin crust cheese pizza for $4.50, add 50-cents for each additional topping, such a great deal.
author: Ethan L.

description: In terms of Italian and pizza takeout, this place is the best in the neighborhood for the price. Inexpensive yet delicious pizza. The meatball sandwich is a great option...cheesy, meaty goodness!
author: Nick L.

description:
I'd have given Pasquale's easily 4 stars when I last ate there about 3-1/2 years ago (when I lived in the Bay Area a friend and I used to eat there almost every Sunday afternoon).  But since 2006 it's changed, and not for the better, a far cry from when I was a loyal customer from 1990 to 2006.

First, the good:  Actually, the pizza and Caesar salad we ordered was excellent.  No complaints at all.  Made just the way we ordered it.

Now, the bad (and why I only rated them 2 stars):  I ordered iced tea, but forgot they use that funny-tasting (to me, anyway) tea that's sweetened or flavored or whatever.  So I asked the server to switch to coffee.  (They don't offer free refills on sodas, and one soda will never last me an entire meal, so iced tea or coffee works for me, which they do refill.)  The coffee was awful, like it had been sitting on the burner for awhile.  It took extra creamer to lessen the bad taste, and I had to keep asking for more creamers (they'd give me 2 or 3 of them at a time, as if they were rationing them).  Later I did get "fresh" coffee, but I noticed rather than making an entire fresh pot, they just poured a little water (enough for a cup or two) into the coffee machine, and this time it was as if they used waaaaaay too much coffee and not enough water (I love my coffee strong, but not to the point of unbearable).

Moreover, I remember the friendly and attentive servers from the 1990s and early 2000s.  No more.  I mean they're friendly,  but the service could be a bit more attentive.

Bottom line, if you're getting take out and providing your own drinks at home, go for it.  Funny-flavored iced tea and lousy coffee and so-so service won't be an issue and you will get excellent food for sure.  But if you're eating in, go elsewhere (e.g., The Sausage Factory or even Round Table Pizza).
author: Tony T.

description: This a good spot for ordering pasta late at night--portions are generous, and sauces are generally tasty. We were very disappointed with their Pizza, however. Having read the good reviews we ordered an extra large that was half one of their specialty combos and half another. When we picked it up the bill was $40 because, as we later found out (and was not mentioned over the phone), if you do half and half you are charged for each topping individually, not for the more expensive of the two halves. AND, to add insult to injury, the middle of the pizza was soggy, undercooked and stuck to the box.
