The parts that were cooked tasted like an average pizza to us, although losing an unexpected $20 extra will put a bad taste in your mouth...
author: J T.

description: You know that "Meat Lover's Pizza" from that one national chain that we will leave unnamed? Well, that has nuttin' on the House Special from Pasquale's. Carnivores Unite!
author: Ti I.

description: This pizza beats the Pizza chains like Round table, etc, but not by much. It's a great place to eat when you are drunk and want to prevent a hangover. I will admit they give big slices and the guy there is nice, but the pizza is not great, really...I really wanted to like it, too! I'd rather order a classic pizza hut pan or if i want a really good pizza I'd order Cybelle's Pizza!
author: M R.

description: I'm not a fan of their pizza because I find it too greasy, lacking in toppings and pretty flat like the cold pizza on tv shows.  BUT, their homemade MEATBALL sandwich is to die for! YUM. For $6.25 you get this HUGE french roll (like the fresh ones they sell at grocery stores for $2) filled with large homemade meatballs, meat sauce and mozzarella.  Then they stick it in the toaster/broiler so the cheese gets melted and oozy and the bread is crunchy and toasted.  Even comes with a salad!  How's that for a deal!
author: SFFoodie F.

description:
dive pizza, for sure.  soggy crust.  poor ambiance.

but i respect their longevity!
author: kelly d.

description:
I admit, I'm not a huge pizza connoisseur, but the pizza here was fine to good. The thing that I was most concerned with was the service. My waiter was creepy, to say the least, and all the other workers were hanging around the front of the restaurant eating and STARING at me.

However, I can say that the service was quite prompt. Probably because nobody else was there.
author: Lisa B.

description: I've been eating here since the late '70s, and the pizza and pasta are consistently delicious.  And their salads and pitchers of soda are a bonus.  It's one of two places in SF where I'll go for pizza (unless I want deep-dish!).  The service is also fantastic - the servers are so sweet.  Alas, sometimes the pasta could be a bit watery - it's not drained enough!
author: Michael S.

description: The pizza was satisfactory but the service was horrible.  he was pleasant when we entered but once we said we were doing 'take out' he was rude.
author: Liz L.

description: $6 personal chicken and jalapeno pizza less than 10 min from my place? sold.
author: Sean M.

description: Great for delivery.  Good Pizza in the Sunset.  Their pepperoni is piled on.
author: Steve Y.

description:
Pasquales Pizza is the best pizza in San Francisco.  Joe who is the manager is very friendly and is usually at the restaurant with a big smile to greet you.  I have been going there for 25 years and it seems that Joe has not aged in those years, which I find very odd as he looks the exact same year after year.

The pasta is as good as the pizza, I highly recommend any of the chicken sautee dishes which is their specialty.  Also, try the seafood pasta dish which is awesome and reasonably priced.

Their pizza dough is home made from a multi generational recipe, sweet and very substantial....

The service is excellent from a group of waitresses who have been there forever.

I recommend the mushroom and sausage pizza, or just mushrooms if you have a sensitive stomach.

If you have room for desert I recommend the new york cheesecake or chocolate cake which settle the garlic taste and put a nice ending to the meal.
author: louis b.

description:
Just went here last night. 

Good atmosphere, tasty pizza, service was fine, and the beers were $2.25.

I would recommend it as a place to eat in with a group of friends who are looking for a casual meal in a decent atmosphere.  Not tons of kids were there when were, but I'm not sure why...

The cheap beers were a huge plus.

Good place to eat.
author: Taylor B.

description: we dine here twice and i love it... always pick up our meat lover and you can't go wrong with a pitcher of coke too, i must say it one of the better for san francisco... hard to find a good pizza joint these days!
author: JessePanda C.

description:
ok i can't dog on the pizza because it's good. but!

SERVICE: i think i might have dined here once, but most of the time i order at the register and take it to go but everytime i've done that some kid who takes my order looks either stoned out of his mind, or is on an ego trip.

FOOD: the food is always really good.
author: san francisco k.

description: We order from this place at LEAST once a week.  Great pizza -- fast delivery!
author: Jen H.

description: Even though I'm lactose intolerant... I'll take a break from my no dairy diet so I can splurge on Pasquale's pizza. I'll pay for it later. But its worth it.
author: timmy l.

description: I have been eating Pasquale's Pizza, as often as I can, since I was in high school, nearly 40 years ago. Unfortunately, I had to move from San Francisco during some of those years, and the search for a pizza in other towns and states for the same incredible sauce, crust, sausage and overall perfection was like finding water in a desert - impossible. To this day, I still travel to San Francisco for Pasquale's Pizza from Sacramento every chance I get.
author: Dennis G.

description:
My husband and I finally got a break from being in UCSF Childrens hospital and had ordered Pasquales before.  So we thought hey lets just go and have dinner there and it will be like we are on a date.  We show up and there is some big graduation party.  Ok fine no big deal they had plenty of staff and plenty of tables open.  
We got seated a couple of minutes after we walked in .  The waiter put the menus down and walked away.  Ten minutes later he noticed that we had finished looking at the menus and took our order.  In the meantime we watched 2 tables get seated, have water and other beverages within 2 minutes of being seated.  About a half an hour after we ordered our order finally comes up and has a DIRTY pizza spatula.  We give it back and it was like we had made it that way and somehow it was our fault.  
We start eating and it is good but we watch another table get seated and again 2 minutes for beverages and ordering.  We finish drinks and food  and sit there before the waiter comes to see how everything is.  From the beginning we had watched people come in and have drinks and have seen their waitor or waitress several times.  Finally we ask for a bill and a manager.  The manager comes and talks to us and does not seem to care that the utensils were dirty, and that the service was bad.  Fine GIVE US THE DAMN BILL!!!
We get out of there and realize if we like their food then we will order it for delivery but never go in again.  It was a horrible experience so I don't even think we will do that again.  It would have started off ok if the waiter had said hey it might be a few extra minutes because of the party.... but unfortunatly they didn't and plus it shouldn't have because the party already had all of their food and we watched the wait staff standing around talking.  A LITTLE FRUSTRATING!!!
author: Sarah K.

description: chicken alfredo is bomb! yum. calamari is awesome too! good place for big groups. try their pizza!
author: Ame C.

description: No frills italien joint with checkered tablecoths and basic fare.  The italien sausage sandwich with a side of marinara is fantastic.
author: daren w.

description: pretty decent pizza...ppl brought to work potluck today. i think one was veggie, had like spinach, tomatoes, onions. the other was super meaty. it was totally decent pizza. would eat it again, but not in a heartbeat.
author: Jess V.

description: Bad service.  Bad pizza.  There are at least three places within a couple blocks with better pizza.  Totally bland ingredients, and they spoon garlic from a jar onto the pizza to make up for it.  Crust is flavorless.  Seriously, I don't get the other reviews.  Are we talking about the same place?  Pasquale's seems like one of those tourist traps that gets by with bad food simply because they've got a good location.  I don't recommend.
author: James S.

description: one could live on the baked penne with meat sauce and mozzarella and the baked penne with meat sauce and mozzarella alone.
author: Jessica L.

description: wow! a great pizza delivery, at 1 am how can you go wrong with a thin crust pie? just make sure you know joe and he will take care of you... and this is strictly a pizza place make sure it's just pizza you're getting and nothing else and ask for thin crust and crispy its going to come out perfect if you're sober or drunk wink wink .
author: Chris D.

description:
ok, this place has the best pie in SF by far. the blend of cheese, and the quality that goes into this is unparalleled. 

they will spin your za extra thin if you like. Bot the Irving location and the carryout on sloat are superb. 

just do it.
author: Johnny C.

description: good old family pizza night! it is exactly what a pizza place is supposed to be. good pizza, checked table cloths, nice nice nice waitress. it isn't the best pizza ever but it is good.
author: Deva G.

description: ya... i'll say it. this is arguably the best pizza in san fran. for those of you who do not eat the crust... you are wasteful people. furthermore.. obviously you must not have tried pasquale's crust yet. it's crispy, yet soft. the way it should be. ya.. this place can be hit or miss. even when it misses, it aint half bad. but when it hits.. it's like having GLORIOUS pizza in ny (peep the review on grimaldis in brooklyn). pasquales.. i love you
author: geoffrey l.

description: I've been going here for years and it's awesome for what it is.  There's not much of an atmosphere, but it's homey, super inexpensive if you order the right things, the portions are hearty, and it's tasty.  They also do free delivery without a minimum purchase.  I usually get the meatball sandwich for $6.25.  It's huge and comes with a side salad or fries (I get the salad, the fries aren't too great).  Lots of cheese, sauce is good, big meatballs, and the bread is soft and doughy.  My wife usually gets the lasagna, which is also pretty awesome.  It's two full meals worth of food for her.
author: Ryan D.

description:
Ever since I moved to San Francisco, I felt privileged to have learned about Pasquale's on Irving St. However, after 1 attempt at eating OVERLY DRESSED CAESAR SALAD and voicing my complaint to the manager ( who quite apologetically bought my husband I a CAESAR SALAD for our next delivery and revealed that someone else that week had also complained of a sopping wet salad), we then tried it again, but were even MORE DISAPPOINTED!  I will admit that it wasn't drenched in dressing, and was quite good ( it seemed obvious that careful consideration was given to the preparation this time, but as I stabbed my fork into a piece of lettuce thus revealing a LARGE, RAW PIECE OF SQUID in my container, I almost lost my entire meal all over myself. It was TRULY HORRIFYING and just SOOO UNEXPECTED! I then composed myself and called the manager, "JOE", who said he was sorry and would "look into it", even after I assured him that I would most-likely NOT be eating there ever again. He didn't say he would contact me or try to take my number or really even seem affected at all by my experience in any way... He couldn't wait to get me off the phone and I felt like more of a waste of his time than a valued, consistent customer for over 5 years... I wasn't asking for anything other than some consolation and also to inform him of what had occured...What a nightmare... I am not one to complain but have also worked in the restaurant industry as I am a chef and restaurant manager... I can understand mistakes, but 2 times in a row, is in my book, a very poor excuse for "customer satisfaction". A a result of this drama, I will NEVER eat there again nor see calamari without feeling utterly ill... What a shame!!
ps... the pizza was cold, too:-(
author: Britt L.

description: we've been coming here ever since we were wee ones. i think it may have survived a fire back in the 80s? anyway. still my favorite pizza of all time. thin crust, not too soggy, just the right amount of cheesy gooey goodness! the service is a little slow, so don't wait until you're hungry and your stomach is about to eat itself (don't dwell on this). parking is kinda crazy on irving, and when i say crazy, i mean that parking is near non-existent unless you're lucky! haven't tried anything else but the pizza here since i'm a creature of habit-- but i've seen ppl order other stuff and they are always smiling, so it must be good.
author: Lori J.

description: best pizza in SF hands down~although I wish so much that they delivered around soma
author: L V.

description: The pizza is great and reasonably priced and the antipasto salad is also a good option.
author: Karen H.

description: good pizza, especially like the veggie.  they're always fast and quality.  just watch out for sogginess after a while of sitting in the cardboard delivery box.  I order from them all the time.
author: Chase N.

description: i've never eaten in the restaurant, but i've had their pizza delivered.  it's *much* better than domino's, and the sauce in particular is quite tangy and zesty.  however, while the pizza is good, it's nothing amazing.  one point of irritation is that they always claim to be out of parmesan and hot pepper flakes, and i like my condiments!!
author: Roshni R.

description: Ever since hearing acquaintances and friends rave about Pasquale's, I've been eager to check out this pizza joint in the Sunset.  I've been told that this is the place to have pizza when you're in the Inner Sunset and that its even better than Giorgio's in the Richmond.  So when I went to Pasquale's today with a group of friends, I thought I'd be in for a real treat.  Wrong!  First off, I was shocked by the prices: small pizza is about $11, basic cheese, medium is $14 and so on.  If you want to do half and half, the pricing is different and is based on what each half is comprised of, which seemed a little strange to me.   We ordered three extra-large pizzas which was more than enough food for tweleve people...ended up having about one pizza's worth leftover.  The pizza arrived to our table piping hot, the crust was thin and cripsy, and the cheese melting off in strings.  In the taste department, it was all right.  Just all right.  The sauce seemed a little bland, like it could have used some more oregano, basil, or anything to give it more flavor.  What got me were the puddles (read that: puddles!) of orange oil sitting on each slice of pizza.  I am not a health freak by any means, but oil was literally dripping off the slice when I pulled it from the pan.  I had to take two napkins to blot off the slice before it was eatable.  I noticed others doing the same thing.  Service was all right...the waiter came to check on us occassionally but more or less stayed away.
author: Swirls L.

description: consistently good pizza, if you like the thin, crunchy crust type. definitely not made in a chicago style. try the spinach, tomato, garlic, and pesto pizza. yummmm :). not the friendlist waitstaff in the world, but the pizza makes up for it.
author: monkey l.

description: great tomato sauce and big portions.  better than domino's or pizza hut.
author: Amy Z.

description: The best thing to eat here is a XL thin crust cheese pizza, I just had one and it was awesome the cheese is yummy. There burger is also good but there spaghetti and meatballs kind of bland. Stick to ordering it's name sake... pizza, oh wait I lied I tried to baked tortellini and that was pretty good.
author: Rachael M.

description: This place was so much fun.  I came here for a late lunch/early dinner with 2 girlfriends.  We were HUNGRY.  Pasquale's didn't disappoint.  First off, the bread is really delicious, and served warm.  I ordered the vegetarian lasagna, which was huge.  The only bad thing was that the edges were hot, but the center not as much.  I don't like that.  One of my girlfriends ordered the fried calamari sandwich, which was HUGE too.  She ate the calamari, but left the bread.  My other friend ordered the 1/2 spaghetti and 1/2 ravioli with meat sauce and meat balls.  It also was HUGE.  Leftovers a plenty.  So, this was awesome:  our server was too damn funny.  She was super friendly and had that "smoker's deep voice".  She told us "3 pretty girls" that there was a table of "3 cute guys" nearby, and that we should meet each other.  Hmmm, a match making server/ restaurant?  Also, we heard her yell at the cook in the back about him forgetting to put something "on the side."  She kept it real.  When she took my friend's plate away, she noticed that she didn't touch her salad.  She asked her, "Honey, do you wanna take this salad home?"  When my friend said no, she asked the rest of us, "Do you want her salad?"  We declined.  At least she cared about our health and wanted to make sure we got our moneys worth.  To end the meal, she told us what they have for dessert, and they have "It's It" ice cream.  Prior to this, I had never heard of this amazing desert.  My friends quickly filled me in.  They had 3 flavors, including spumoni (wow).  Well, maybe I'm totally rambling in this review...  anyhow, overall, this was a lot of fun.  The food was okay, but the service was fun.  And hell, they have It's Its!
author: Sarah F.

description:
I've gone to this pizzeria before. It's been wonderful in the past but this time around I'm starting to rethink twice before setting foot in here again. Since I  still love the food I decided not to talk to the owner of the rude service I received by a waitress that merely stuck us in corner and ignored us for the remainder of the night. Two other tables were seated before us and got their pizza first. The waitress (curly haired chick with glasses) didn't bother taking our order until fifteen minutes later. We received our drinks about 20 min later, didn't get an appetizer until much later and noticed that other people had already enjoyed their food by the time we got ours, and we were there before any of them. On top of that, when we did get our pizza I noticed that the cheese was coming right off, which can only draw me to one conclusion; she forgot to put our order in and they made a fast, sloppy pizza to try to cover up her mistake. 

Don't get me wrong, the food has been and will  always be excellent. The service sucked (at least this time around). Beware when they stick you  in a corner because more than likely you'll be ignored.
author: Alicia A.

description: it's casual, old and still serves the same good pizza just like back in the old days of the 70's.  we always order a pizza and antipasti.   the only change i noticed is the antipasto...it looks like the cook just slapped the cheese, cheap olives, tomatoes, peperoncini's, on top a big bed of lettuce.  back in the old days it can be a hearty meal on its own with more stuff and nicely presented.   the pizza crust is hand tossed, it's tasty, not soggy, a bit crunchy.
author: Kui T.

description: The pizza at pasquale's was great. Full of flavor and a genuine italian crust. We ordered the seafood pizza. It was every bit as good as the waiter said it would be. The only downside to the whole visit is that there were flies flying all over the place and was very annoying. If you are in the neighborhood, go for it. I saw some of their other dishes go by. They looked pretty good.
author: R R.

description: Called Pasquale's on Irving Street for a pizza delivery.  I wanted to order a pizza with half mushroom and olives and the other half with ham and pineapple and they wanted to charge for four toppings!  Outrageous!!!  Most pizza places would still consider it two toppings since that's really what is going across the top of the pizza.  I then said to just make it with the mushrooms and ham which would be considered two toppings.  When the pizza arrived, it was luke warm and the pizza had mushrooms all over it with half ham!  My husband HATES mushrooms.  Well I called them back and the person who took the order said I ordered all mushrooms and half ham which I would never do since my husband hates mushrooms.  Anyways he offered to make a small pizza with just ham and I was fine with that.  My husband then said he doesn't want it thinking they'll spit in his pizza so I called them back to cancel the small ham pizza they were going to send over.  Now I'm stuck ordering another damn pizza from a different pizza place becuz of the mistake they made.  I've been a long time customer for many years, but that is going to end as of today.  On top of that, my pizza was burnt all across the bottom so every bite tasted horrible.  What a waste of money.  Not going to order from here again.   Go to Giorgio's instead if you want good pizza and service.  We didn't order from them today only due to them not delivering during the lunch hour (they don't start delivery till 5:00 p.m.).
author: Kiki W.

description: The pizza here is great and I love cheesy garlic bread.  Needless to say, so do my kids.   Enough said!
author: Annette D.

description: The pizza is pretty tasty but a little overpriced in my opinion.  If you are new to the inner sunset and looking for a good pizza, walk around the corner and check out Milanos.  Pasquales does offer many other food options, and unlike Milanos they accept credit cards, but the food just isn't as good.
author: Steve O.

description: By far, my favorite of all pizzas created is the Pasquale's House Special.  I have tried other pizzas they have and if you are unimpressed I can see why. Nothing can beat or touch the house special.  Maybe it is becuase this is the pizza I have been eating since I was about 10 but 24 years later it is still the same and still good.Get the house special you wont be......you can't be disappointed.
author: Tim L.

description:
Ok, I want to start by saying that I love Pasquale's Pizza, and have ordered from them many times throughout the last two years, well until recently.  I'm sorry I just can't deal with their horrible phone service/manners anymore. I'm sick of calling and having someone half ass mumble something and then CLICK I'm on hold without even being allowed to say one syllable.  I understand about being busy ( I ran a busy coffee house in downtown SF that had a line out the door every morning). But there is never an excuse for bad service whether over the phone or in person. Also when I finally do get to talk to someone, as I'm placing my order they keep interrupting with "Anything else...? Anything else...? "  Geez let me finish my order!!!
I live literally across the street. Sometimes when I have hung up with them out of frustration, I have walked by and there are like 5 people milling around in service area - why isn't anyone concentrating on the customer service?
I love there pizza, pasta, and sandwiches and I don't mean for this review to be a whiney message but hoping that it serves as constructive criticism for management. Hell I even dare management to call their own shop and try and place a phone order so they can see what it's like.
author: Adrian M.

description: i have been going to pasquales since we moved to the nieghborhood in 1957. it is simply the best pizza i have ever had. i have sampled pizza in all the well known pizza cities-chicago, new york, new jersy, even rome. nothing compares to a thin crust cheese pizza from pasquales. a few years ago purly by accident i purchased a thin crust pepporoni / salami / garlic pizza. this is the greatest taste sensation you will ever have, there is nothing like the olive oil running down your elbow as you fold that slice and take your first BITE  we live out of town now and go there whenever we are in town. parking is easy to find and the staff there is friendly and attentive. for an "old school" real pizzeria experience you can not beat pasquales.
author: ROY M.

description: I am from New York and have lived in the SF area for almost 20 years and have never found a pizza that could compare to home...until now!  Pasquale's is the best pizza around.  It is made with all fresh ingredients and the staff is wonderful!  Joe, the manager, is friendly and he makes you feel like you are family when you walk through the door!  I am so happy to have found this gem in San Francisco!!
author: Vicki M.

description: Best pizza in SF. Probably my favorite in the entire world.
author: Daniel K.

description: Was here a few months ago and the waitress really ignored me and my wife and I was feeling kind of pissed about it but the waittress, Marie, took a deep breath and really apologized about her performance.  I guess a bad day and she even gave me a complementary beer just to make things up.  I like the crew here and the pizzas are really good and the other dishes are served old style.....big portions at good prices.  We just came back, the food is just as good as before, Marie remembered us and gave us really good service.  Great family place!
author: albert c.

description: i adore pasquale's pizza. and that's about it. not a fan of their pasta and other dishes, and i certainly do not enjoy dining at the restaurant. however, i do think their pizza is one of the best in the city. i'm pretty picky about pizza crusts and theirs is perfect for me - not too thick or doughy, but not to thin and crispy.
author: Leesee A.
